reviews.review:
First time here...has a Yard House feel to it but different twist...

Ordered the bread basket and it was delish but wished it was unlimited...

The sushi menu is eclectic and overpriced (way better sushi places in town) so definitely don't recommend that side of the menu to splurge on.

Now the ribeye and scallops were delicious...especially the ribeye prepared with the chili molasses glaze...2 thumbs up!

Would come back here again to enjoy and hang out with friends in such a nice atmosphere! :-)
My husband took me to "Crave" in beautiful Downtown Summerlin for my birthday last week.

I ordered one of the sushi boats, and the sushi tasted like supermarket sushi. The boat itself was $26. They were probably one of the worst tasting sushi I've had in my entire life..... Fish was far from fresh, and the rice was definitely not sushi rice. My boyfriend liked their ribeye steak though so that was fine. Service was great. Just avoid their sushi at all cost....

First of all great environment inside and out. I ordered a Bento box sushi whatever their premium box was called. The sushi roll that came with it was crap. I asked the waiter if I got the right role since he recommended it. As it turned out, he never had it. Just recommending things on the menu that he has no clue about. Learn the f**kn menu and what's on the menu. Could've done better with a hamburger or something else that looks OK on their menu. Definitely stay away from sushi at this place. I also ordered the wings which were gigantic, but in the end average. I would probably give it a second chance if someone wanted to go there however I wouldn't go there myself again.

The setting is nice, waitress, Erica, was really nice. We ordered the sweet peach tea, wasn't impressed. The crab artichoke dip was ok. The roasted chicken breast was very dry and flavorless, I couldn't even finish it. The mahi mahi was flavorless and was not finished. Will never go back or recommend. Worst place I have eaten at in a long time. Wasted $70.

Place was a joke salad wilted pizza cold and soggy tempura carrots cold and soggy really bad food all the way around.I asked for a glass of water the waiter dropped it off in a hurry.When he came back I asked for a straw he said they don't give straws with water unless you request so he would have to go get one really bad! So many things wrong with this place.60.00$ for lunch for me and my wife and 6year old grandson no alcohol.Will never go back

I came here during happy hour, so I cannot comment on their regular menu. Most of everything I ordered was below average to average. 

I personally love California rolls, and it was my fave out of all the HH food items we ordered. They serve Tenaya Brewery beer on tap, and had some good stuff during HH.

I walked away however, feeling that I am okay never coming back. At least for the food.

we visited Crave for the first time today.  The establishment was nice with modern decor and very clean.  The service was excellent, our waiter was very attentive and answered all of our questions.  Our food selections were not so great however.  We started with the edamame appetizer, it was boring no and bland.  Our son had a flatbread pepperoni pizza that looked good and he enjoyed but the side selections were no good.  I had the pork butt Rueben, didn't like it at all.  Just slices of fat with slaw, should have guessed that though.  My husband had the miso salmon.  He said it was bland and flavorless, where was the miso glaze?  Would maybe give it a second chance sometime.

Thank you, CRAVE for making our Valentine's Day perfect! The restaurant's appearance was very upscale, clean and classy. The whole atmosphere was sophisticated. Beautiful hostesses waiting to greet you, awesome waiters, and delicious food! My husband and I had the Valentine's Pre Fixe Menu for two. All I can say is,"Mmmm"... Completely satisfied with everything from the appetizers down to the dessert! My daughter ordered the bamboo bites (sushi) and crab cakes, both exceeded our expectations. We were really impressed to see how well the whole staff seemed to operate on such a busy night. Shout out, to our waiter Victor, for the excellent service!

All of the staff was very cold and unfriendly from the hostess to the server.  You do not feel welcome at all and almost like you being there is putting them out.

We asked to sit outside, but they only had tables in the sun.  We took the sunny table but after about 20 minutes it was just too hot.  We saw the hostess setting up more tables outside in the shade and asked if we could move.  She just said no she was setting these up for another party but did not offer to move us inside or elsewhere.  A couple minutes later her, and who I think was the manager, were setting up chairs for the tables and we we asked if we could just move inside then.  We were told yeah give us a minute.  So they proceeded to both push in chairs and get everything ready for the guests who hadn't arrived yet instead of relocating the guests who were already there and sweltering in the sun.  It seems like one of them could have handled pushing in the chairs and the other could have re-seated us.  

Once we were eventually moved and received our food nobody ever came by to check on us or refill our drinks, which were both empty.  After we had finished eating and our drinks were still empty the server finally came around, but by that point we were just ready to go.

I can deal with bad service if the food is good, but that was not the case.  I ordered a flatbread pizza and it barely had any cheese on it.  Maybe 40% was covered in cheese.  Most of my bites were just the flatbread with tomato sauce.  All of the entrees were way overpriced too.

The whole vibe in this restaurant was just bad.  We couldn't wait to get out of there.  I will not be giving this place another try.

The service was fine but the food was on a fast food level.  The sushi looked and tasted old.  Fries were soggy. There are just way too many great restaurants in Vegas to even think about ever going back. Disappointing.

No wait on a Friday night... Noise level is loud.  Sushi was ok had the Hamachi, Salmon and Rainbow roll.  Soy Sauce was very salty (more than most).  My daughter had the Bison Burger w/ Fries.  Said it was good but not great.  My son had the chicken and veggies off the kids menu.  Chicken was very dry and the broccoli was hard as a rock.  Prices were fair but I have to say I was not impressed.  Our server was very nice and on top of drink refills.  I guess I was expecting more and it was just average...

The food is amazing here. We ordered a Duck Confit Flatbread, which had jam spread, greens, cheese. The Scallops were nicely seasoned and browned, over a bed of butternut squash rissotto. The scallop poppers were from the sushi menu, its a ball of rice, wrapped in raw salmon, and topped with scallop chunks in the middle. 

They have happy hour during the week only. We ordered a White Sangria and a Sparkling Cranberry. They were both very delicious but i felt disappointed because i think they drink sizes were too small. 

There is indoor and outdoor seating, the outdoor seating has both tables and lounge chairs and couches.

I felt that our server was not very knowledgeable. She would admit she hasn't tasted all the menu items, and then she would recommend drinks, we'd how that drink tasted and then she'd say again she's never tried it.

I have been here several times, mostly because of the variety of the menu and we have never had to wait for a table. The food is pretty good but I think overpriced. The service is usually slow and I am always confused about the decor. Not too sure what they are going for with the applebee's style tables/chairs, carpeting, and curtains in all the corners. Feels very dated. I would expect a little bit nicer atmosphere for the cost to dine there. Overall we will probably keep coming back because it's an easy place with lots of choices for everyone.

I really really enjoyed it. I do have to say the regular menu is pretty pricey but the food was well worth it! We went during happy hour and everything sounded so appetizing.

Our waiter DeAndre was so nice and welcoming. He even gave us a little Japanese history when he gave us hot towels to wipe our hands. I like the atmosphere and I love the location! Overall it's worth it during happy hour!

5 stars! Dakota was very prompt in seating me at a great booth and she was so kind. For once a hostess who actually seemed like she genuinely wanted us there! Our server Jordan was very informative and had excellent recommendations. I had a lunch combination with the crave salad and a half BLT. So good! My friend had the bison burger. We shared the Mexican roll and were absolutely blown away. We will be back again very soon!

I ordered the Roasted Chicken, and it was unappetizing. The sauce was too sour or bitter. It had a hint of BBQ and soy sauce. The taste was just weird. The taste was confusing. The fried plantain tasted like soap. I would NOT recommend this place.

These guys are lost.  Whoever trained this staff needs to be trained themselves.   We stood out front of hostess desk and told three people our name and reservation time.  3 different times they asked who we were.   At 715, 20 minutes later the ask a 4th time and say "ohh we have been waiting on you". I said we have been standing here for 25 minutes.   She replies. "Did u get lost, the place is hard to find".  I looked at her and said her and said ...I just told you we have been here 25  minutes.    OMG.   Ok now at dinner.   Ran out of kids cups crayons.    40 minutes now no salad.    Salads now have come but mine is missing.  I'm not going to say anything cause I want the torture to end    I should also state.   They are not even busy.       It's a thur night   Here is the deal.  I lived here for 20
Years.  If this place near strip it may survive. But up in Summerlin. I give it 18 months and their gone.      Food was average

Loud, Service sucked.  Waiter should have paid more attention to our food than trying to play nice guy. 
I asked for my salad to be served before main course and still have to wait after asking twice.  Of course half way through eating it down comes my dinner.  
Let's talk about that. Had the chefs special steak and while it didn't taste bad it's was one step above cold. The Brussels sprouts were cold and hard, mashed potatoes tasted like they came out of a box
Now let's top of the fact the server while I was still eating plops down to the others sitting at the table this "sign up for points card" DUDE IM STILL FREAKING EATING HERE! Next he was plopping down the check.  AGAIN IM STILL EATING MY DINNER WHY THE HELL ARE YOU RUSHING US.  
Oh wait, now that you closed out the check did you even offer desert? 
I so can't wait for the rest of the mall restaurants to open cause business will drop there with service and food served this way

This is the 3rd time we've been here (closer to 10 if you count the times I've been to the one in Cincy), and the service/food just keeps getting worse.

Today, we had the jumbo shrimp for an appetizer. Mike had steak sliders, and I ordered the bison burger. 

First, they didn't even get Mike's coke right. The shrimp was pretty good, but it took a while for a starter. 

The chef spent most of his time chatting with his friends at the next table about a party at Brooklyn Bowl. 

When our entrees (finally) arrived, I took a few bites. The second bite was a mouthful of chewy undercooked pork fat. I was done. I searched for our server, but since the chef was at the next table, I told him to send the server over, because I was done. 

When the server took the burger away, I told him the pork belly was raw. The chef said, "let me see that" under his breath. 

I'm sure he was going to say it was fine. He probably doesn't realize that Crave isn't the only place in Vegas that serves pork belly. 

The manager came over and apologized for the burger, and said she took it off the bill. I told her, "of course you did, I didn't eat it."  

The management, should work on their service standards and service recovery, because there are literally thousands of restaurants in Vegas.

After having the worst experience at public house upstairs or school whatever it's called we choose this place out of default. But, I am so happy we did! We had a server named Maggie I think which every sweet and full of jokes. We loved her! Gave us recommendations to our foods and drinks. Explained I wanted a mojito but I can't have pineapple (which is what they have on their menu) and she said no problem, I'll substitute it with a splash or raspberry or regular mojito. She made my day. We had about 5-6 mojitos later... Lol we had to cancel our shopping and walk it off a little. The food was delish! Sliders, truffle fries and sushi was A1! Thanks so much for your wonderful service. It was a litttttttle pricey, but I suppose if you want good food with great service ya gotta pay for it. Lol

I have been to Crave on many occasions. I have never had a bad experience. Whether I was eating dinner at a table or hanging out by the bar for happy hour. Beautiful facility, great food and drinks. Highly recommend.

It's hard to say... Haven't decided on the ratings yet, I guess I'll determine that at the end of my review.... Well two times I have been there and both experiences have had issues. I usually Pay attention to my surroundings with what can be taking so long or what can be possible on why it's been so long on waiting for pretty much everything. With that being said the manager is great, checks up on you a few times to make sure everything is ok, the standards with the waiters and waitresses are there, but what causes me to be there for an extensive amount of time? Two words, -Understaffed - (wait is that one word or two) haha! You get the picture! But yes service lacks with being understaffed even when it's not busy. But you know lets put that aside. The food is great here for what it is. The 702 burger is a hit. The truffle fries for sure. Chips and guacamole, yup! And the crispy pot stickers are great. The half off wine is what keeps me coming back, you take that away then there is no way I'll be back. So I guess it gives you plenty of time to Drink the bottle  but you know I see what the situation might be with the waiters and waitresses, and I always take care of them real good because I know they are short staffed. If I'm wrong I want my $20.00 back ! Jordan thanks for the service!
If you know ANYTHING about food, don't eat here. The food is mediocre at best. Service is great though.

We had tried Crave when it first opened and felt it was nothing really special. We went back for a date night based on their signage outside offering a date night special! It consisted of 2 appetizers and 2 entrees (from a choice of 5 or so) 2 small desserts and a bottle of wine for $50! It was a great deal and great food as well! The portions were perfect and enough that we took home some for lunch the next day! Nicholas was a great server and appeared to be happy at what he was doing! We will definitely do that again!

After having dined at CRAVE several times, I feel like I have enough info to write a review.

The first time I went to CRAVE was at the soft opening months ago. I thought the restaurant had great ambiance and being able to try several items on the menu gave me a prespective of the type of food CRAVE offers. The items we tried were hit or miss, but overall I got a good feeling from the food we tried and knew we would be back.

We came back probably a month or so after and I ordered the Lamb Meatballs which is a Signature Dish at crave. It was AWFUL and I do not use that word often to describe food. The pasta portion of the dish was fine but the Meatballs were extraordinarily bland and did not taste fresh. I would not be surprised if they used frozen meatballs. My mother-in-law also had to send her dish back because the lobster tasted awful.

I came back last night with a livingsocial coupon and because opentable was giving 1,000 dining points. I actually was pleasantly surprised with my meal. I ordered the edamame starter which at $8 was definitely not worth it, but tasted fine. I ordered the chicken apple sausage flat-bread and a couscous salad as a side. The salad came out first and it was great. The dressing was very refreshing. The flat bread next came out and it was amazing! The mix of flavors between the sausage, bell pepper, and balsamic vinaigrette was unique and blended together well. It was around $16 which is a little over-priced but I would order it again. My husband just got a burger and fries and it was the perfect medium rare, very juicy and he was a happy guy! I also thought the service was great.

Overall, food is VERY hit or miss. Additionally, the food is generally not worth the prices. It appears there is a happy hour menu, which might be a better deal, but I have not tried.

Service is just ok. I have had terrible service there, but last night it was great. Jury is out on that.

Ambiance is great. Beautiful restaurant in a great location. Food is average and not worth the price.

I picked Crave for Mother's Day for my wife because my daughter and I absolutely loved it when we ate there a few weeks ago.
I figured it would be busy being it will be Mother's Day so I made reservations.  There was a slight wait when we got there but no big deal.  Our waitress walked by and stopped with a stern look and said, "I'll be back!"  Who are you, the effing Terminator."?
Anyway she came back to take our drink order.  My wife wanted a cappuccino but couldn't find it on the menu and our kind waitress said, "Oh it's not on the menu."  Helpful, but doesn't tell us what other drinks you may have.  At this point, I'm starting to notice food boogers all over the silverware and asked for a cleaner option but spoke too soon.  The water glasses had stuff chunked on the sides as well and once we finished the appetizer, there was some pasty/dry/cheesy crap now smeared across the table which was nothing of the likes of what we ordered.  This apparently is on the bottom of the disgusting plate.
Since our dining experience is not quite going as expected, we begin discussing places we should have gone.  I was thinking to myself, are we really discussing my shortcomings of picking a suitable restaurant for Mother's Day?  Wow, now I feel like an ass!  I felt even more like an ass when the food came out.  Not sure who the broad was that brought out the food but she had no clue what she was doing nor could identify anything on the plates.  No worries, here comes our friendly neighborhood waitress that's been such a joy.  Everyone finally got what they ordered however the food was cold.  My daughter got the Crave Burger.  I'm assuming the buns are not fresh because when I say cold, I mean you could have reduced swelling of an injury with her hamburger.  Both my wife's food and mine were also below room temp.  This was the straw that broke the camels back.  Check please!

My daughter and I were excited to take my wife here for Mother's Day.  Now we're going to one of the places we discussed while waiting for our food.  Sorry Crave, won't be back...ever.

Pretty sure the days are numbered here. Went in right after the parade, which was packed with people, and told a 25 minute wait for a nearly empty restaurant. Hmmm.... that should have been our first clue. Ok....we are slow learners!! The hostess said most of the servers were a no show. Probably because they were not making any money. Anyway, we waited and ate. Food was OK, but would have been better if the food wasn't sitting under a barely working heat lamp, forever, because the service is awful!! And I mean AWFUL!! I did give it an extra star because kids eat free and I love free!! I do like the atmosphere, so I hope another restaurant moves in when this one closes.

Had the Crave Burger, it was very tasty, meat was cooked as ordered. The customer service was not good. I asked twice for utensils as my dad had ordered pasta. I ended up and just getting my table's own utensils from another adjacent table. We weren't going to sit there while the food got cold while waiting for utensils. No one stopped me to offer service or replace the utensil sets i just took. It is also very loud. 

I think the concept is great where you can get anything, even sushi here all in one location, but If customer service continues to stink, folks are better off going to sushi loca and 5 guys across the mall.

Tried 4 different flatbreads, 3 sushi, lobster linguini, meat balls, 3 different beers, cocktails, and white wine, nothing is good. The only thing that is fine is the chicken flatbread. 
The server, Darius, is attentive and friendly while others are not.
Will not come back unless I take my puppy here to enjoy their patio and open air.
Breanna was great. Food just ok. If you want sushi, not really that great. Expensive. Big place. Calamari was good. Veggie sushi platter good.
This place has something for everyone and after a few trips of trying different things I have yet to be disappointed.  They even have vegetarian sushi, which my wife is a big fan of.

Great place to come for the variety of foods! This place is a good place to come for large groups because everyone can have what they want. I had the raspberry lemonade cocktail and it was great, not a bad drink menu Crave! The filet with crab meat on top was awesome,  I would recommend it to anyone who enjoys a light surf n turf with a cream sauce.
I was actually impressed with this place. They had delicious cocktails and a decent happy hour selection for food. I could see myself coming back.

This is the 2nd time my husband and I are here.  Because of our first time here, we ordered conservatively. We ordered the chicken wings and the chicken pandoori sandwich and split.  Most of the sliced apples were on one side of the sandwich along with most of the chicken. It tasted good but had too much sauce. The French fries were terrible!  They need to have good oil or fresh oil for the fries to taste good. The manager needs to step it up with his quality control. This would be a great place if they were more attentive to the food that was served.

No. No no no. I am so disappointed!! I don't know what I'm more disappointed with! The service- 15min waiting to be acknowledged after we sat down... Or the fact that my jambalaya tasted like someone poured an entire bottle of tabasco in the sauce!! I love spicy food... But give me a break!! I was expecting Cajun seasonings. The smell of the sauce literally was burning the inside of my nose. 4 bites in and I thought I was gonna be sick. I pushed my food away because the smell of vinegar was too much.

When our server finally decided to take out plates away, he noticed that I barely touched my food. I proceeded to tell him that the smell and taste of Tabasco was just way too much and really gross and make me sick to my stomach. His only response to me was "maybe you would like to order some desserts to get the taste out of your mouth" ARE YOU SERIOUS!?!  No apology.. No getting the manager. I tried to wave a manager down, but I was ignored. 

Don't waste your time. Don't waste your money. If you value your precious daily calorie intake.. Go to shake shack

The atmosphere vibe and service are amazing.
The bread basket is very tasty.

I orders the BLT....really very good.

I love the place and will definitely be back.

My husband and I went to crave after receiving a coupon for by 1 entree get 1 free. We had a reservation and were sat right away. The reservation didn't seem necessary even though it was Sunday lunch time. Our server was nice and attentive. We ordered Salmon Sashimi which was ok. Then our entrees came out. I had steak sliders that was beyond boring in flavor. It was so bland that I could hardly make out anything I was eating and my fries looked old and also was lacking in flavor. My husband had the Steak, he asked for medium cooked but all we could taste was burnt meat, it was tasteless even after asking for a1 sauce. I was glad we had that coupon since paying for a disappointing meal is never a good time. We won't be going back.

I have been to CRAVE about a half dozen times.  The ambiance is upscale yet comfortable.  The service is always impeccable and the menu has a wide variety for all tastes.  The sushi is very fresh and well done but the offerings are limited. Most of the items either have a deep fried component or spicy mayo, so you might choose another option if those aren't your taste.  The steaks are excellent.  I tried the beef stroganoff most recently and it was good but not great.

New concept of having American and Japanese food fare.  Dishes looking appetizing, but the taste are just average.  Service is off balance.  Not sure if it is due to new opening or volume of folks being served.

Came here tonight for a company dinner party , and too put it nicely it was nothing special , their menu is very random from sushi to burgers to pasta . I ordered the rainbow roll and the fish was okay again nothing amazing very similar to sushi from a grocery store and for the price defiantly not worth it I also ordered the albacore nigiri and that was a huge disappointment, a coworker ordered the Godzilla roll it was so big and tasteless too much work for a blain roll , onto the burgers the bison burger was served literally burnt and the fries were over salted ,the lobster linguini was flavored good  but for the price you get 1 1/2 claw very tiny  and a very small portion of pasta that was undercooked lastly another coworker ordered the gluten free chicken salad (a plus this place has a gluten free menu) so you really couldn't go wrong with lettuce , we also had to constantly ask for refills mind you our group was only 9 people very disappointed . It's such a great location and very nice place itself but the food just isn't up to par

I will never go back again! My husband and I went there for the 1st time; needless to say, we were starving. The hostess sat us down and nobody showed up to take our orders. We literally sat at our table for 12 minutes w/o any service. We walked out, but before leaving we stopped at the hostess stand. We politely told them why we were leaving. They stared at us blankly without remorse, and did not even try to stop us.

We normally come here and are usually happy with the service. Tonight our bartender was busy so we asked William if we could get ramekins and soy sauce for our sushi. He said yes. William had the GALL to sit next to us with his friends, drink a shot and never told our bartender that we needed the ramekins and soy sauce or get them for us. William represents CRAVE, he was still wearing his CRAVE uniform when he sat down with his VIP friends and drank that shot. Apparently it doesn't count if you regularly go to CRAVE, only if you're friends of William does it matter. I hope William's friends come as often as we did. Or maybe we should befriend William, I think NOT!!!

Good selection , sushi was ok..
Soup and Turkey Blt was good.
Most likely will come back again !
Atmosphere was fun , clean and no wait

This place needs some serious help. First off the girls at the front were quoting waits despite that tons of tables were open all over the restaurant. They informed us that we could sit at the sushi bar with no wait so we sat immediately. Our server was quick with greeting and very friendly so she was absolutely not the issue with this train wreck. So here it goes first off the wine glasses weren't polished so they had water spots all over, balsamic chicken salad was mediocre and full of leaves with huge hard stems, servers seemed to be standing around hanging out and not one moved aside to give me the right away when I walked through, they had an entire section being used to polish silverware out in the dining room, managers seemed to not care about what was going on, oh and there was no seat covers in the bathroom. 
So disappointed, I should've just grabbed a pretzel.

This place is another sad case of a confused restaurant who, in trying too hard to be innovative and sexy with flavor pairings, and trying to catch all the food trends, has achieved nothing but mediocrity. Not to mention that for the same prices I can get the real gourmet version of what they are trying to do at a strip restaurant. My Mahi Mahi was over cooked , and had a bizzare banana and curry sauce. The sushi roll we had was edible...if you are the type that likes American AYCE places. The best thing was the burger, which was ok, but for $17 I expected better grade beef and more interesting bun. The service was good. I liked the waitress but In the end, I don't think I would come back. Too many other better places to spend $100 on dinner for 2.

Great service! Server was friendly, bubbly & attentive; also was knowledge of gluten free menu or any related questions I had about menu items. She offered suggestions of what food to order based on variety of preferences. We split the hummus for an appetizer and absolutely loved it; very unique. Then we got the mahi mahi with a shrimp infused rice & steak kale beet salad for our entrees and were both happy with choices. Only thing I would have liked was more emphasis on the beets in the salad, but I still enjoyed what I got. I Will definitely go back and try it again.

Great service and great food. Had the tiniest issue with a cold dish and the staff fell over themselves to resolve it. The manager and the server were extremely attentive. Great great service I would recommend any day of the week.

This place is always delicious with excellent customer service! It's mine and my fiance's go to spot, for great quality dinner at a very reasonable price! Everyone always seems happy to be there serving us! We've gone multiple times and bring others with us and will continue to... I spent my birthday there last night and requested the booth with the curtains, it was a great night with superb service! I had the best birthday. We love CRAVE! Make sure to try the bamboo bites..

Had dinner here last night and I won't be coming back. The food was mediocre, definitely not worth the prices they charged. $13 for a crab and artichoke dip that was very small and had no visible crab in it.
My friend order the Mac and cheese and I had the special ancho-chili ribeye. She had maybe 6 bites and kept adding salt&pepper to it bc it had no taste. My ribeye was ok, the sauce was very tasty but I enjoy the one at Outback more. 
Our server took about 15-20 minutes to deliver my drink/take our order. Then she returned maybe 2 more times before delivering our check. 
Overall don't bother coming here, it's bad service and mediocre food with a very high price tag.

I have been wanting to try this place since they opened!
Went in with my Sister after catching a movie at the new mall.

Our food was really good! Started with the calamari, it was good, but nothing special.
For dinner, I had the lamb meatballs and fettuccine and it was very tasty. 
Over all the food was fine, but not incredible. In the same price point (our dinner was about $100) you could have something really special. 

What was the highlight of the night was our waitress. She was awesome! Fun, friendly and right on the ball! Which is funny, since most of the lesser reviews here talk about the flawed service here. But that was not our experience at all!

My over all take on this place is it is good, but not great. The price point is a bit high, but I suspect that the rent for this new location is insane. I get it.

Would I go back, sure. Would I suggest it. Maybe.

Very expensive for bland low quality food. We had the lamb meatballs(very dry) and the sea bass (lacking flavor) and also the street tacos( fatty meat). Didn't meet my expectations for the price we paid

I'll admit, based on the reviews, I was apprehensive when my friend suggested Crave before shopping... I was either going to dig it or detest it. Bearing in mind we got there at 11:30, we were ahead of any rush. Nice enough weather to sit outside where they have lots of umbrellas for those who don't enjoy direct sunlight dining. Before moving on, I will say that the hostesses were quite friendly but I hate how they dress! I think there's a red/black dress code- which I'm on board with- but the women (more like girls) looked like they belonged at a club, not a restaurant at a mall in Summerlin in the afternoon. Our waiter was adorable & on his game. We started with the bread assortment with fragrant olive oil... we loved every bite, though they were a tad skimpy on the oil. The tables have salt & pepper grinders but if you're a pepper user, don't use salt because there's a bit in the pepper (we super liked it!). She ordered the chicken breast entree that has a tropical spin (with jasmine rice) & I ordered the steak (with mashed potatoes & heirloom carrots). There was a bit of a panic when the chicken came, because it was on the bone with a wing & skin- my friend doesn't like meat on the bone, chicken wings or skin. Our waiter very apologetically offered to do what he could to make her lunch enjoyable & she settled with a side of the glaze since the glaze was only on the skin she wasn't going to eat. At that point, she liked it but I doubt she'd get it again. My steak was tasty & so were the carrots (either sauteed or lightly roasted). The mashed potatoes had a homemade texture but no butter or sauce/gravy of any sort- I ended up using some of the side of chicken glaze to spruce it up & it worked wonderfully. I'd definitely get my dish again. All in all, I think Crave has potential but a few kinks to work out. I won't rush back but I won't protest if it's suggested.

FOOD POISONING ALERT! 

I gave this place another chance because 4 out of 5 times the service was terrible.
 
I went there this past Saturday and had their yellowtail and seaweed salad and I'm just now feeling better.  I've been puking my guts out and had diarrhea for the 24 hours after eating there.  Either it was the food handler handling my food without washing hands or the fish itself which tasted fine at the time so my guess is improper food handling!!!  Watch out because I'll send the news over to this place and you'll be featured on Dirty Dining!!!! Disgusting!  Just like Firefly you'll be shut down if you continue unsanitary practices.  Restaurants and their employees need to take care an pride in protecting people's health.  I've NEVER got food poisoning before and it felt like the flu but even worse!!!!!!!  Stay away from this dump!!!!

Giving three stars because the service was fantastic. Otherwise would be a two. Michael was our server. He was honest and had a sense of humor which can be an issue in these parts. 
Ordered the jambalaya. Was forewarned there were better items on the menu, but that's why I we stopped in after viewing menu outside. It was more like a salty tomato base with sausage and shrimp and minimal seasoning, lacking in flavor. Dish came out lukewarm with indications of having had a visit in the microwave from the uneven heat around the plate. Fish tacos were good. Coconut jasmine rice good too. Neither out of this world. Average. Had a ginger vodka drink which was decent.

I'd perhaps return for drinks and apps but the menu has an identity crisis and still manages to have nothing that stands out. Basic Americana fare with a sushi kitchen. Not an original idea, but catchy perhaps to some. Will try the other places in Dtwn Summerlin before heading back.

Wow....had the sushi boat with friends. Hiroki is the man that created this masterpiece. There are lots of other goods things to eat too. This place is beautiful.i also had the lettuce wraps. You gotta try this place. The desert and drink menu is top notch.

I have been here twice now not the best place but not bad. 
Ordered wings and was weird how they were cold on one end but hot on the other.
Burgers have been the best thing for the money so far. 
Poke Bowl not worth the money for what you get at all.
Drinks are great though that is a plus. 
Good concept of american and sushi but could be improved on.

I had family visiting from out of town for Spring Break, and we wanted to see a movie at Regal.  Since Crave is one of very few restaurants in Downtown Summerlin that accepts reservations, it was my choice.  It was a beautiful night, and we had a great table on the patio. We were seated promptly at the reserved time, and our service and food were all without a flaw.  I like the varied menu, and the restaurant is very attractive.
Workers were so polite and helpful. My food and my friend's food came out really fast despite the place being busy. Definitely going back here soon~

30 min wait for seating.
1 hour for bread on table. 15 more mins for food.

"Aint nobody got time for that"


The place is a mess right now. Not just us but multiple tables with the hand on face bored looks and wtf is going on faces.

I know it's new but come on. I have been to new places that aren't this messed up.

Hold off on this place for a few months and see if they get their act together.

The food seemed OK but not THAT good.

Gr8 selection of dishes.  Lunch is a bargain w/big servings.  Dinner prices go up for same portions.  Service is good.  I like the salmon, chicken brie sandwich and sushi.  Spacious and beautiful ambience w/nice tables and booths.  Gr8 bar and happy hour.

Randomly chose to try this place after visiting downtown Summerlin and viewing the menu.
The ambiance of the place is fun but without making into a 'club restaurant' and the front end staff was very friendly.  (You can leave your phone number and they'll text you when your table is ready if you want to walk around the shops)

We ordered the truffle fries, the chicken-apple & brie sandwich and baked penne.  The food came out fast and we were happy with how everything came out.  Our waitress was friendly and checked on us a few times to make sure we had everything we needed

We found this place and saw that they offered free meals to kids on certain days so we instantly got attracted to it. Any kid friendly restaurant and advertises for it is a plus for us. 
When we walked in, the hostess was chatting with other guests, the wait was five mins... My husband had to speak to the bar tender to find out if we can just seat ourselves, we actually almost left. After being seated, the server ( petite with orange hair - Saturday shift at 7:30p ) approached to get our drinks and gave our little one his activity stuff. She looked very tired but still attentive, mediocre - not friendly or entertaining, just there to fill a shift. Food came after about 15mins since we wanted it all together. My miso soup was not even warm so I asked to replace with "hot" miso soup. The server seemed very apologetic, (she was very attentive the entire time) and got another one. Whoever the cook was ( cant call that chef ) seemed to just have poured boiling hot water on the soup. It tasted like hot water with a minuscule hint of miso so I returned it after I asked both my son and hubby if they wanted it ( they both said yuck ). 

The rolls we ordered were alright, nothing I will come back too .. The last roll was loose, the cooks lack pride in making them. 
I have tried better and more artistic seaweed salad before. The only good taste was the steak but my hubby ended up with stomach pains and major bathroom breaks after. They need to be wiser in choosing chefs because it can definitely make or break you.   

Restaurant was clean, bathroom had broken seat cover holders.. Seemed like someone yanked it. I love the chandelier in the bathroom though. Place seemed empty for a Saturday. I don't think this place will last unless it is turned around because location is great and there is potential.

First time with my wife. Had happy hour and the Sushi and Kogi Beef Taco are wonderful. Great greeting at the door and wait staff was great. Being they are new they have a lot in training and they all seem very attentive  and professional. Beautiful Resturant.  We will be back. 5 stats guus. Keep up the great job. Will be back for my birthday on the 20th. Looking for a full dinner. Will post how that goes.

The only good thing about this restaurant is their service. Their staff is friendly and well trained. The food is below average.  We ordered their Siracha honey wings... too oily and shy in flavors.  Their food presentation is good but the flavors are subdued and bland in many cases. We ordered their chicked farfalle .. just too bland and extremely unhealthy with lots of butter floating at the bottom. My husband ordered another chicken dish in which the potatoes were cooked inconsistently and the whole dish was bland. 
We wanted to try their desserts but did not CRAVE for any after trying their appetizer and entrees. 

I have marked this restaurant off my list of places to revisit.  They need to make some serious improvement in their food flavors.
Bernaise Burger & Pablano Ceasar IS SO DELICIOUS, HEARTY, RICH .. FLAVORS Are PERFECT!! YUMMM  Marcos our waiter was knowledgeable & recommended the above dishes, which I will have again
Loved it Super awesome Yellowfin Tuna and Hamachi

There are five things that I want to review my opinions upon this restaurant.
1. WELCOME- Hostess was very polite, giving us a 30min. Wait time since this is the only sit down restaurant that's open in downtown summerlin mall.
2. SETTING- Very nice furniture and lighting is amazing. It feels like walking into an Asian infused American restaurant, maroon and red and gold interior, you can tell by it's design that it's been very well thought through.
3. CUSTOMER SERVICE- From the hostess and the waitress, they have been extremely polite, taking our drink orders once we sat and our entree orders as well. Time is a precious matter and no matter how busy they were, they helped us at any chance they get.
4. FOOD- I ordered the aloha sushi roll and it was amazing, it had ginger and a sweet teriyaki sauce that meshed well with the raw tuna, my friend had the "crave burger" and it was cooked just right medium rare, and the French fries had a great seasoning not just plain. 
5. OVERALL REVIEW- Great setting, customer service and food. Definitely coming back.

I've been to Crave several times. They have a huge menu with something for everybody. And the food is really great. However, I have had the worst service every time. The servers are a little scatter brained and have messed up my orders/ forgotten to bring the check and the kitchen took forever to get the food out. It's always been a hot mess. Two and a half hours in a restaurant for a salad and some hummus is just too much. Its a bummer because their food really kept me coming back until I realized that their bad service was the norm and not a fluke. I suggest that you skip this place and go to Public School instead.
Crave in Downtown Summerlin. -awesome service, great ambiance and superb menu selections.  The salmon salad was the best I have ever had.  Jessica you rock!

We were starving and since this was the only restaurant open, we decided to give it a try.
From the moment we walked in, the hostesses were pretty clueless and despite many empty tables, they said there was a 15 minute wait. No problem we said, we will have a drink at the bar. There were three bartenders working, and the tall male bartender directly in front of us wouldn't turn around to ask me if I wanted anything to drink. He was too busy chatting to the other bartenders and slicing his lemons and garnish.  I was practically waiving the menu to get his attention but was unsuccessful. Luckily the hostess came over and said our table was ready. She brought us to a high top table in the bar area which was too small for me and my guest. I asked for a normal table in the restaurant area and she said no problem, but it will be another 10-15 minutes. Ok, I will try to get that pumpkin spice Ale that I was thirsty for. Still unsuccessful in getting the bartenders attention (he is really focused) the hostess comes back and seats us at a booth in the back. On the way, I told her about the problem with the bartender. She just smiled and told me to ask my server for a beverage. She was totally unaccommodating.

The server came and she was great, so no real complaints about her. I did notice however that most of the servers came and went like waves. I mean they would be all over the tables and then they would all disappear for  7-10 minutes at a time. I mean no service staff at all in the restaurant. 

The appetizers came and they were fantastic. It took about an hour for our entrees to make it to the table, steak salad and burger. Steak salad was great, however the french fries on the burger plate were soggy as a sponge. So they were sent back and replaced. When I went to eat the burger, the bottom bun was saturated from grease. In fact, the hamburger was sitting in an oil slick puddle of grease. Pretty gross. The manager came to the table after speaking to our server about the issue after about 10-15 minutes. Seems there were some problems with their Point of Sale system and he was concerned with that issue. He took the burger away and he replaced it with a sandwich which was more of a wrap, and it was tasty. He replaced the replacement fries as well again as they were just as soggy as the first if not more.

The acoustics in the restaurant are not very good either, it is very loud inside. Very much like a sports bar. Good luck having a conversation.

I know this restaurant just opened, but I expected more from them. I would be willing to give them another try, but it wont be any time soon. Hopefully they will still be in business by the time I do decide to patronize them again.

Honestly I don't know why there so many bad reviews but I had a great experience. We sat at the bar for happy hour and the bartender was super friendly and helpful. Everything we ordered off the happy hour menu was delicious. I definitely will be back and try the full menu next time.

After a bad experience at Grape Street Café my husband and I walked to Crave Restaurant in the Downtown Summerlin Mall. Im so glad we didn't settle for rudeness at the other place. At CRAVE we were met by courteous smiling hostesses Chelsa and Kayla who in tandem took our requests and sat us outside under the stars.
 Crave has a menu called "DATE NIGHT". We loved the food choices and the bottle of wine that was included in the rate. And then much to our surprise we were greeted with a 5 star server. Her name was Maggie T. and right from the beginning she seemed delighted to serve us. Her 5 star demeanor lasted throughout our meal. By the way, not only was the service great for a mall restaurant the food was delicious! We had the pleasure to be served by Jennifer Lapadu; a Manager at Crave. I shared my delight with the service and asked if she could share their names. As much as I share honest and truthful negative experiences it is much more important to shed light on servers who do their jobs so well..it even makes the food taste better!

REQUEST NICHOLAS as your server! he's amazing. so personable, and provides exceptional customer service. the food was great, the patio was beautiful and more than welcoming of our golden retriever who accompanied us, but it will be Nicholas who makes us come back. :) thanks nick! thanks crave!

Went there to check out happy hour with some friends.. Drinks were good with $4 beers and their ginger beer drink for $7 was tasty. Customer service was great but the rating is based on the food.. Or lack of. The crispy chicken that was $6 looked like someone already ate half of it and it was like a sliver of chicken with bunch of breading.. The sliders came out and there were only 2 and light ingredients. Sushi was also ok, Philadelphia was quite fishy.. Used to salmon having a more buttery taste. We tried out this place during their grand opening but it was a madhouse so don't want to rate on that day. Only reason I would come back is because of their awesome patio seating and to have a few beers.. Other than that, not too crazy about it.

This place has so much potential. The service was good and we were seated right away. The crab and artichoke dip wasn't bad but the 2 bento boxes and the premium bento box were terrible. The panko shrimp was basically all panko. The sushi tasted fishy. I was going to give the place a second chance but when i saw the bill i changed my mind. For the price we payed and the location, I was expecting a lot more. I'm not saying that you shouldn't go and give crave a chance but, yeah i was a little disappointed.

This place is pretty fancy inside. A really nice looking restaurant with a large center bar with plenty of seating, and an outdoor patio area. 

My friend and I decided to give it a try. He had already been to Wolfgang Puck's (I haven't so that's another future review). We ordered the crab/artichoke dip in a lemony mayo sauce which was pretty tasty, but lacking a lot of crab. ($14).
For dinner my friend ordered the Chicken stir fry ($20) which he said had good flavor but the noodles were undercooked and the veggies overcooked. I will note that our bartender did try to talk him out of that selection.
I had the Norwegian Salmon in a mustard sauce and that was pretty good. I enjoyed the flavors and the salmon was cooked nicely. I would order this meal again. $27.

They get lower stars due to two main factors. One - my friends Chicken stir fry meal and 2 - we sat at the bar, and my cocktail sat empty for almost 10 minutes while 3 bartenders looked and walked by. That's not good.

Enjoyed a great meal with 7 of my girlfriends! Our server Casi was outstanding! Her knowledge of the menu was great, but her ability to know how to serve us without over doing it was refreshing! She is friendly & a real pleasure! I loved the Bison burger, but everyone at our table was very happy with their food. I can't wait to go back again!

This is our first time venturing through Summerlin area.  We didn't know what to expect, walking through this deserted shopping center.  

We saw the menu, saw they have gluten-free, so I'm testing a new diet to see what my allergies are.  I never knew how hard it was to eat GF, dairy and soy free, when dining out.  

The sushi is nothing to run home to, but at least it was decent.  My chicken and rice noodle dish was a good-interesting, really flavorful, also filling down to the last bite.  Not good for low carb, but perfect for gluten-free, minus the goat cheese for a non-dairy meal.  I always associate rice noodles with my Chinese flavored broth, but this lightly salted, olive oil concoction was surprisingly great.   

This place has the generic contemporary sort of look, nice choice of orange/red tinge to their decor.  Service was slow to start off, until I made a remark and the waiter was super attentive throughout our entire meal.  Now, that's customer service.

We decided to do a late dinner last night.  I had been wanting to come here since it opened and they offer reverse happy hour which is a plus.   For our food my husband ordered the Crave burger with fries.  I ordered the baked mac and cheese with grilled chicken added to it.  We also ordered appetizers.  Now initially our service started out great.  Our server checked on us and brought us the apps in a timely manner.  When he brought our food, mine came out and, my husband only received his burger.  Our server told him that he asked the kitchen to make a fresh batch of fries and that it will be out shortly.  That was great, but why wasn't this done when the order was taken initially?  Ten minutes or so goes by and our server comes back saying he was off, but another server was taking his place.   He introduced her and they both left.  Five minutes or so passed and when our new server comes by she looks at my husband and says, "Sir, can I get you anything?". I think to myself, I'm100% sure she see's me here with him, so why not address us both?  My husband mentions his fries never came out so she goes to get them and by now I'm just annoyed that she didn't address us both, nor did she look at me.  I don't know what her deal was, but honestly I was looking forward to going back with friends for happy hour.  Now, not so much. 

Besides the lack of good customer service, the food for okay.  Again, I don't know if we'll go back for a second try or not.  It's a shame too, I thought this would be a good hang out for us aside from Public School.

My family and I went here for my birthday. The atmosphere is almost as wonderful as the food! I ordered the lamb meatballs with a glass of red wine and they were delicious! The service was excellent. We very much enjoyed the company of our server, Jennifer. She was so sweet and attentive. My family and I will be back soon just for her outstanding service.
Sushi was pretty good but nothing spectacular. Liked the Mexican roll. The décor and environment was somewhat strange, felt very institutional.

I've wanted to try this place for quite sometime. However, with poor Yelp reviews and a discouraging word from my parents that it wasn't good and over priced I had mixed feelings. When a meetup group scheduled a lunch here I thought I'd give it a try before planning to go with my husband and having a bigger tab.  Meh, nothing special about their Sushi Lunch Combo and service was poor. For 13.95 it came with miso soup, a skimpy spicy salmon roll and 5 nigiri. We were a group of 9 in the corner and server never came around to refill beverages and the restaurant had barely any guests. My glass of water was low and I slurped the remains of melting ice when we left. Sometimes with larger groups I wonder if servers feel more relaxed about providing excellent service because they know there is a high likelihood the total tip is going to be pretty good. I am usually a very generous tipper (18-25%) but not today. No one at our table raved about their selection. If you want sushi, this isn't the place to get your "fix"!

I stopped into Crave with my boyfriend for a cocktail and a snack.  I tried the blueberry lemonade which was great, I enjoyed the flavor- it was a perfect mix without being too sweet! We ordered an appetizer, which was tasty. I want to say I like Crave, although the service was lacking. I know that Crave is one of a few restaurants open in Downtown Summerlin at this time, so I want to give them the benefit of the doubt and hope that the service will improve, I think they have the cocktails and food to be successful, they just need the service and hospitality to catch up with it.

Ordered the steak sliders and the Dirty Flirty cocktail. Must say, the " Dirty Flirty" was pretty intense, the dirty martini had few bits of prosciutto & bleu cheese stuffed olives. The steak sliders were delicious, could of used more of the "juniper mayo'. Definitely would go back to try the sushi.

2nd time going to this restaurant the experience was not what I expected since they've been open for longer than 2 weeks. Waited 30 mins for a table for 2. I noticed a group complain that their buzzer wasn't working and apparently the battery died. The restrooms were again not cleaned and refilled with paper towels. Not sure if this place is going to change anytime soon.

Overall
   My first and second time dining here were both amazing experiences! During my first visit, my coworker and I had just finished shopping around and were looking for a place to eat and we decided to give Crave a try. Having a wonderful experience there the first time, I told my parents about it and they ate there for lunch for a meeting and soon called me over as well; ending again with a wonderful experience. I definitely recommend this restaurant, but just watch out a bit for the pricing. 

Wait Time & Customer Service
   Hostesses are alright in my opinion, and the wait for us wasn't as long as some other reviewers (do note that it was only the two of us) had experienced; I waited around 10 minutes for an indoor seat my first visit, which isn't bad. The indoors looked pretty classy. Our waitress was absolutely amazing, she was friendly, knowledgable and very attentive. 
   We received exemplary customer service; During our first visit with my coworker the manager paid for one of our desserts just because we couldn't decide between two of their desserts. He (the manager) did initially think that my coworker and I were on a date though, so I believe this would be a great place for a date knowing that the manager's trying to make your date run as smoothly as it can. I don't know if the manager does this 24/7 but, during the first visit the manager was roaming around the restaurant, checking on the customers constantly. I gave the biggest tip I've ever given a restaurant here. 
   During the second visit with my family, again, we had exemplary service. We were seated outdoors at the patio. I don't know if it was super busy that specific day, or if the waiters and waitresses for the patios are just less organized. Our waiter for that day was friendly as well but wasn't as attentive. A few times different waiters came to our table with something that wasn't ours (but all of the food we had ordered had been served already) and at some point went from table to table asking if they had ordered what she was carrying. It wasn't bad though, we're all human and they just opened so there will always be a few kinks here and there. I overall definitely recommend this restaurant.

Food
  During my first visit I had the Filet Mignon, which by the way, is the best Filet Mignon I've ever had! It was very juicy and had lots of flavor, I find their Filet Mignon better than Cheesecake Factory's (and Crave's Mignon is a bit bigger). It's accompanied with "potato puree, caramelized brussels sprouts, [and] topped with garlic butter" which is a perfect (I guess you would call it) side to the dish. My coworker had the Ribeye which is also accompanied with the same sides as the Mignon. I had a taste of his Ribeye and it was pretty delicious too I'd give the Ribeye about four stars and the Mignon five stars. We also ordered the sushi, Godzilla. Very delicious. I'd give that about five stars as well. 
   With the desserts that night, we had the Smore's Brownie and Signature Cheesecake. We devoured the smores, and we didn't really eat much of the cheesecake. The smores had the perfect balance of sweet flavors: five stars. The cheesecake was ok but nothing really special: three stars. 
   During my second visit I initially wanted to have the Filet Mignon again (it's that good) however, I'm a person who loves to try new things so I went for the Pork Tenderloin instead. The Tenderloins were not as delicious. It was kind of dry, but manageable, nothing really special in my opinion: three stars. 
   My Father had Half Roasted Chicken, which was absolutely delicious; I took a taste of it as well! It contains rice, bits of grilled pineapple, and "jalapeno orange glaze". The chicken was juicy and seasoned deliciously, and with the pineapple and the orange glaze it tasted delicious altogether: five stars! My Mother had the Chicken Stir Fry, (which again, I had a taste of. I'm a foodie) it was okay for me, around three stars. My Mother however found it to be too salty for her, and asked if she could have something else (which they happily obliged) and then ordered the Half Roasted Chicken.
    Both times that I was here I had some tea with peach in it (different drinks) the first one was mixed with raspberry I believe, and it was okay. The plain peach tea was not sweet enough for me, so it'll be good for those who like not-too-sweet drinks. Wait time for the food wasn't that long as well, pretty average wait time for a restaurant. 
   The food overall? 4.5 Stars

Pricing
   The prices of the food here are kind of pricy, but my coworker and I thought it was worth it; I think they would have even more business if they maybe lowered the prices a bit. The bill for my coworker and I came up to the low $100, with the cheesecake being free (Filet Mignon, Ribeye, Godzilla, Cheesecake, Smores, Peach tea, Raspberry  tea). I do not know of the total bill for the lunch meeting during my second visit, but as far as I know, there were no complaints.

I sell furniture at the macys summerlin store and frequent CRAVE quite often. Their lunch specials are delicious and reasonably priced. The service is hit or miss, which is the reason for the 3 stars. 
I also went for drinks here and am obsessed with their red sangria, SO good. 
They also have groupons $15 for $30 of food, a great buy!
Everything was great! Service, food ... Except for the sushi .... The volcano roll had huge cucumber chunks that made it difficult to eat. After removing the cucumber the roll was okay.

Crave burgers, Parmesan/truffle fries, & salad were tasty, but there's something about lukewarm-coldish food, especially soggy fries, that I strongly dislike. Our waitress was friendly but seemed eager to clock out already.  After our food was served, no one asked how we were doing. This place might have strong potential if they improve on service. Otherwise, there are many other places to get the same if not better and less expensive type of food.

I took my husband here for his birthday with my daughter. We were seated and they only brought us two waters. They brought us another water and took our order. I asked for the dressing on the side for my salad and when it came the dressing was drizzled on the salad. The food is pretty pricey and the fish is not fresh. My daughter had the California roll and it was $9 for 6 little pieces. The imitation crab was dry and the roll did not hold together. Our bill came out to be $100 with some other things. But other than that the server was nice and helpful.

We finally checked this place out during Restaurant Week. Love it! Service was fantastic. Cone during happy hour on weekdays and the sushi is half price. Food tastes great. Parmesan truffle fries are amazing. Trendy ambience. We will be back for sure.

Great food, the Lamb Meatballs were fantastic with a North African flavor profile. The service was excellent, our server Cassie was top notch. I had two minor issues. First, when there is a fifteen to twenty minute wait, it doesn't help that I can see from the lobby, enough clean tables to seat everyone waiting with a few tables left over. Second, they really cheaped out on the tables and chairs. They remind me of something you would find in a cafeteria.

HORRIBLE!!!! We get there and order our food...we ask for a bread basket and it cost extra. My son had hair in his food..When I told the waiter he said do you want me to take his food back to the kitchen???? I'm like did you really need to ask that question??? Then they bring my salmon and it is under cooked in fact just about raw. I told the waiter and while he's somewhat apologizing he spits on the table and keeps talking. We are like WHAT??.? So they bring my son out his food and a whole 20 minutes later they brought my food and I'm like keep it...we're leaving.  Prices and high. .
Service bad. ..
I WILL NOT BE RETURNING!!!

I wish I had read reviews before coming in, we were greeted promptly and with a smile but it took awhile for anyone to come to our table (there were 2 other couples at two other tables-so it was not busy) our server was just ok, he was polite. He kept forgetting to bring our waters and only refilled our waters once (and that took awhile). I ordered the black bean soup (it was also jUsT ok- actually Panera's is mucH better!) I also ordered Caprese flat bread no complaints there,  portion was good for the price. My fiance ordered the lobster linguine (I believe it was around $23-25, additional charge if you want a side of bread with your pasta) we could not believe when it was served how small the portion was, I've seen children's meals with more food. Price doesn't matter when you get what you pay for but to pay the prices we did and have my fiance still leave there hungry..... yeah total disappointment. Too many other options within walking distance, we won't return.

Couldn't get seating outside. Very nice restaurant. Chairs were too high and uncomfortable. Waited 20 minutes to be served but our waiter was very nice. Got the lemon pepper wings they were excellent. Flat bread pizza was also tasty.

We sat at the bar and were given menus. Then we were subsequently ignored for 15 minutes after putting the menus aside. Customers around us were served multiple times but we were not addressed at all. They were busy, but there were 7 bartenders for 12-15 customers at the bar. There's really no excuse for the bad service. After futilely waiting for a few more minutes, just sitting and waiting, we left. I will not be returning here anytime soon.

This place was such a bad first time experience that I just HAD to write my first review!!! 

First off when you walk in there's a wait just to put your name on the list. They put your first and last name in the system then give you a waiting pager. They seemed so unorganized like they didn't know what they were doing. The wait was an hour long so we decided to walk around downtown summerlin and check it out.. About 40 minutes passed by so we checked to see how much longer. They said about 4 more people were in front of us still so we waited some more.... About 15 more minutes passes by so we check how much longer again and she said 2 more people were still ahead of us but since we were in there she'll just seat us. I don't know if that was a good or bad thing because if she let us cut in front of people imagine how many people she let cut in front of us?! 

So now that we're seated let me say... She gave my boyfriend and I the WORST table. It was so tiny right in between the bar and the bigger tables. We were so close to the family sitting on the side of us. The space was so tight the servers were having a hard time squeezing through to drop off and pick up food. 

Now for drinks I ordered a white sangria. Our server bragged about how delicious and popular that drink was and how I'm gonna love it...... Then he comes back and says they're all out!!! Really?! Got my hopes up! So I went with the blueberry lemonade.. It was good-- super minty from the mint leaves. My boyfriend just got a Stella.. Nothing to mess up there. 

As for food.. The menu was on the pricier side. Their pastas ranged from 20-30$... 18$ for some Mac n cheese!!! They have a sushi side of the menu too but I didn't order any sushi. My boyfriend got the crave burger and the fries tasted over-cooked. The food was just okay. 

Mainly went to check out the new mall and decided we'll stop by and eat there and it was just bad. They are the only restaurant open right now so I understand that's why they were so busy but they just seemed  so unorganized. Probably will give them another shot again like later later once they figure themselves out.

I was excited to try CRAVE on my recent business trip to Las Vegas due to some great reviews I had read of it. I'll have to say that it generally lived up to the hype. With that said, I would not leave the Strip to experience CRAVE -- but if you're in the suburban area around it, it's a wonderful choice for a delicious dinner in a trendy casual place with friendly service. 

The menu is varied with many options including a sushi menu. To some extent, for better and for worse, it feels like a Cheesecake Factory type menu with lots of variety in the cuisine types but at a high degree of quality. I chose the fried calamari at the server's suggestion, and accompanied it with hot marinara. I love any calamari that is freshly battered and not too greasy, and this more than met the test. I really liked the crunchy corn meal batter. I also had the steak sliders for my dinner since I was not too hungry, and I enjoyed them a lot. I wasn't a big fan of the sauce on them, but the steak itself was juicy, tender and came in large chunks on the Hawaiian sweet bread. My friend had the sushi roll and enjoyed it.

Jordan was our server, and our whole table loved him. He was sweet, sincere, and made great recommendations that demonstrated his knowledge and experience of the menu.

This was my second visit to CRAVE. Both times I had the pesto goat cheese hummus and it is by far the best hummus I have ever had. Do yourself a favor and order it! I also had the tempura veggie roll with cream cheese and it was excellent. My husband ordered a burger and requested no cheese. Our waitress told him it doesn't come with cheese, but unfortunately, when he got it, it had cheese on it. The waitress apologized profusely, got him another burger, and gave us a $10 off coupon for our next visit which will hopefully be soon!

EVERYTHING YOU MAY CRAVE

This is a very INTERESTING restaurant.... There is a VARIETY of things going on... They have things from American... Mediterranean... to SUSHI... RANDOM but also... if you can't decide what you want... i guess you can come here for a VARIETY of Choices.

I have been here before when they were fairly new... the food was AMAZING! this time around... i was a bit disappointed... as the selection i made again of what i had eaten before was NOT the SAME as what i was expecting.

Our server was nice, but she seemed like she was having a bit of a rough day... We also ordered a bottle of wine & there was some spilling action due to the capsule not being cut off all the way... which the wine hit & just dripped all over the table =/ 

Came here w/ 2 of the girlfriends so we shared a bunch of different things.

BREAD BASKET $3 - different kinds of bread & probably wouldn't get it again while paying... prefer to get truffle fries as a filler but our server forgot to put our order in for this & we were already too full to tell her.

CRAB ARTICHOKE DIP $13.95 - a mix of crab & artichoke tossed in a lemony mayo served hot w/ flat-bread. This thing was freaken AMAZING & scorching hot which made it even tastier. The crispy flat-bread just perfects the dish!

CRAVE HUMMUS $9.95 - a pesto & goat cheese infused hummus served w/ rainbow cauliflower & fresh veggie bruschetta w/ crostini. This was not my style & we probably made the least dent in this item. It just had a sour taste to each bite... =/

ARGENTINE STYLE RIB-EYE $31.95 - rubbed w/ palm sugar rub & chimichurri served w/ potato puree & rainbow cauliflower. I was hoping to taste some chimichurri but the palm sugar rub was overpowering & it tasted like a sweet piece of meat rather than the melody of sweet & savory....

SAUTEED SCOTTISH SALMON $21.95 - mustard crusted served w/ grain beurre blanc, potato puree, heirloom carrots. PERFECTION on this dish, although i don't like salmon... i had to try it. it was also a HUGE piece of fish! the mustard crust gave it a nice blend in flavor.

SIMPLY GRILLED HALIBUT $MP - typically served w/ coconut jasmine rice & roasted rainbow cauliflower, but i got potato puree & asparagus instead. This was a very DISAPPOINTING dish... the fish was like GOO... i LOVE LOVE halibut & i just couldn't eat it.... every bite, it was like MUSH rather than FLAKEY meaty goodness... also tasted fishy which typically should NOT be the case for HALIBUT!

Great tomato pesto soup, four cheese grilled cheese sandwich. Premium bento box of spicy tuna.  All very very good. Server Michael was good to us, even came out with a little fruit salad for our grandson who didn't take the time to taste that but did enjoy playing with the lid on his water glass

Crave! Such. A beautiful restaurant indeed. The service was fantastic except for the rude hostess. The food was incredible, I had a margherita flatbread which was phenomenal and ordered the turkey burger! It was absolutely delicious except for the fact when I picked it up a pool of oil/grease fell all over my hand in large amounts.... I couldn't eat the bun cause there was literally too much compared to the patty, and it was soggy!! but it was amazing! For fries, I recommend the gluten free and not the normal ones... Mine were stale and dry:(

I have never had such poor service when sitting at the bar.  I had to ask three times for a glass of water; once when I ordered my drink, once when the bartender gave me my drink, and finally to who appeared to be the assistant bartender.  I even had to sit and wait, with empty plate and glasses in front of me, and finally ask for my check even though I had told the bartender I was done when he asked if I wanted another drink after I finished my food.  Besides those times I, along with the other three ladies at the bar, was mostly ignored.

The kicker is they weren't all that busy with it being past the lunch rush and before dinner.  Hell, while I was sitting there waiting with my wallet in front of me the assistant went and started to chop lemons instead of asking if I needed anything. The food and drink were good which is why they get two stars and why I'll probably give them a second chance sometime.  But it won't be soon.

5/5 or the food
1/5 for the service

We came here with a group of 20 for a birthday dinner, and we sat down at 9pm. We ordered at about 9:30, got our food at 10. One thing was she didn't ask us for our drinks. She just assumed everyone wanted water.  We finished eating at 10:30, waiting for our checks. As I am writing this review now, at 10:54 p.m., we are waiting to pay for our bill. It took 25 minutes for the check! That's a pretty long time.

The food, however, was good. We ordered a rib eye steak and Mac n cheese. The Mac and cheese is alright, but the steak was packed with flavor! I really loved it. 

Like most of the reviews here, service needs to improve.

Overall experience was not memorable. Took over an hour to get seated. After being seated took about 25 minutes to get my drink. Ordered Sweet Peach Ice Tea. Waiter kept coming back to table saying the bar was making it. About 4 trips. Finally after another 16 mins she said that they ran out. This place sells sushi but not that great. Food wait times are horrible. While I must say that the place looks fabulous and upscale, the presentation of food is below par. Sushi wait times are bad for a place that claims that has a sushi bar. The only thing I liked was that it was family friendly.

After my 81 year old mother prepared our Thanksgiving meal I decided to take her out last Saturday to relax and enjoy a good dinner. The $5 cup of black bean soup was fine, however after that, things got bad.  We ordered the "steak" sliders as an appetizer.  They were a sad shade of gray, tasteless, tough and luke warm.  Couldn't figure out if it was salisbury steak, or something more sinister.  $15 for 3 of these monstrosities was criminal. The calamari was tasty, but skimpy, and again luke warm.  The caeser salad was bland, with absolutely no flavor, and next to no dressing.  
       Ordering the 'signature' rib eye for the main course was another huge disappointment.  $31 for a steak 3/8ths of an inch thick is absurd.  I don't think they are getting nervous at Del Frisco's.  After all this mediocrity, we decided to skip desert at Crave, and purchase some items from the nearby Trader Joe's.
      The highlight of the meal was the desert from Trader Joe's.  I am not a malicious person, however I need to warn other yelp fans about this $155 fiasco.  For that type of money we could have had an outstanding meal at the nearby Vintner's Grill or Honey Salt.

Crave is not bad, but I'm not craving Crave

Crave is located on the northern part of downtown Summerlin. The decor is modern and trendy with bar high stools, booth and table seating for groups.

We ordered up a few beers on tap, Kona Brewing is always a good choice. The sushi menu was good, but really nothing that jumped off the plate to make it stand out over your local sushi hole in the wall. The calamari starter was a decent serving and something I would recommend.

The service was great, our server ran through the menu lighting fast and offered up some really interesting choices from the sushi menu.

Downtown Summerlin has some great options to choose from either for lunch or dinner. With no disrespect to Crave but i believe it falls in the middle of the locations you can choose from. If you have not been, Go try it out 

Overall:
Food: 3-5
Drink: 3-5
Service: 4-5
Coming back: sure

We arrived Sunday around 5 PM, and waited in the front for a good ten minutes prior to anyone acknowledging that we were there. The restaurant was not very busy so we were surprised that we had to wait so long to be seated. 

Happy hour is available all day Sundays, and found that CRAVE had quite a few items offered between $3 and $6. We ordered 3 dishes, the pesto chicken flatbread, the Korean nuggets, and the bacon cheddar tater tots.

The Korean nuggets had a good flavor, however the breading was falling apart and quite mushy. It definitely needed to be cooked to a crispier finish. 

The bacon cheddar tots are not what you may expect. I was thinking it would be a crispy tot with bacon and cheddar melted on top, however, the bacon and cheddar were actually inside the tots. The tots had mashed potato consistency on the inside. The flavor was good, however it was served on such a large plate, that it looked rather unappealing. 

In  contrast, the flatbread was larger than the plate it was served on. It had an okay flavor, however it is not something I would actually ever CRAVE. 

Overall, the happy hour food and drinks are cheap, but so is the quality. I would say you get what you pay for, however, I still think I overpaid.

We were at this restaurant about 4'ish on Monday afternoon during happy hour.  I ordered the Kobe tacos as an appetizer and they were so spicy I could hardly eat them.  My girlfriend ordered the roast chicken w/salsa and specifically asked for no halopenias.  The meal came out spicy hot.  Upon complaining to the waiter, who was also the bartender, we were given the bill with no apologize or reduction in the amount.  Although the restaurant is very quaint, customer service needs to be improved. We will not be going back to this facility.

A new favorite!!

This was an impromptu dinner and we were not disappointed! Our server Maggie was so helpful, down to earth, & made us smile every time she stopped by our table. 

The food was AMAZING. We even got to enjoy the outdoor seating since the weather was great. 

Also, Maggie mentioned how new creative dishes are always being added to the menu. Who doesn't like new things, right?

Keep up the great work!

I have a love-hate relationship with December.  I love the twinkling lights; the crisp air; the elevated spirits of people who'd likely be under a rock because it gets dark so early; the food.  Ah, the food.  I hate the food.  There's just too much of it in December! And that's what brought us to Crave, who generously hosted a free reception after the Menorah lighting at Downtown Summerlin, open to all.

They brought out an admirable selection of appetizers:  two kinds of flatbread, two kinds of sushi, multi-colored cauliflower with a dip that seemed to be babaganoush with diced apples (?), bacon & cheese potato tots with a very garlicky dipping sauce, and an assortment of breads.  Drinks were on us, and service was excellent.

We might have stopped there, but we had a BOGO coupon for dinner that had actually expired about a week ago.  They generously agreed to take it, so we decided to continue our food fest in the dining room.
