One quibble, and it's not only for this place:  why on earth do restaurants insist on air conditioning a huge restaurant when it's winter in the desert?  I quipped to the hostess that we should sit in the [open] kitchen, but she said it's cold in there, too!  If restaurants stopped doing this they could probably lower the cost of each entree by $5.  

Despite other reviews decrying the service here, our experience was different.  Just as in the bar, the service was A+++.  Our waiter, Jordan, was friendly, chatty, attentive and fun.  Though others may feel differently, we hate it when a wait person is a robot; to us, a personable server is an asset, makes us feel welcome, and adds to the overall experience.  Disclaimer:  I like chatty seatmates on airplanes, too.

There were numerous entrees to choose from, and I had Pesto Chicken Greek (no, I didn't reverse the strange order of the three words) - two small but thick breasts atop a mixture of roasted potato dice and multi-colored cauliflower.  The very juicy chicken was topped with mozzarella and drizzled with a nice, creamy pesto.  I loved the veggies, but alas, it was a very small portion.  If we hadn't had the BOGO, I would have objected to the 17.95 price of this dish.

My husband had Chicken Caprese Rosa, a fried chicken breast duo sliced over angel hair in a vodka-ish sauce.  Very juicy chicken, tasty pasta, but again, not a very large portion of pasta.  

The food is very good, the service is excellent (our waitress from the bar even stopped at our table as she was leaving to wish us a happy Chanukah), and the restaurant is very pretty.  We liked it and we'll return.

We came here because Crave sponsors O'Roarke Elementary's Pep Squad.  We had no real expectations and were pleasantly surprised by delicious food, great service and a great location.  The Honey Sriracha wings were delicious, sushi is fresh and reasonably priced.  Good kids menu selections (with healthy choices!) Overall great experience.  We will be back.

Sat at the bar for at least ten minutes with no service. 
Finally got a beer. Ten more minutes pass and no contact with the happy hour bartender. Finally had to leave. Very disappointed. First time and probably last time.

Favorite place to go eat! Everything we've had has been a home run, especially the apple sausage flatbread pizza! Chef Shaun is amazingly talented and we are happy to follow him to whatever restaurant he works at.

Just had lunch here and I must disagree with a lot of the reviews. 

Service was spot-on. Waitress was great and very attentive. Refills for drinks constantly. 

Love the decor, environment, the total vibe. I feel really bad that so many people reviewed based on a brand new establishment and not giving them credit for just opening. 

Food was good: the bbq pork sliders with kimchi was tender and juicy. The chicken apple and brie sandwich was bomb. Such a unique flavor. 

Will definitely be coming back.
Channell are server was very good didn't miss a beat thank you we shall be back the gluten free menu is great lots to choose from.

I've been wanting to try this place out fit for a while. We decided to go try the Happy Hour. I really liked the choices they had. My friend and I ordered drinks, pretty good. I ordered the kinky mojito. I ordered the kogi tacos. The big plate they used made the serving size even smaller. It was only 2 tacos... Kinda small. Wished they added 3. My friend ordered the Apple sausage flatbread. Looked pretty good. My other friend ordered pork belly sliders. She says there wasn't that much pork in hers and it was just 2 sliders too. At least at cheese cake factory they would give you 4 or 6 I believe. The decor was really nice. Looked modern. We sat at the bar,i didn't know it would be that loud. The staff was very nice. The hostess sat us right away when we decided to sit somewhere else since you can only try happy hour at or around the bar. I would try to go back there and try the regular size food next time instead of just the Happy Hour

Came here for lunch after a few hours of shopping at Downtown Summerlin. It's quite a large place and wasn't very busy, but it was earlier than the lunch rush and a weekday.

The waiter was very nice and attentive. He was very cute as well. A little young for this old cougar but I won't complain.

Between us, we had the chicken wings and an asian salad. Pretty healthy now that I look back. Five stars for the food and service. Minus one star for my average sized lunch costing me $18. Yeeshka! 

I would say this place would be good for a business lunch where you company is paying or a date, where the guy is paying. Great vibe. I need to get back into dating.
The 702 burger is in the top 5 burgers of Las Vegas.  Plus, Dogfish 90 on tap, perfect combination!

This was my first time here after hearing about it countless times and I have to say I was more impressed with the decor than the food and service...

Definitely interesting ingredients and twists in classic dishes if you're into that sort of thing. The service was beyond slow, the restaurant wasn't too filled, there were more than enough servers and somehow we still ended up being there about 2 hours. Not terrible but not worth a second shot for lunch at least.

3 letters... O.M.G.

Crave is a new restaurant inside Downtown Summerlin, and actually its the only restaurant open so far! Ive been here 3 days in a row now and every meal gets better then the last. 
The first time we dined here we were lucky enough to be invited for the Soft Opening. We got to try numerous items from their menu. I loved all of them and a few of my favorite items were:
Chicken Apple Sausage Flatbread- Caramelized red onion, balsamic glaze, manchego, roasted red peppers
Pork Belly Sliders- Kimchi, Korean BBQ sauce, cilantro
Jumbo Shrimp- Spice marinade, flash fried, tzatziki sauce
Lemon Garlic Wings- cucumber, bleu cheese dip
Lobster Linguine- Poached lobster, lightly truffled lemon butter sauce
Strauss® Free Raised® Grass Fed Burger- Foie gras butter, caramelized onions
Aloha Sushi Roll- spicy tuna, mango, cilantro, avocado, poké sauce

We also had an arrangement of cocktails, my favorite was the Candied Carrot Martini. It contained a few different vodkas with fresh pressed carrot juice. YUM!
Our server Jennifer was great, we could tell she was very busy but still provided great service. Probably the best server Ive ever had.

The second time we dined here it was the grand opening. There was a 2 hour wait at the door so we tried our luck at the bar. We grabbed a few seats (we got extremely lucky) and started out with a few wines. They have an amazing hour Pinot Grigio and Merlot. We had the Aloha Sushi roll (again) and the calamari. Andy LOVED the calamari. it had a crispy cornmeal crust and came with  jalapeño aioli for dipping. It was a great twist on the classic calamari dish. Although I didn't get any of the bartenders names we again had great service.

And the third time I dined here (this afternoon) Ceasar took great care of us. I came here with a gf and my mother, who has celiac disease. CRAVE has a huge Gluten Free menu! Ceasar even told us that they take celiac so serious that the chef who makes any gluten free item even changes their coat, gloves and apron to keep from cross contamination. We were so impressed by this. 
My gf and I started out with the Margarita Flatbread. So amazing!! Each piece had the perfect amount of fresh mozzarella, basil, and tomato. 
For entrees my mom had the lemon garlic wings, she loved them as much as I did. I had the  Roasted Chicken. It came with coconut jasmine rice, grilled pineapple relish, fried plantains and was glazed with a jalapeño orange glaze. This is probably my favorite item I've tried here. Its amazing. Jen had the Turkey Burger and she loved that as well. 
I had a blueberry Fizz to drink, it was pretty much a non-alcoholic blueberry mojito. 

This is probably my new favorite restaurant in the Summerlin area. We've dined here 3 times in 3 days, and enjoyed each experience. So happy to have a place like Crave right up the street!

I've been here twice with a friend of mine and before my first time going I called to see if they have any vegan selections and they replied saying "many options, they're just spread throughout the menu" I ordered the veggie roll, which has no Suchi in it, just rice sea weed, avocado and veggies. It was pretty good. Only downside was my waiter didn't really take me saying I'm "vegan" seriously. I asked him what I should order and he kept pointing out items with dairy, and even offered me dessert with ice cream! I just thought waiters and waitresses would have better knowledge of what vegan and vegetarian is. Over all. Everyone is very nice. My friend loves Crave and even got a rewards card. I hope more vegan options come on the menu. It's a very nice restaurant but the appetizers are just as much as the entrees . Weird. Probably will be back :)

Went for happy hour last week and we were not impressed. First off, terrible service... We sat for over 15 minutes at our booth before served. Second, the menu is not as impressive as we were hoping. Food was good but the drinks were only okay. Probably will not try again.

went with family for lunch had the bison burger and was very good french fries were ok a little soggy had the bread basket and was very good for appetizer all in all would go back and hostess was very friendly.

Service was great. The location and patio have a great atmosphere. However, the food left a LOT to be desired. We ordered off of the happy hour menu and we were displeased with every item that we ordered. We decided that since it was the happy hour menu it may be sub par. So we ordered a sushi roll off of the regular menu and it was the worst one! Like I said again great service, great location, terrible food and presentation. My fiancé order a glass of wine and the glass was filthy. I don't think this restaurant specializes in sushi. All of the rolls were rolled terribly and falling apart by the time they reached our table. We won't be going again.

Went for lunch this weekend, and enjoyed it very much.  We were seated promptly, and our server took our drink orders.  My daughter was with me, and ordered off the kids menu.  Her sliders were delicious.  I had a Cuban sandwich, which was also delicious.  Our server was friendly, and quickly took care of an item that came out wrong.  Prices are reasonable.  My only complaint (and this happens frequently at other restaurants, too) is that I was about 3/4 through my meal, when our server asked if we had room for dessert.  I finished my bite ( ;-) and said no.  The check was then presented.  I can see that maybe our server thought we were in a rush to get back out shopping, but it's a pet peeve of mine to be asked about dessert when I'm still chewing on my meal!  All in all though, we would return next time we are at Downtown Summerlin.

The happy hour is reasonably priced but the service was not too good.  The drinks were watered down and took forever, meanwhile all the food came out at one time which was quite annoying. The food was okay. The fire alarm went off several times no one came over to apologize or tell us why it was happening. All and all happy hour was not so happy.
Rough grand opening but they got their stuff together now. Had a great lunch and the burger was awesome. My appetizer came out cold and the same time as my food but was till happy with the service.

Here is my review of the restaurant. The decor is nice and modern, upscale looking but the food doesn't match the ambience. Portions are small and bland. Do not order Steak Sliders if you are hungry!! It's consider an entree/burger which looks like it should be an appetizer $14.95!! A White Castle burger is bigger than the sliders I got. The wait staff was decent and friendly which is why I gave 2 stars. FYI you'll be "Crave"ing that you had more food on your plate. Pass!!

Service was ok. Three of us for dinner. The wedges salad was just fair. The soup tasted like marinara and very thick. Edamame was full of soy sauce and tasted burnt. Kogi beef tacos were just awful.   The crave burger was good.  Mascarpone stuffed chicken. The crust was burnt as was the asparagus. Overall the experience was just ok.  They refunded the soup and Kogi tacos.

This place is an upscale American/Asian diner. 

The service was friendly and attentive. The meals was delicious. Our party had the chicken wings (yum), sushi (fresh), and the restaurants signature cocktails.
I always get the Scottish salmon and it's very tasty. Good sauce and the carrots are awesome

Everything was edible but below average at best. I had the steak sliders and they were okay but the bun was phenomenal. The side salad was pretty good.
My wife ordered the baked penne which tasted like a cheap lasagna that you would bake at home.
We also got the truffle fries as a snack and those were GREAT. 
Good atmosphere but bad service. Our waiter walked by several times without even asking if we needed anything after we were completely done with our meal. We probably won't be coming back, and I doubt crave stays in downtown Summerlin very long.
Our bill took FOREVER to come and it had 2 items on there that we didn't even order

Great place for the couple where 1 person loves sushi and the other not so much, they can get anything from pasta to a burger and I can get my sushi fix! Rolls aren't too bad def recommend the aloha roll and tuna poke. Tuna is super fresh and was great. Service is great and white sangria was delicious and not too sweet. My only complaint is that it's a tad pricey, but I'm ok with as long as service stays decent.

My Father and I can be very difficult to please, him kinda more so.  I was hoping for a good experience taking him to Crave, and I'm happy to report they killed it!

We were greeted by a lovely young lady and seated promptly. Our server, Becca, was really terrific. Patient, friendly, and knowledgeable, we both order the steak frittes (steak medallions, asparagus spears, and fries.  It was absolutely delicious! Arrived hot and well plated. Generous amount of everything.

If my Father says "I'd come back here, you know it's gotta be good! Thanks Becca!

This would have been a 4 star but we had some service issues. We ordered salads to start, after appetizers, a few drinks then our meal came, I asked about our salads. Said she never put them in...hmmm, kinda of a drag. Was looking forward to a salad. At least she was honest. Also our steaks came with a different veggie than advertised. When asked, she said she didn't know why and brought us the correct veggie (which was cauliflower and was utterly tasteless), so we were glad it came with asparagus instead. The steak medallions were good, as were the roasted new potatoes. That saved the meal, otherwise would've been totally disappointing. To start we had the fried calamari which was actually really good, so that was a plus as well.

I went the for the second time yesterday, the only reason I returned was because I received 3 free appetizer coupons after finding a hair in my salad my first visit. The place had maybe three people in it. Though I'm visibly pregnant and the place was empty they sat my friend and I at the bar.
The waitress mentioned happy hour was coming up and even though we explained we wouldn't be drinking she failed to mention the food specials (which we found later on after we ordered) We ordered two salads, truffle fries, and the crab and artichoke dip with my coupon. The waitress never came back to check on us to see if we needed anything else and I had to chase her down every time she dashed by without refilling our waters. I wasn't a fan of the aioli for the fries and wanted ranch.. I was able to ask her for some about 10 minutes after we were served. Ten MORE minutes later she comes back and says oh no one brought you ranch? By now the fries are cold and soggy. She offers to take the fries off the menu. We ask for more flat bread crackers for our dip which we were charged extra for... My friend takes a bite with dip and finds A STRING OF PLASTIC in her mouth!!! We stopped a manager and to tell him what happened. He apologizes, leaves, comes back and says "You know what I think it was? A bristle from the brushes they use to clean the kitchen.. You know like a toothbrush." UM WTF!! Yuck!!!!! How did that get in the food?!! He returned with some more free appetizer cards and a $10 off coupon for the next visit buuuut I'm honestly scared to come back. Also hate not being checked on in an empty restaurant. I personally have never worked in the food industry but if I was a manager I think it would be common sense to train your servers to come check on the table 2-3 minutes after being served.

The chicken lettuce wraps were delicious. But what was really impressive is the service we got at the bar. Donnie was all smiles all evening, so was the other lovely blonde lady who was working at the bar. It had been years since I had seen so much good energy and happiness and awesome customer service in action. It made my night. Thank you guys!

I'm compelled to write a review. We went to dinner last minute and took our little dog with us. They were so accommodating. Everything from our hostess making sure we were comfortable and she clearly had a good handle on everything - to the server and food. And our little dog was welcomed too!

I'm gonna give it 3.5 but I don't feel it was good enough to round to 4. My best friend and boyfriend of best friend wanted to try something different. We decided to go to Crave for two reasons. 1. It was in Downtown Summerlin and we wanted to go shopping. 2. They had sushi. We made a reservation and headed over. We sat down in a little table and got some menus and the waiter explained the place to us. They have two kitchens, one regular and also a sushi kitchen. We took a moment to look over the menu and kinda just ordered a little bit of everything. We ordered a couple rolls, truffle fries, guac and chips, edamame, flat bread pizza, and even some mac and cheese. My favorite was probably the crunchy spicy tuna roll. We ordered so much they had to extend out table. HAHA, fatasses. We also ordered drinks. I had the blueberry Lemonade, very delicious if you like mint. It has mint leaves in it so it wasn't very lemony. We also ordered lemon drop shots which were strong. My friends also ordered some beers and ciders. We discussed the meal together and came up with 3.5. The flat bread was a little cold and not super tasty. The fries were probably my second favorite. I mean they are fries, you can't do much to mess them up. The guac was on a pile of lettuce which made it look like there was more than there was, also don't like lettuce in my guac, hopefully i'll remember to order it without the next time. Our server was really nice tho. He gave us as much information as he could and helped us organize our table to fit everything. I want to go back and try more items and hopefully fine something more memorable.

Came here with the mr. for an early week happy hour.  Our server was nice but our food was ready before our drinks.  We had the pork belly sliders, tuna roll, and philly roll.  The food was meh, who puts lettuce in a philly roll?  Good luck keeping customers when all of the resturaunts are open.

Decided to give this new restaurant a try since this was just a few of the restaurants that were actually open for the grand openining of Downtown Summerlin. Sorry to say that my boyfriend and I were not impressed. The quality of food was something I would expect from Applebee's but with a 75% mark up in their prices. 

We started off with the Aloha roll and the Pork Belly Sliders. The roll it wasn't anything special but for $15 I was expecting more and the sliders came on some hawaiian roll bread, it was just ok. My boyfriend ordered a their signature Crave burger, the meat patty was a bit dry and the fries were soggy. I ordered turkey BLT and I got somewhat of a flat bread sandwich, kind of threw me off. The smell of the bread was too dough-y, wasn't very pleasant.

In conclusion, we left dissapointed and unsatisfied. Probably won't be coming back.

We went here for dinner a few weeks ago with another couple and everything from the time we get their was poor--they sat us 20 minutes late, everything that all of us ordered wasn't good, the atmosphere feels like a chain and there are many other places on DT Summerlin to eat at.

Here to try their happy hour. A very beautiful restaurant in the new downtown summerlin. Had the Sushi Tuna Roll, very good. The Lettuce Wraps are individually prepared and they were tasty. We also had the crispy pork dumplings, they were the only disappointment, they were pre made and not very good. Everything else was so unique and presented so nicely. I would recommend this place, very nice.

I have been to Crave several times for lunch and have always had a wonderful experience :-) I love the idea that it is a scratch kitchen and the interesting menu choices too (not your average boring items)! The kale salad, bison burger, and lobster mac n cheese are definitely items to try..delicious!  The atmosphere is fun too! I enjoyed being able to watch all the action in the kitchen! If you're looking for a new, fun place to enjoy different kinds of food...this is your spot!!

I do not know why this place has only 3 stars!! My experience here was great!! The service and food was absolutely amazing!! The ambiance was very relaxed. If you are looking for something different to try out definitely pay a visit to this place! Did I mention the dessert was awesome!!!

De-li-cious. To have ate here 3 times and the food has been fantastic. Esp the chicken sausage Flatbread. They're also dog friendly on their patio and provide us a bowl of water. The HH is at the bar or patio and they have an evening HH as well as a reverse one

If I could give this restaurant zero stars, I would.  It has a nice setting and appearance, but it is all looks. Our waitress was very nice and helpful but everyone else, especially the managers were soooo lazy. They would walk by past my empty water and look at the table and keep on trucking. My Bison Burger was not good and the fries were more than soggy. The Mexican Roll was pretty gross and tasted old. Everyone at the table was served at different times so we could not all eat without waiting for one another. Plus it took over an hour to get our food. Their service overall was bad and their food was even worse. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY.

Very poor service. The waiter was extremely slow and inattentive. When our food finally came it was cold and we sent it back. Not very pleased with management ( I can only assume they had a manager, but I never actually saw one). We certainly will never go back. There are too many good restaurants in Las Vegas to waste our time and money on this one.

So far, this is the best burger we've had in Las Vegas. 702 burger or the Crave burger were both top notch. Amazing flavor combinations well presented. Scottish  Salmon was well worth it. Fresh and not fishy tasting. They claim it actually comes from Scottish waters. Our experience was 5 star worthy. Waitstaff was good, attentive and knowledgable. We will be back. I don't say that often in this town. I'm not sure why this place gets only 3 stars on yelp. Our experience was a solid 4.5. Will be back later this month to see if they are consistent.

First impression: I loved the ambiance. The restaurant was beautiful and I loved the live entertainment! We were seated at a large booth by a friendly host. 

My table ordered the truffle fries which were so so good We could not get enough of the fries!!) and a sushi roll (Bamboo Bite) which was also very yummy:) 

Then came the main course. I got the Pesto Chicken Greek which was VERY bland and under seasoned. I did not enjoy my meal all. My family members got Beef Tournedos (which was just ok), Thai Shrimp Curry Rice Bowl (also under seasoned), Crave Burger which was good, and Chicken Caprese Rosa which was also pretty good. 

Overall, I was impressed by the ambiance and service. Our server, Michael was very friendly and attentive. Wait times were pretty long which was a little frustrating since the restaurant did not look too busy. Food was mostly under seasoned. I may come here again to try another dish, hopefully I will have better luck next time!
Great happy hour menu. Bradley the bartender is great. We left wolfgangs still hungry and we found a wonderful menu at the bar that was perfect.

I had the Poke', Yellow tail , and seaweed salad , all were excellent ! Display, quality of product , and service were perfect. The citrus pot of herbal tea , with lemon and honey, I believe it to be the best served in town, right up there with the four seasons.   My only suggestion is to get a selection of Wheat less Vegan deserts , then you will have me there all the time.  I had No Bad Reaction to any of their food.

Been here a few times and usually pretty good experience. Service is hit or miss. Nice ambiance and great menu selection. They have a separate sushi menu which I appreciate. 

3/26/16 I met my friend for a Saturday lunch. Not too busy. We were seated in booths in the bar area and were waited on by Jordan. He was a great server! Very attentive, funny, knowledgeable about the menu, refilled our waters often without being asked. We really liked his personality. 

I really like the menu selection. They also have a special menu (at least they did on 3/26) where they donated a portion of the meal price to a charity.

I was really wanting some seared ahi tuna but I wanted a tuna steak and a side of rice. So I looked at the menu and the closest thing I could find to what I was craving was the sesame seared ahi tuna salad. I asked the waiter to order just the seared ahi on a plate, and a side of jasmine rice. I was rather disappointed in the serving size of the tuna, very very thinly sliced ahi. Ah well.. it *IS* what I requested... I can't get upset about my bad choices, right? I will give the chef credit, it was definitely a very beautiful presentation, and the tuna was super delicious. I just wish there was more than 2 ounces of it! It actually melted in my mouth, it was quality sashimi. 

My friend and I also ordered the hummus appetizer, which was amazing!!!! I love the cucumbers served with the crispy pita bread, something about a really fresh cucumber and hummus that is so refreshing. The hummus was slightly spicy and had jalapeno in it. SO good. 

Everything is reasonably priced, with the tuna only costing $15. Great service and food, and an awesome location in the middle of downtown summerlin mall. Great place to stop before or after a movie, or to take a break from shopping.

Couple weeks ago, my wife and I had a bad experience at the hostess stand and after alerting management to our concern they went a above and beyond to apologize and took our concern seriously. We returned today for happy hour and it was awesome!  From the bartender to management to the HH specials =  5 stars. Can't wait to come back for dinner.

Horrible overpriced sushi. I've had better sushi at 7/11. Tried multiple items on the sushi menu and they all lacked taste and quality. Service was mediocre as the waiter seemed in a rush all the time and did not want to wait till we finish our sentence while ordering and got a bunch of things wrong , 

Never again

Did not expect a great meal because Crave was new  and I assumed that they were not 100% up to speed yet...  I was wrong. It was great!

The cocktail list was amazing! Expertly crafted artisan style.
Sushi was the best I have had in Vegas. (Not the "same old" boring sushi that every other place has. ) New quality ingredients and textures that create wonderful flavors that I had yet to experience.

The decor is upscale, warm, and welcoming.

For this price point... definitely a five star experience!

Food was ok, but the service was horrible. The waiter kept on spitting and was rude. They messed the food multiple times. If you can handle incompetent chefs and less than smart waiters I'd say go, but otherwise it's a bust.

I came here at 9pm, hungry. I ordered the philly roll, #9, dynamite, and parmesan truffle fries. They got my order wrong, but that's just minor. My fries were soggy and cold, the philly roll had lettuce in it (and it tasted gross), #9 roll (nothing special,lots of greens), and at all normal sushi restaurants the "dynamite" roll is a baked roll. Not this one. It has some kind of mashed fish with more greens. Have you ever been to Yardhouse? I would give Yardhouse food 5stars compared to this. This is Yardhouse like food, done wrong, and they don't know how to do sushi. DO NOT COME HERE FOR SUSHI. Food, one stars, service, two stars. Not my kind of place.

The service was slow and the food was disappointing. We went for lunch and from the point of being seated to having our check brought to us was slow. We finished our drinks before our appetizer came out, requested refills, ate our appetizers with empty glasses, finished our appetizers and still had empty glasses. I requested ketchup...it took 8.32 min. Take your timer and have your staff sit in front of a hot plate (mine was not so hot btw) and have them wait 8.32 min. You get my point. Now, had the restaurant been busy this would have been somewhat acceptable. It was not busy, there were several empty tables. I witnessed employees sipping out of a glass, joking with other staff (including my server) and basically taking their time. The food was served cold, it was underwhelming, over salted and on top of that, hard to enjoy due to the not so great service. Frankly, there are plenty of places to spend my money on food. This will not be one of them.
 
I'd like to end this with something positive...our server smiled a lot!

I was very hesitant to try Crave due to the reviews on Yelp. However, I was pleasantly surprised! I ordered the aloha roll and the King Kong. Both were delicious and I've tried a lot of sushi places in Vegas. The aloha roll was spicy but really well prepared. My boyfriend ordered the Mac and cheese. He said he really enjoyed it but was expecting it to be spicier with the addition of the sauce. We had pineapple mojitos which were also very good! I would definitely come back. They have a really big menu with a variety of choices.

I have eaten here several times and service/food always good. I think priced on the high side but has a not so normal menu. It offers twists on classics like the Mac n cheese(can you say yummy) to sushi. I go back because I do like the menu and service always good.

Second and last time at Crave. The host was friendly and we were sitted immediately.  Atmosphere was pleasant. A beautiful day to enjoy their patio.

For an appetizer we ordered the truffle fries. My wife and daughter loved them. For our entree we ordered the Crave burger, a sushi roll and Asian salad. Food was good not great. 

Unfortunately, it took over 45 minutes to get out food. Two tables next to us both ordered after us but received their food before us. 

When we complained to our server, Marcos, he said he would have the manager talk to us. Our food came, the Manger never did. Our server told us one more time that the Manger would come to our table. When our bill came, our server said all he could do was give us a coupon for a free appetizer on our next visit. The problem is there will not be a next visit. We where not looking for a freebie, we just wanted an acknowledgment that this is not the norm or an apology for making us wait. 

You can't tell customers that the Manger will come to the table and he/she never shows.  On top of a lunch Bill of $60 for three people  (no alcohol, one soda)

We've been here a few times. It's ok. Not bad, but not amazing either. 

We've even been for one of their romantic dinner specials. Plenty of food, but still just ok flavors.

And the place is pricey! Their happy hour "specials"...pricey. 

It is a fun place to bring a group. The service is wonderful and the atmosphere is nice.

Good food, terrible service. The hostess was not friendly at all. She told us we could wait outside for her to seat us. We awkwardly stood among the outdoor tables and waited for her to come out and eventually chose a table ourselves. The table had a teapot on it from a previous diner which nobody bothered to remove, the hostess "cleaned" the table with a paper napkin. The waiter was nice but didn't know a lot about the menu items. When our food was delivered we didn't have any flatware or napkins. We asked the expo for flatware and she returned with fork and knife. When we then said we needed napkins, which was obvious, she was clearly irritated. My boss, who I had brought to lunch, received the wrong item which she ate anyway. The waiter was kind enough to have the correct item prepared so she could take it to go. Coffee, tea or dessert was not offered at the end of the meal. The food was quite good but the poor service overshadowed it. Some of the employees at Crave need to look for a different field because hospitality is clearly not their strength. I will not return or recommend to anyone.

We went here during the week for lunch and it was great. 

Despite having a bit of a wait to be seated, even with a restaurant full of empty tables, the food was exceptional (we ordered a variety of sushi rolls) and this has by far become my favorite spot for mid-day sushi.
Had dinner here three times now.  Tonight we had Mahi-mahi again.  This time the Mahi-mahi was not prepared correct.  The rice and sauce was flat. Disappointed  with tonight's fish.
Very average.  Description of food was way better then the taste. I'm sure after a few months they will get their menu straight.

Came here the night before Christmas while in town, and it was amazing. We ordered sushi, and the bison burger among other things and everything was amazing! The service was amazing and for Wednesday night it was half off bottles of wine which we didn't know till the End! Will definitely come back when in town! My family loved it!

We walked in and asked for outside seating, got it right away.

We ordered drinks and our food after about ten minutes, I feel like that is a normal wait time. Our waitress was running around I could overhear other tables being quite needy (as in can you move my umbrella I wanted to sit outside but not deal with the sun or the heat or the birds ha) 

I asked for a recommendation on which fish dish was better in her opinion and she recommended the salmon but warned me about the mustard flavor. Honestly it was delicious so kudos. 

I think people need to give the place a chance it's just opened give it awhile to work out the kinks.

I'm not sure what the terrible reviews really stem from, but I'm sitting here now after a wonderful meal and will definitely be back. We were seated almost immediately, the menu has some very excellent looking meals, the service was spot on, and everything we had: artichoke crab dip, volcano roll, Crave starter salad, the crab topped filet (cooked med rare perfectly), and the Angry Dragon martini were all fabulous. I would say it could possibly be because we were here at a slightly later hour, but it was quite busy since it was the same night Red Rock had their fireworks show for their 10th anniversary. Like I said before, we will definitely be back.

Went here with a group from work. Food was okay, although not as good as I expected. Service was fair. I'll try then again but I'm not overly impressed. The restaurant wad comfortable with a nice decor.

Originally went to Public House, but it was a long wait so we stumbled upon Crave. It wasn't busy at all. The host greeted us (4) and continued finishing up whatever she was doing before we walked in, which kind of bugged me. We waited for about 2 min before she grabbed our menus and escorted us to our booth. Mind you, there was absolutely no one in the restaurant. We were the first guests of the day I assuming. We shouldn't have waited at all. We got seated and immediately our server greeted us and asked if we've been here before which we haven't. And began to give us a quick run down of the restaurant and menu. He was great. As soon as we ordered our food started to come in quick one by one. Also ordered a mimosa which only tasted the Orange juice. The appetizers were great (tuna poke) and the jalapeño poppers were delicious. When we got our entrees my husband ordered the béarnaise burger and I ordered grilled cheese with tomato soup. Mine turned out great (but who can mess up grilled cheese) as soon as my husband was about to take a bite from his burger our server mentioned that it was the wrong burger. He was served the Bison burger instead of the béarnaise. He apologized and offered to get him his original burger but my husband was fine with the bison burger. Which he said was really good. So no complaints. The manager even came to apologize about the mix up. When we got our bill nothing was even deducted for THEIR mistake. I mean the least they could do for their mistake on a slow day was take off a few dollars. But hey that's my opinion. All in all the food was good, the restaurant was nice and our server was great. I probably won't ever come back.

Just left Crave right now in huge disappointment. . Chicken was super dry. Wait time was long but of course It is their 2nd day opening totally understanding. . 

To MANAGEMENT: 
Please teach your staff to be more professional. I was eating at the end of the bar. My wife ordered a roasted chicken and I ordered a sushi boat while I was eating by your well station you have servers and bartenders giving guest checks right next to my plate invading my personal place and i just couldn't enjoy my food. We have your long black hair bartenders giving out free drinks to these two guys. Gosh, mind as well give me some free drinks too while she and her friends talk over my shoulder! 

Advice to everyone: please give this restaurant some time to improve trust me. The food quality and service is not worth the price yet.. But we shall wait n see..

Don't bother....seriously. Decided to go to "crave" on a Sunday night for a quick dinner with my fiancé. Did I say quick? Because it wasn't, service is extremely slow and not professional. But that's only the beginning, we first ordered crab artichoke dip and it tasted old. For entree I had a ribeye steak medium rare, came out medium with Luke warm mashed potatoes and barley edible Brussels sprouts. The "lobster linguine" is a joke, and tasted like death. Overall don't bother going.

Crave - a strong desire/ yearning for something (usually food, experience). 

This was one of the first few restaurants that opened in Downtown Summerlin and I remember this place being so busy it was so hard to get in. My sister made a reservation for lunch. A few friends of mine warned me about the taste of the food but it was too late and I'm pretty stubborn.

I just had a great shopping trip at my favorite store nearby. I was happy. We walked in and the host took us through a maze of high tables and high chairs. Did you not see my big shopping bags and yoga mat I was knocking things on the tables with? Why would you seat us at cramped tables when you have booths available? Lack of perception and care. Woosah!

CRAVE Grilled Chicken Salad:
Candied walnuts, goat cheese, field greens, grilled chicken breast with balsamic vinaigrette. I was leaning towards the Baby Kale and Steak Salad but this had the place's name in it so, it must be a must-have item, right? Not really. Everything that does not require cooking was ok but the chicken was dry. 2/5

Norwegian Salmon Salad:
Couscous, salmon, quinoa, pomegranate, pickled grapes and wilted spinach. The chef must not be good at checking for meat temperature and doneness. The outside of the fish was cooked but a big portion of the core was not. The manager got involved and offered another piece of cooked salmon. Why can't you just get it right the first time? 1/5

Nigiri:
My sister got salmon and escolar (super white). I didn't have any. The cuts looked good and the fish seemed fresh. I won't ever touch escolar due to its natural laxative properties - I don't need that!

I normally would try to be understanding of things. Mistake after mistake...after we were done, I was yearning for my bathroom. I had plans to continue shopping with my sister but I had to go. I guess it didn't matter if I ate escolar or not, the food here has the same effect. I don't CRAVE for pain and suffering that's for sure. Holy borborygmus, I gotta go!

Let me start by saying that this place has been open a few weeks, ample time for a new restaurant to get it together. We went in the middle of the afternoon, so it was not busy. We were sat right away, and our waiter came out shortly after to get our drinks in. We paid the $2 for the bread basket, and while it was adequate, the stuff that was supposed to be crispy was soggy. Just, no. it really should have been free. The runner who dropped it off took the time to explain what each of the breads were, by touching each one! Wtf! We had to laugh. The menu is extensive and appealing, but, They were out of the sandwich my boyfriend ordered, which seems to be a theme in alot of other reviews. He settled on a burger that featured a foie grais butter, and i got the steak sliders, both with fries. As we waited for our food, we had time to look around the restaurant, It was not busy at all, and it was obvious because there were waiters everywhere, standing around and talking in the middle of the restaurant, one guy even stood in the middle of the restaurant and texted on his phone! Gross! Some food got dropped off at a table near us and we could hear the waiter say to another one, "bet that food gets sent back, looked pretty bad." Umm what? At least we were entertained while we waited for our food. Our food comes, and yikes, it didn't look good. My sliders were sloppily put together, the crispy fried onion strings were really pale and under done, the steak had no flavor and the color of it was... Unappealing. There was no detectable juniper mayo, and the buns were underwhelming. There were about 9 soggy greasy French fries on my plate, and the temperature of my food was Luke warm. My boyfriends burger was ordered at medium well, it came out well done, and the bun was burnt to a crisp. His fries were also cold and soggy. There was no foie grais butter to speak of, either. I felt really bad for our waiter, he must know how bad their kitchen is because he brought us out fresh fries without us even saying a word about them. 

We left our waiter a nice tip, as it wasn't his fault, it is clear to me that he was trying his best despite a kitchen that doesn't seem to care.

Bottom line, this place needs to get it together quick, or it will be gone as soon as the other restaurants open. It seems poorly managed and the kitchen is a mess to say the least, zero quality control. For a $40 lunch, we would have had a better meal at 5 guys.

Crave was absolutely amazing. We got seated quickly for a Friday night.  The hostess was very nice. Our waiter was great. He recommended some great appetizers and we chose the calamari with an amazing sauce. We ordered specialty drinks that were unique and very tasty. I ordered the lamb meatballs with peppered fettuccine and my buddy ordered the scallops with corn and asparagus risotto. These dishes were outstanding. The service was great.  The atmosphere was perfect. Overall,  amazing.

This place is getting worse, from the first time i came not even a year, service sucks and food, really that   bad...the flatbread was cold when it came.  Will never come back, i threw my loyalty card.

I give the extra star for friendliness of staff.  That being said, they seemed understaffed when we dined there.  understandable considering how new it still is.  The food was tasty and somewhat prompt with above average execution.  The quality that seemed to be missing from everything overall was conception.  It comes off as if they are trying to execute multiple concepts at once, like a casual mid to upscale sushi bar/yardhouse that is part intimate - part sports bar-ish.  This creates a confusing vibe as it is not pulled together in its paradoxical ways, and IMHO they do not capitalize on such a mish mash of concepts with their menu items.  The other reason I give them four stars, is because despite these and more shortcomings, it is clear that they are putting time and effort into making it all work in a genuine way.  Whether or not they continue to develop it into a more refined version of itself, I applaud the effort they are clearly putting into it.

Loved the service, dinner and setting. Food was excellent and served quickly on a busy Friday night.  I had the poblano Caesar salad and husband had grilled halibut. Very nice upscale place for a date night. I like their beer and wine selection

There are some extremely harsh reviews compared to the experience I had.

We chopped up Aloha roll, scallop poppers, chicken sausage mac 'n cheese, a bread basket, & a tiramisu just power it down style.  Everything was above average.  I was amazed at how respectable their sushi was when they are also serving up standard food.  I don't know if I would necessarily come for just the sushi, but if you are "craving" a feastival it makes some sense.  The desserts stood out enough on their own that I could see coming back and firing on the $20 sampler.

My server was spot on the whole time with no delays.  Almost had a "white table cloth" kind of experience combined with your casual bar.  Big comfortable booths and ample outdoor seating.

I would edge to a five before I would click a three, but expect a bit more uniqueness / less of a chain feel to get the full five.  Definitely will be back at some point.

For being open less than a week, this restaurant is horrible. 6 hostesses at the front telling us it is a 45min wait only to be seated in a restaurant that is only 1/3 full. The meal took an insane amount of time to be brought to us only to have soggy luke warm fries. Sushi was average but not memorable. Dessert (a small mousse cup) took nearly 15 min to be served and STILL had a shortbread cookie in it in spite of us being told it was the only gluten free dessert and us making it clear we needed it without the cookie. Since we had to leave (since the whole meal took twice as long as necessary) The waitress merely suggested it be removed from the bill since it could take another 20 minutes to put mousse in a 2in cup. Absolutely absurd. Looking around the restaurant at any time one saw waiters just loitering around....so they are clearly not under staffed on the floor , maybe the issues stem from the kitchen that isn't even prepared to serve to a restaurant less than half full. I won't bother returning.

The service was pretty good and I would've called it perfect if the server would have mentioned that the crab cakes came with a side salad.  We probably wouldn't have ordered the house salad if we'd known. We tried the margarita flatbread, the crab cakes, the house salad and the butterscotch pudding. I guess being in the business myself has made me a bit of a picky diner. I wouldn't go back to Crave because the meal we ordered was not worth the $43 bill. The only thing I really liked was the crab cakes and I didn't think they were worth 15 or 16 dollars. They tried to put their own spin on butterscotch pudding. I didn't care for it at all. It was served with an oatmeal cookie than looked and tasted like it came out of a box. I didn't like the margarita flatbread either. The sauce tasted really strange and not pleasant. There's too many dining choices in that area to go back and give them a second chance. We were there on a Friday night and the place was dead so I'm thinking that I'm not the only one thinking the place is not worth the money.

From out of town. Great restaurant, wonderful staff, very friendly. The food was superb, excellent service, each course came exactly on time. The manager even came over to see if everything was okay. Will definately go back we we go back to Vegas!

Don't get your poke bowl here! The Mexican poke bowl was $18.95. I guarantee you can, get 2 medium bowls at a specialized poke place, with healthy portions of protein, toppings, and avocado. Not. Here.

The chicken apple brie sandwich looks mouth watering; presentation stands out in the food preparation here at Crave. But dry chicken without flavor within it, always tastes better with added sauce and thin sliced apples.

We had a good sized party of 7 adults. Even so, the restaurant did not seem that busy, but our food took a while. It was nice of our server to acknowledge our low on level drinks, he was really pleasant. I hope the tip I left all goes just to him.

The ambience gets a star and a half, our server gets a star. If our food weren't overpriced or actually had a flavor score, I may be more generous with my decision of the rating. At this point, the reason I found to possibly dine here again is for dessert and happy hour. Then again I'm positive there are other places that top the happy hour temptations. You'd have to have a strong sense of influence to have me try another menu item, and make me change my mind on 2.5**

No Bueno! The food is super expensive and not eatable, the service is mediocre.

Came to Downtown Summerlin to check out what everyone is raving about and decided to eat here because this is the only restaurant without a giant wait and on a friday night it was rather empty. Should have known that there's a reason for that! 

I ordered the salmon Spinach salad was no good. The fish was cooked rare, just the way I like it, but the the spinach was drenched in a pool of salad dressing and soggy. It was a puddle of green mud, and the dressing was sticky and too sugary. Also ordered 4 of the Kogi tacos and they were ok in flavor but Kogi beef is suppose to be big pieces of beef marinated with Korean BBQ sauce, not a puddle of shredded dry beef strings. 

Service was ok, bathrooms clean, parking was not easy.

Came here for lunch. We sat out on the patio which was interesting on a side note as all the booths were filled and they weren't seating in general at the tables in the center due to having to sit in direct sunlight, but we noticed that they had umbrellas so we asked to be seated at a table and had a umbrella moved to give us some shade. It took about 10 - 15 minutes before a wait staffer came to ask for our drink order, so as we waited we noticed a table of 3 women who order the hamburgers which looked really good, but what caught our attention was that all 3 of them ate their burgers with a knife and fork. It took another 10 -15 minutes before our drinks came and the waiter informed us that he was actually not the waiter assigned to our table and that our assigned waiter would come shortly to take our orders. It took another 10 mins before we saw our new waiter, so in the meantime we watched as a family of 3 insisted on being seated in a booth near us where the sun was shining directly at the table. The woman was pushing a stroller and we saw that there was a small dog inside, not a baby. When our waiter finally appeared to take our order we chose a starter of the Walleye cakes and then for entrees I ordered the Mexican sushi roll which was the only roll on their menu that had any hot spice to it, my partner ordered the Kogi tacos. As we now waited for our food, I noticed the lady at the booth looking distressed and covering her head with a magazine to block out the sun, she was frantically looking around for something. Her husband and son looked peaceful and were chatting quietly over the menu, the little dog in the stroller was soaking up the sunshine, finally the lady waved down a waiter and much to my surprise, asked him if he would move the umbrella that was at OUR table over to hers. Seriously?! Wow... The waiter looked confused and said that he couldn't do that as it was in use at OUR table. Ok, moving on now to the review on our food. The Walleye cakes were interesting but not enough to ever order again and personally felt they were overpriced at $ 13.95, they were just 3 little patties of wild rice and red onion with a tarter dipping sauce. My partner's kogi beef tacos were good with a nice flavor but a bit too sweet for my taste. My Mexican sushi roll was just eh....nothing memorable or different from any other standard roll. Overall, we spent almost 2 hours there with 3/4 of it waiting for service and food, if not for the side notes of "people watching" it would not be a memorable experience at all.

Just finished lunch here and definitely will not come back. A large party sat 10-15 minutes after us and got served first. When we finally got served, about 30 minutes after we ordered, my husband's burger was luke warm and the fries were almost cold. My salad came out wrong and I had to wait for them to redo it. They didn't offer us anything as an apology and charged us for the full meal. Oh and there was next to nobody in the restaurant so no excuse for how long we waited for our food.

Food was good service is horrible. After being told we would be text in 30 mins when our table was ready we went outside to wait. 40 minutes went by and no text, no one came outside. So we went inside and they said we wrote your number down wrong. Your table is ready.  We waited another 15minutes for our table. We finally ordered, meals were coming out except they for got to serve our main course. 1 hour and 30 minutes later we decide to go. Manager comes to our table to apologize stating the kitchen thought they served us our main course. We were given our meals to go. I was very disappointed seeing this was our first time eating here and it was Valentine's Day dinner. Someone needs to be fired as the management here and food expeditors were relatively nonexistent. Very disorganized.

Disgusting... I'm completely appalled at how they let dogs feast on their plates and let them urinate in the patio. It was my 21st birthday and it was nice up until I was eating and suddenly lost my appetite after smelling this strong urine odor. The dogs had an accident and I told the waiter about it. He brought out the manager and she told us that the patio is pet friendly. If I knew they let pets defecate and urinate on their furniture I wouldn't sit outside... And if I knew they allow the pets to eat off the same plates they serve to customers I wouldn't order anything!!! The manager offered to move us, a party of 9, instead of telling the couple with the two dogs to move since we had the problem with the pets emptying their bowls. After she spoke to us she spoke to the couple with the pets and started to pet their dogs... 

That was just a slap on the face, how dare you have the audacity to tell me to move and then pet the dogs that just pissed under and around one of your tables. 
Bad management. Disgusting place. They try to be upscale but allow URINE. Even if it is outdoor seating it's still a restaurant. I've yet to come across another restaurant that allows the same thing to happen.

I visited Crave for the first time tonight, and I have to say that it was a wonderful experience. The service and promptness was impeccable. Hayley was our waitress and she did a fantastic job, always making sure we were taken care of.

Servers were friendly and decently good with drink service. Food took forever and the portions were small. Ordered off the happy hour menu and it looked like a half portion for half price. Food was below average. The happy hour beer prices were decent. The mixed drinks were watered down and  came in like a 8 oz cup mainly ice. 

Outdoor patio was nice

Great locations as few restaurants are open at downtown Summerlin. Nice busy bar vibe but that carries into the restaurant and it becomes noisy.  The menu is very limiting unless you are there for sushi but it you really wanted sushi wouldn't you go to a dedicated sushi restaurant for added freshness. 

I ordered the lamb meatballs which was a special and sounded great, and luckily the waitress told me that many patrons had said how spicy it was. I ended up with the Asian salad.  Nothing special.  If you want bread its $1.95 for a basket that comes with soggy crisps, two small pieces of just ok foccacia and pita bread.  

Grand total bill was over $65 for a salad, two drinks...one so bad I could not drink it, and a pasta dish that I could have made at home 

The waitress was adorable and the design nice so maybe after they close someone can make something more out of the space. 

I won't be back
Our server ,Kayla, was an awesome bartender and always made sure we were great ! She was great, very attentive, and the reason we would ever come back! The food was amazing as well :)

I visited this restaurant last night for dinner and after waiting 25 mins for a table we were seated and our server was excellent.  Very attentive and quick.  We ordered wine which was very good and got to the table within minutes.  On the server's suggestion, my fiancé ordered the jumbo shrimp appetizer and I ordered the poblano Caesar salad, both very good but the jumbo shrimp was not hot.  Our mains came out midway through eating our appetizers which was quite annoying, we felt rushed.  He ordered the half chicken which was good, Jamaican flavours.  I ordered the farfalle pasta which was warm in the middle and cold on the outside when I received it.  I mentioned the temperature to the server and she offered to take it back to pan fry and I said no that's ok.  Our bill was $98 and we tipped $15.  A bit expensive for the rushed feeling but the flavours of the food was very good and I will give this new restaurant a chance to work out its kinks.

Wait staff was really nice, but the whole place was really disorganized. We were brought to our table which already had people seated at it, then, it was right by the kitchen which was very crowded and the wait staff was clearly didn't know the layout of the restaurant yet. The beer they brought me was warm from the tap and the food I ordered was way too spicy and the lamb meatballs were overly dry. It will be a long time before I go back.

I went to Crave yesterday, 10.13.2014 around 2 p.m.  I was told a 45 minute wait when there were empty tables all over the place.  We ended up sitting in the bar.  The service was awful.  When the server Julie  did come over she was writing everything down on an OUTBACK notepad and when I asked if the restaurant was part of outback she said the restaurant was too cheap to supply paper for them to write their orders on so she was using the outback notepads.  Her attitude was less than professional at the start.

 I ordered the sandwich with chicken, apple and brie and when it arrived after about a 35 minute wait the fries were cold and chicken cold.  I asked the person who brought me the sandwich if it was suppose to be a cold sandwich.  He said Yes.  When the server came over I asked her and she said no and took the sandwich back.  20 minutes later when everyone else had eaten the sandwich came so I ended up taking it to go.  The manager came over and apologized and said he would be back in a "few"  never did see him again.  The bill came; it was wrong and when I mentioned it to the server instead of wanting to correct it she wanted to give me the cash in lieu of fixing the bill so I would pay the bigger amount on my credit card.  When I asked her to fix the bill she slammed it on the table and said it would take a while to fix it.  Let's just say that this experience was not good and it will be a LONG time before I would try this restaurant again.  Too bad because it has a nice ambiance but the service and food has to improve.

Barely average and overpriced....two of us ordered the chopped chicken salad for lunch which sounded great on paper---chicken, bacon,  dried cherries, almonds, fontina cheese, avocado, etc.  We were served an exceptionally unappealing small mound of gray, barely seasoned chopped items that all shared an odd flavor that neither of us could figure out. We decided the wet, bland, shredded chicken may have been slightly "off" and left after two bites & paying our bill.  Our fault for deciding the 20 minute wait for a table at another restaurant located right above Crave was too long.  Our first clue that something wasn't right should have been all the empty tables during what should be a busy lunch hour on a Saturday afternoon.  Too bad, too. The interior is lovely and the staff is pleasant.

I am giving it three stars mostly because it was a terrible value.  The service was pretty good.  Not stellar but I had no complaints.  The food was good.  I mean really good but not OMG amazing.  We split a chicken salad which was the star of the meal.  14 bucks for a lunch portion salad.  We each orders the sushi lunch combo which is a midi soup, one 6 piece roll and 4 pieces of nigiri.  Again, it was all tasty and presented well.  14 bucks each for the combos.  Just ordered water to drink in order to better enjoy the Unami of the sushi.  Total bill.....almost 24 bucks each so all in 28 dollars for lunch.   To me, a bit overpriced considering the choices Vegas has to offer.  

I don't consider myself a cheapskate, so I think I am pretty accurate in my value ratio.  The food was good, not a single complaint.......it just wasn't 28 dollars of good.

Don't bother,I'm not sure what was worse,the service,the prices  or the food
Slow service ,overpriced menu and terrible food
Sent back the raw chicken pesto and choked down an ice cold burger

I really wanted to like this place, but was EXTREMELY disappointed! The server was clueless and gave us the wrong information. Ended up moving tables because sat by cold front door area. Waited for service,
but server never came back. Moved to bar and totally regretted that because the bartender was soooooo rude. Very short w us when he took our order like we were completely bothering him. We observed him with the other guests and he was the same way with them. Our food came out wrong and he blamed us! We showed him what we ordered on the menu and what was supposed to come, but he got defensive and was almost fighting with us. So crazy!!! I have worked in the hospitality industry for 15 years and have never seen anything like it. I will never go back to this place and will advise anyone who asks not to bother trying it. They need to start fresh with staff that is competent and actually want to be there. Your food can be great, but if your service is terrible, your restaurant is doomed to fail miserably...but the food was mediocre so good luck...

Came here with a group of 8. Took 25 minutes to just get our drink orders. 6 out of 8 orders were incorrect. I ordered the steak medium and it came out well done and the appetizer soup came out after my steak???

The waitress was very nice but you could tell the the mess the kitchen was in was taking its toll on her and her customers.

It almost felt that there was too many staff working Friday night and they would just form these little groups and chat for 5-10 minutes and then go off and do some work again.

Like I mentioned above most of what we ordered came out all wrong. Sushi orders were all mixed up, items we didn't even order were constantly being dropped off at our table. It was chaos and we pretty much rolled with the ouches and just had to laugh at how it was one thing after another. It was definitely one of the most bizarre dinners we ever had.

Oh and someone might want to let the hostess know she doesn't have to scream the large font headers on the menu to the patrons at the table when she seats them, I was near deaf afterwords and we could barely keeps ourselves from bursting out laughing.




I won't be returning.

Dined here over the holidays with a out of town friend. We arrived fairly early in the evening via the back door and were seated at a high top. I will tell you this, the chairs to the high tops stink! They are super uncomfortable and not a lot of room for your booty! The menu offers a huge variety of choices and the Happy Hour menu is decent.  Since it was happy hour, this is the menu we stuck with. We ordered up a sampling of sushi, miso soup, edamame for our first go round. I really appreciated our server advising us of which dishes she felt were the best. Note to self, never order sushi unless you are in a sushi house! I was sorely disappointed with the sushi and let my friend eat most of it. The miso soup had the oddest taste and I could not finish it. The edamame was ok but how much can you screw up edamame?? We then tried the lemon garlic wings and the mini pesto chicken flat bread which were actually quite tasty and these made up for the poor tasting sushi. The wine choices were the best part of my experience at CRAVE. The "Freakshow" Cabernet was so yummy. We had to have a couple of glasses. This is a wine I have always wanted to try and it did not disappoint. Overall the service was A++. Our server was attentive and friendly and we enjoyed talking about wine with her. As we lingered, the restaurant began to fill up with holiday shoppers and then they had to move our table which we didn't mind as "The Human Jukebox" was setting up to provide some holiday fun and entertainment. He made the night, by playing all kinds or requests from holiday to classics. I may go back again in the future to try an actual entree as the location of this restaurant is very close to where I live which makes it a convenient place to have a bite.

Had a great time at Crave two days ago.  Knowing Downtown Summerlin just opened recently and this restaurant is new, we were skeptical of what to expect.  However, Jordan, our waiter, was fantastic.  He suggested some great items, the Black Bean Soup and the Chicken Apple Sausage Flatbread, which were both delicious.  Back staff was always on top of refilling water and clearing plates.  We were there early, so were seated right away.  When we left, the restaurant was full and people were waiting to get in.  The bar was full and lively.

Overall, great experience and looking forward to going back!

Food was average, but definitely overpriced for what it is -- bar food and wannabe sushi. Ordered 2 appetizers, one roll, drink, and my  bill was $60. Probably won't come back unless they lower their prices or increase the quality of their food.

I didn't like this place at all!!!! Service is awful!!!! Went here today sit at the bar... I was starving and ordered right away, menu was just handed to me and have no idea how the portions  are, the salmon salad was decent and I had some crab cakes for appetizer which came out together with my salad... The bartender didn't even ask how my food was, the guy next to me ask me "how was the crab cakes" bartender was In front of me when I response "it's really salty" and he didn't say a word!  Bad bad service....

I have been to this restaurant twice and enjoyed the food and service both times. I had the same hostess both times I ate there and she was very courteous and respectful. For my first dining experience I had Channelle as my waitress. She was awesome! My drinks never got empty and she knew the menu quiet well. I'm not a sushi fan but she recommened I try it. I ventured out and tried the King Kong sushi and loved it! The pineapple baked chicken was a little dry but it  was very flavorful. However, the water was stale and gritty. I think a high end water filtration system might improve the taste.

My second trip I tried the guacamole and apple sausage flatbread. Both dishes were very good. I also had the bread basket. Although it was only $3 it would have been better if it was free. The pan bread and crispy flatbread were delicious with the homemade garlic butter. However, I was not a fan of the baked bread. I had Michael as my server this time and he was on point! He never let my drink get empty and put the order in so I didn't receive the appetizer with my meal. (I appreciate that).  

All in all this restaurant  has very flavorful food that is not too filling and serves much healthier food than many of the other  places in Vegas. I will continue to go here.

They have a good selection for lunch during the weekday. However, their service was just okay. They weren't busy since it was lunch on a Wednesday, but our server took a while to complete our order (he had to go back & forth to the kitchen to clarify a few things regarding the menu).

He might've been new, but my coworkers & I needed our order ASAP since we were there during our lunch break.

Despite this, I ordered the Crave Sliders & they were pretty good. The burger was juicy & buns were similar to a sweet Hawaiian roll. They were quite stingy on the fries though, but they were good. $12.95 for 3 sliders & fries.

Not sure if I'd go here again by choice, but, I'll try to give it another shot.

AMBIANCE: 4 - Really nice, really clean. Probably looks more upscale than it probably should.

SERVICE: 4 - Pretty awesome service. Our server was just really cool and helpful. He was always coming to check on us and see if we wanted anything more before happy hour ended. 

FOOD: 3 - It was okay. It wasn't the best, but one dish is worth mentioning: Sriracha Wings. I thought they were pretty good. A bit too pricey for happy hour, but pretty good. I also selected the Caprese Chicken Sandwich, which was pretty weird, by the way--otherwise okay tasting. 

Also, the happy hour drink section just wasn't worth it. My friend ordered one drink and I had to finish it because she didn't like it. All I have to say about it is that..that drink was not worthy. 

I see that they have sushi, but I think I'll pass. I have to give this place an overall 2 because of the menu. Honestly, Crave has potential, it could be a good American restaurant. But, their menu is so out there and weird that people are just not craving Crave.

Great experience!!! Service was superb! We loved the layout of the restaurant, there was plenty of space between tables and booths which made it seem more private and spacious. The decor was exquisite and impressive! Beautiful! The menu was really nice, with great choices in each category! The red curry pumpkin ravioli soup was absolutely amazing!!!! From flavor to consistency it was delicious!!! I had the chicken apple brie sandwich, which was really delectable! The combination of all the ingredients made for a really interestingly delicious flavor that I was thoroughly impressed by!!! I definitely want to come here again and try more selections!! 5 stars by far!!!

I was a little worried about going here after seeing all the bad reviews, but hubby and I got a coupon in the mail for a free entree and figured we'd check it out. So glad we did! The staff were friendly, the food was delicious, and the chef even subbed out mashed potatoes for a risotto that sounded amazing at no charge. I had salmon and hubby had jambalaya. Could not be happier with our meals!  

Service was great until the place got busy, and then slowed down quite a bit as other people stated. So yes, do not go there if it's busy and you are in a hurry. The staff is great, just overwhelmed when tables fill up. Be patient. Order another glass of wine. You'll be fine.

The food here is good and the atmosphere is nice. I'd definitely say that everything is a little bit overpriced. However, the staff is friendly and my friends & I had a good experience. I don't think I'll be 'craving' to eat here again but definitely wouldn't mind trying it out again.

Dining review: CRAVE Downtown Summerlin

Food was ok. Service....SUCKED. It was only 3pm and not busy. Waited approx 10 minutes to get seated basically since they were waiting for the new shift of staff to come in. Waited at our table for another 15-20 minutes for a server to arrive. We had plenty of time to figure out what we wanted so we did drink and food order at the same time. Drinks arrived (we only ordered water and never were given refills)....then waited well over 30 minutes for just a turkey burger and chicken stir fry to show up. We saw our server only 3 times in the hour we were there and had to almost tackle him to pay attention to us to get our tab. Manager walked around a lot and was on his cell. Not a good view when people are waiting for food or have that look like they need assistance but no one is showing up. We weren't the only table that seemed to be forgotten. Staffing needs some work and management could step up and help out more as well in my opinion. We probably won't be going back.
Turkey burger was average and the chicken in the chicken stir fry was thinly sliced like it could of been used in a chicken sandwich or BLT style sandwich.

I came here for Mother's Day with family. I give it a one star because of the service. I ordered the 702 burger and it was good but the service wasn't to par. Seating was fast our waiter was horrible. Pretty much didn't see him. We ordered our drinks and they came. I didn't have a problem going to the bar and getting lemon wedges that we had asked for... But when I got to the bar to ask the guy if they had bloody Marries along with my wedges he said yes and needed to see our ids witch I didn't have a problem with but when I turned to get my mom and dads ids he told me the server would help me with that... I didn't want to order from our server because he wasn't tentative as it was... So I said forget it no bloody marries I figured their lose... Also my dad ordered a salad and his burger came before his salad.like I said the food was good, the atmosphere is nice but the service is terrible... I don't know if I will be coming back... Pretty much killed my vibe...
Didn't disappoint!!..Crave is a must but grab a manhattan to chase down that burger!!...
Good Food, Great Service,  FRESH seafood, great Mac n cheese

CRAVE - We won a $100.00 Happy Hour Party for up to 10 people. 
We booked the party to celebrate a birthday.   We had outstanding service, the food was great and it just kept coming for over an hour they delivered a huge variety of food samplings. Pizzas,sliders,sushi, 
Pot stickers, lettuce wraps, amazing variety. Jeff and Joe  accommodated our need to be out of the bar area as a member of our party was not yet 21. Hayley our waitress was pleasant, helpful and provided excellent service throughout the evening.  They even allowed us to bring in a birthday cake for our celebration. Their Happy Hour prices are very reasonable. We loved the decor and we will return soon. Thanks CRAVE !

This place is sort of a hit or miss...  my 10 year old daughter and I went together.  It was not particularly a kid friendly restaurant. Upper scale atmosphere with overpriced, undersized meals... my daughter had an $18  (very SMALL portion) of fried rice with chicken.  It was yummy but the flavor (including kimchi) was a bit mature for kids..we weren't given a kids menu so I don't know if one was even available.   I ordered the cioppino.  $27 for what seemed like a few tablespoons of broth, 2 nice sized shrimp, 4 over- cooked mussels and a few tiny scallops.  I'm quite aware that I live in the land of buffets and oversized portions but this was a bit extreme in the opposite direction.  I sent back the cioppino and ordered the bison burger.  Yes it was filling and delicious, but again...$$$ plus extra for the fries. Drinks ...also pricy.  All in all not a great experience for me and my girl.   Perhaps better for a romantic date if you are not concerned with price.

Simply not worth the excessive time or the calories. Despite three separate reassurances from our waitress and two managers that a computer glitch was the issue, it took 2 hours for three people to receive some bland sushi (that was not what was ordered - and the spicy tuna roll contained lettuce?!) and the salmon plate. Chopsticks took another 10 minutes.  Each dish finally arrived - in separate 15 minute blocks - and was unremarkable, however, they comped the meal.

It was okay.  Seated quickly...a plus since it was Friday night.  First time here.  Really needed more guidance on specialty entrees  and menu.  Other then specials for charities really didn't get any--note to wait staff.  Drink was Strong!  Appetizers good.  But needed to leave before entrees arrived - because drink was Strong.  They we're packed for take out.  Ate them for lunch, but found them to be nothing special. 
Have to admit it is a large beautiful place.  Wish the food would match.

Went to happy hour with a couple friends today. Food was good. Especially liked the Parmesan truffle fries and pork dumplings. The Aloha roll, on the regular menu, was delicious also! Our favorite drink was the Kinky Mojito!!!! 

Of special note...our server ended up being one of the bartenders named Michael. He was very courteous and provided professional service. In addition, he went above and beyond the call of duty...my friend left her glasses on the table when we left, we had told him we were going for gelato (why we didn't order dessert there). He walked all the way to the gelato place just to bring her glasses! Michael deserves recognition for his extra effort in exceptional customer service! Thanks for taking such good care of us!

1) Front desk girls are TERRIBLE! 40 min wait at lunch with tables open. 

2) The servers are COMPLETELY CLUELESS! 

3) The managers look LOST! 

4) The bar is a constant mess and totally unorganized! 

5) The food is better at Olive Garden! 

DONT WASTE YOUR TIME HERE!!! 

I promise you will regret it!!! 

They will be out of business by this time next year!



LOL....I received a "compliment badge" by someone from CRAVE and they tried to get rude because I left a negative review!!! Lmao!!! How about you educate your staff, instead of arguing with your customers! You asked me if, "I knew how to run a restaurant" in your rant....I'm a JWU graduate...and I clearly know more than you! I had one of the worst dining experience in your establishment! You can look at my record here on YELP...I rarely complain! So please stop harassing customers Shawn and focus your time on improving your Yelp rating! 

Thanks  lol
This is great food at a fair price in a fun part of town! They did a great job hosting our work party, too.

The food was hit and miss the last time I ventured here.  The service was terrible and the reception was as bad as it can get.  3 minimum wage females with attitude.   I was at a movie and thought I would give it another try.   Hostesses are clueless. ..  the only reason they are busy is the other sit down dining are not open yet.  I walked out as they just don't know how to treat a customer.  No hello, no I will be with you in just a moment,  nothing but attitude.   They were too busy with their chit chat than doing their job.

I predict closure if they don't fix the lack of service as MTO,  California Pizza, Wolfgang Puck and Grape Street will pull 90% of their current business.    

Owner and Management,  make changes before you loose your investment.

Sushi, cheeseburgers, and pasta all served with the class of a fine dining restaurant. This is like a wealthy stoners paradise. 

I came here with a table of ten on their official opening day during the Downtown Summerlin insanity. Turns out this was the only restaurant that was open for business and you could tell.
