Crave was bursting at the seams; the bar was overflowing with the Real Housewives of Summerlin, the patio had the aging bros and most likely the ex-husbands of the fore mention housewives, and the dining room was a hodgepodge of suits, children, and hungry looking patrons. The front desk was backed up and a little unorganized, we had reservations for 8:30pm, but weren't sat until about 9:15pm.

The food options at Crave can be confusing, but in a good way. As I read the menu I wanted a little bit of everything and when the waiter took our table's order I noticed everybody must have felt the same way. We ordered sushi, fried chicken, sliders, calamari, and a Margherita flatbread. I only ended up trying the sliders and calamari... 

The slider was very good, a seared piece of pork belly with kimchi, placed on a very soft dinner roll. Full of flavor and the pork belly wasn't too fatty. The calamari was forgettable and it was served with a jalapeño aioli which I though was good, but it didn't quite fit with the flavor of the calamari. This would be better on a sandwich or burger, not with a seafood dish. 

After we finished our appetizers we had about 35 minutes of waiting before our food was finally served. I ordered the Bison Burger with fries and when it finally arrived it was cold and you could tell that the fires had been siting for awhile, they looked wilted and old. I was starving so at this point I really didn't care about the food's temperature, I just wanted to eat. The Bison Burger was very tasty even at a lukewarm temp. This chunk of beef came with a healthy slab of pork belly on top of it and a tasty aioli. I can only imagine was this must taste like straight out of the kitchen. 

There's a lot of things to consider in this review:
- It's their grand opening day. There's going to be hiccups and as a customer and former restaurant worker, I understand this
- They were the only restaurant open at the time. I don't know of any place that can feed about 2,000 people within a few hours and not mess up once or twice
- Our server was solid. We always had fresh water and drinks in front of us
- The manager came over and checked on our table multiple times
- The place was crackin', I mean slammed! So, the fact that we only waited 35 minutes for our meal really isn't that bad. If you have good company, and we did, time will fly. 

This review is really a 2.5 stars, but the service pushed to a 3 star. I will be back in a few months to see if they have worked out the kinks.  

JUST A NOTE - If you give brutal reviews to restaurants on their opening day. You're probably an insanely critical jerk with everything in life. Just sayin'

Last night was our first time going here and we came with another couple. We expected this place to be amazing and to our disappointment it wasn't. When we got there we had to wait a few minutes to be seated. Even though you can clearly see many tables open. The service wasn't great but wasn't bad either. The server took a while to refill our drinks. When I clearly saw them just talking and messing with each other. 

The restaurant itself was nice and lively. The decor was simple but vibrant. The staff wasn't very approachable. They were stern and not friendly. 

The food here is over priced for the quality and portion. I ordered the Steak Slider and my friend ordered the Pork Belly Slider both came with 3 sliders each. The size of each slider was probably 2x2 inches. It was not filling unless you went there not hungry. My Steak Slider was slightly tough so I'm guessing they used a flank steak for it. The only thing that was good with my order was the pickled jalapeño. My boyfriend ordered the Grilled Bistro Steak. That was not worth $30. There was like 8 pieces of steak that did not have flavor what so ever. Even steak on it's own has flavor and that did not. My friend's boyfriend got the Bison Burger. That was cooked well but for the kind of restaurant they made the place seem to be they use the cheapest type of lettuce for the burger. Anything else would have been better than what they used with it. 
We for sure will not be coming back here again.

This review is for everything you look for in a restaurant.  We came for dinner.  Seated immediately.  Place is big, clean, decorated trendy.  Not loud.  Friendly server.  Drinks - pear martinis - perfect pour, delicious.  Drinks came out quick.  We each ordered a Poke bowl.  One traditional, one Mexican.  So tasty, light, healthy.  They say these are for a limited time - I hope they keep them on the menu.  Food came out quick.  And we each got a dessert - coconut cake and the french silk mousse.  What I love about this place - nice size portions.  No gluttonous, over sized dishes.  Go the strip and eat like a pig there.  Every restaurant here doesn't have to be VEGAS SIZED.  Perfect size portions. You don't need a doggy bag to go.   It's a great place.  Want to go back and try Happy Hour at the bar next. :)   What more can you ask for at a restaurant?  Service, prices, food, drink.  All A+.

We were here on Saturday night, it was fairly busy but the wait wasn't long and the hostess was very nice (they even opened the door for us). I had the mustard salmon and my husband had sushi both were amazing! The wine selection was also good. The only complaint is it was kind of chilly in the restaurant.,other than that the food and service was excellent.

Wednesday night we went crave restaurant for dinner after work. In my research they close at 11. We got there around 9pm. Hostess show happy hour just started.food came quickly but 30 min later wireless ask us anything else for last call.... They close at 10pm so we ask box and left ... All food was very salty,sushi rice was hard ... Sea Bass was very good !

I've enjoyed a few lunches and a happy hour here with the girls but last weekend my boyfriend and I came here for a wonderful dinner.  5 stars for the atmosphere, service, bottled wine menu, crab and artichoke dip (with chunks of crab!), sea bass, and pork tenderloin dinner.  The only thing I would not repeat is the caesars salad.  The only thing it had in common with a traditional caesars salad was the lettuce.

For sure one of the best dining experiences I've had in a while. Hostess was awesome, sweet and welcoming and our server Isaiah was on his game. I had the chicken, Brie, and apple sammy that was   pretty damn yum. Best part they brought us out goodies for our anniversary!

Crave is great. We went for dinner early before a movie, so we were one of only a few tables.  Our server was a delight, made great recommendations, and checked in often. All the food was delicious, and I was especially excited about the veggie sushi platter, which was really impressive. Portions are good and not overwhelming.  It is a little on the pricey side, but there are many reasonable options. We'll definitely go back.

Been here a few times. I have to say the new Poke' bowls are awesome. I had the Mexican bowl. It had sharp lime soy glaze flavor and the tuna was bright red, fresh and tasted like it was just reeled in from the ocean.

TRY THE NEW POKE BOWLS. YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED. ; )

Sorry , but when we spend $100 on a lunch for 4 people , I get super offended when I'm charged .75cents for an iced tea refill.   I don't appreciate being nickel & dimed in an already overpriced restaurant and we won't be back.
I just went there there for lunch today.  The food was good and it was a great price.

Food was excellent. We ordered scallop shooters, lemon garlic wings, Bison burger and the Lamb meatball pasta. All had fantastic flavor, no complaints there. 

But the service........ Terrible. 
First, we waited 10minutes after getting seated for someone to notice us.  Food took a long time to come out even if they were about half capacity. They served us the wrong food. I had to stand up to ask for water 2x. It was hard to get the servers to pay attention even if a lot of them were just standing around.

So we tried out Crave last night, and since it's new, we weren't expecting perfection. We made a reservation, so we didn't have to wait. We were seated and  promptly greeted and our drink order was taken. When we did order, our waiter (Michael B, who was great) did let us know the kitchen was running slow, and yes we did wait about a half hour for our food....but the food was amazing! I got the mac and cheese with chicken apple sausage, that was soooo yummy! My friend got the scallops which he said was great ( I'm not a seafood fan). The best part was dessert. We got the coconut cake and the walnut praline cheesecake. OMG the coconut cake was the best I ever tasted! I'm still craving it lol! So please don't be put off by the bad reviews and the long waits. This place is a winner and a welcomed addition to Summerlin.

Crave just makes it to three stars by the grace of a person who walked by and gave me a $10 gift card as he and his party were leaving.  Otherwise, it would be two stars.

I made a reservation for 7:30 and arrived on time.  I accidentally came in the back door via the patio and was shown to the hostess podium by a nice woman hereafter referred to as NW.  After checking in at the podium, and asking to be seated on the patio, NW took me outside and said that all the booths were filled but I could have any table.  I chose a table that was set for only two people to minimize removing place settings.  NW left menus with me and said that my server would be with me shortly.

The server brought the menus and took my drink order.  He seemed a bit overwhelmed with the number of tables he was covering but he eventually came back with my iced tea and took my order.  I asked his advice on the entrée and I took it.

Quite some time went by and NW had come by and said, "Didn't *server* get here yet.  I told NW that he had taken my order.  After another wait, the server came out with two drinks for another table and my cup of tomato soup.  He first stopped to give the drinks to that table and before he got to me, NW said, "Didn't he bring your soup?  I thought I saw him with it."  I told her it was on his tray and she was happy.

I had just started my soup when NW came out with my entrée.  She apologized for how soon things were appearing.  I was very close to telling her to take it back, but I thought it would sit under a heat lamp and then be brought back out.  I made a split second decision to let her leave the dish with me.

The tomato soup was very good but I wish I had more time to enjoy it but I hurriedly finished it to get to the lamb meatball pasta.  When I tasted the pasta, it was still hot so I cut a little break for that.  Perhaps if the place was busier things wouldn't have been so quick.

The menu describes the pasta this way--poblano cream sauce, red pepper, goat cheese, black pepper fettuccine.  The poblano cream had a nice zing to it and the small amount of goat cheese could be used to cut the heat if you wanted.  The meatballs were kind of dry.  The poblano cream sauce and the pepper fettuccine made the dish, flavor wise.  The fettuccine had become stuck together and I was given no spoon to twirl the pasta on.  Since the soup dish had not yet been cleared, I used the soup spoon to twirl the pasta but it came in very long lengths because of this sticking together.

For dessert, I got their S'mores brownie, a long brownie topped with marshmallow that was brûléed and had three thin ginger snap cookies placed in the marshmallow.  There was also a dip of marshmallow ice cream.  As it turned out, dessert was the best part of the meal.

NW came by a few times to see how things were and my server was around more often as the patio emptied of all patrons except for two dog hugging young women who took up a lot of my server's time.  

For the experience, the food would have been better if it had been timed better.  There's no excuse for NW to bring my entrée when she already knew I had just gotten my soup.  What was she thinking?  

The place is Downtown Summerlin priced (this may become the local version of "Strip prices) and without the $10 discount card, the place wouldn't merit the 3 stars.  Too bad, because for the most part, the food was good.  They've been open about 6 months and they still don't have their act together.  That's sad.  It's also the only time I'll dine there.

I've been to this place twice now. Seems that the food and service are hit and miss. The dishes are tasty and the menu has a great selection. Ambiance is great. However I went for lunch and the food was just OK - some great some had to be sent back. The restaurant was dirty (especially the floor - looked like it hadn't been swept or vacuumed in a week). Beer was a little pricey for the quality of place. Overall I'd try somewhere else first and use this as a backup. Good concept, not so great execution.

I was thoroughly impressed with the service we received today from Cassie.  

It was a beautiful but hot memorial day lunch hour so we opted to sit out on the patio.  Our server Cassie was very attentive to our needs from making sure our water glasses were always filled to going out of her way moving our table under the umbrella as the shade shifted. 

As for the food, I was thrown off by the menu which seemed to be all over the place.  The cuisine is "American" and Sushi. We ordered various dishes from sushi to macaroni and cheese to a burger to short rib tacos and my pork belly on fried rice.  See what I mean? 

Overall,  the food had good flavor but I've had better.   My rating is mostly based on Cassie and her service.  If it weren't for her,  I'd only be giving this restaurant 3 stars but the fact that she ran all the way to the parking lot in 90+ degree heat to hand us the sunglasses that my niece forgot at the table,  just earned themselves an extra star. 

Thank you for your exceptional service!
The worst food I've ever tried. Very bad experience. I won't go back. The waiter was great by the way.
Came here with some friends and everything was delicious! Will definitely be back... Ordered the chicken caprese rosa and risotto balls to start and both were amazing! Loved the cute live music too
The cheesecake is amazing. Everything else was an expensive disappointment. The service was lackluster, the food uninspiring.

After a full day of shopping at the new Summerlin shopping mall we had a good appetite. There were several new restaurants in the area but Crave caught our attention.  The outside was very attractive and the menu had a good selection to choose from. We walked in and the restaurant was decorated in ultra modern décor. The hostess greeted us and asked if we had reservations.  Never understood why this  question is asked because there were empty tables available. My wife asked the hostess to sit us in a nice area.  She guided us through the restaurant to our table which was a booth in the middle of the restaurant. We had a view of the bar and the outside. The waitress came to our table and greeted us. She immediately asked us for our drink order and asked if we wanted to start off with appetizers. The waitress suggested that my daughter order the raspberry lemonade. My wife and I ordered a bottle of wine.  I knew that I was going to order a big meal so we skipped the appetizers even though they had a good variety.  

The waitress returned with our drinks.  The raspberry lemonade looked delicious and was. Then she presented the wine by displaying the bottle and opening it for us to taste and proceeded by filling our glasses. She left allowing us to review the menu. The menu had a good variety, beef, chicken, pork, seafood, pasta, sushi, sashimi and a section of chef signature dishes.

The waitress return to take our orders, my daughter order the marinara and pasta with french fries from the kids menu.  My wife ordered the sea bass and I ordered the rib eye steak.

Within 15-20 minutes our entrees came to the table which had a nice presentation and looked delicious. We preceded to eat, however I did not have a steak knife and my wife was missing her knife. We stopped our waitress and requested the knifes. The waiter should have notice or asked us if there was anything else we needed. Our waitress brought the knifes to the table and apologized.  

We began eating our entrees.  My wife thought that her sea bass was cooked to  perfection, light and moist with the right amount of seasoning.  The pasta with marinara was a little gummy but the french fries were crisp on the outside and soft in the center. My steak was very good, medium rare with good flavor, charred brussel sprouts and creamy mashed potatoes. 

The waitress checked on us several times and refilled our wine glasses which shows that she was trained properly.  At the end of our meal the waitress returned and asked us if we wanted dessert. Unfortunately, we were stuff.

Overall the experience was average because the restaurant was relatively new and need some refinement.  It would have been nice if they offered complimentary bread at the table and a little more attention to detail. We will be back again to give it another try.

This place is absolutely amazing. I am a server and can easily find something to complain about but this time there is NOTHING! Our first time here of soon to be many times. We will be back. Merissa was our server and she was so nice, very helpful. She made a new experience so much better. Very initiative and great service! The rib eye and avocado roll was to die for!!! I can't wait to try new things and come back! You will not regret coming here!

I hadn't heard of Crave but as a girlfriend and I were already at Downtown Summerlin to see a movie, we decided to go there for happy hour and a quick bite to eat. Our server Nicholas was a real joy. His suggestions for food were excellent and there's no doubt that his service is the reason we'll go back. We tried a couple of flatbreads and the honey sriracha wings. It was a perfect portion for the two of us. We had some happy hour cocktails, that went down a treat. The atmosphere was lovely, it had a pretty trendy feel to it, and was really spacious. All in all we had a great time and would recommend to our friends.

Just checking up on my yelps and a follower asked me where I've been and I remembered a yelp I forgot to do so for all my fellow yelpers out there that want a great place to dine and amazing service crave is a great spot to check out. I'm actually surprised and shocked on the amount of good places to eat in this downtown Summerlin but wow crave is definitely a shoe in to take first place. Everything about the place is 5 stars even the bathrooms. I usually hate waiting but when Miranda is on I have someone to talk to that'll make time fly by and somehow she can deal with all my questions and still take care and give other guest 5 star service she's an excellent person to have for when you first walk in. The shoe in for greatest sever alive and the most personable server I ever met is Mikey D. Not only does he remind me of home but he makes me feel like I have a great friend every time I step in to the place and I have been here plenty of times happy hour wings is something I live for some days. There a lot of great servers on but when I come and he's on that's who we will request. For the days we come in and we want the bar there's only one person we want back there and that's Andrea she has the most amazing wonderful personality and her smile can move mountains. The fact that she can keep up with all of these different conversations and still have positive input and feel like she's just part of your group makes me salute her. Crave you definitely have an all star cast and as long as you keep on with your 5 star employees which everyone is you'll stay on top of my list. Thanks for being a great place to be

It's truly a hit or miss.  I've been to CRAVE 4 times now.  I went there yesterday around 2 pm.  There were no more than 4 tables and 2 servers, yet the service was poor.  I asked for items and did not get them.  Our server never asked us if we needed anything.  On top of that, the kitchen was incredibly slow.  I ordered the premium bento box.  The dynamite roll was mediocre.   Best part was the fresh fruit... the funniest part of my experience was when we complained to the manager, while he gave us our check, and I noticed that my table was charged an extra plate!!  Thankfully the manager gave us a discount.  It's really the least he could do. Management really needs to improve their system and service.  It's not worth your money or time due to the inconsistency.

Considering going to Downtown Summerlin is like taking a road trip for me, finding a new exciting place to eat was part of the thrill in my journey. 
The menu at Crave was unique and enticing, so, Allison S., myself, and my other half Brent S. decided to give it a try. 
Off top, the service was great. Maybe a bit overstaffed due to the recent opening, but every face was smiling and welcoming from the host, to the chef, to the wait staff. 
Between us, we ordered edamame, a couple sushi rolls, and jumbo shirmp. I also endulged in a martini, because they offer blue cheese stuffed olives and I just can't ever seem to turn those down. We weren't looking for full meals, just something to hold us over.  
So basically, in my own humble opinion, this place has mediocre food, an overpriced menu, and a faux gourmet intention when you are getting nothing of the sort. 
Why should an 8pc. sushi roll with spicy tuna and shrimp be $19?! Because I am in the new mall in Summerlin, eh, NO. 
Why should 4 appetizers and a cocktail cost $80!? Not my style. Was the food decent, sure. I would eat all of it again. But I would never pay that much for it. I could easily go to Ra, or Sushi Roku, for gourmet sushi, AND IT STILL WON'T BE $19 A ROLL!! 
The decor was beautiful, the cocktail was great. (other than the fact that only ONE of my olives was stuffed, LAME!) But remember, Wetzels Pretzels is still 500 feet away, and Crave, you are not good enough to charge the prices you're asking. Rent must be super high at this location. Sitting between MTO (which has GREAT prices) and a Wolfgang establishment, where its worth the price, my final words for Crave, GOOD LUCK.

The atmosphere was nice and very warm. Great food. I had some artichoke dip with flat bread. Then I had 9th Roll sushi roll...it had tempura shrimp with avocado and raw salmon on top and rolled in rice and cucumber. Then went out of their way to serve my friend a bday cake and ice cream for her birthday.

Eh. I had high expectations for this place and was really excited because it's just down the street from my house. Everything we ordered was...just OK. We tried if you appies and a few entrées and everything was pretty mediocre. Everything we had was great in concept...but the execution just wasn't there. The sushi dish (yellowtail carpaccio I think?) was missing something. The sliders too - sounded really good and all the ingredients should have worked...but they just didn't stand out. 

The prices were on par for Downtown Summerlin, not cheap, but not strip prices either. 

I'll go back and try it again, if only for the location and the ambience. It has a good atmosphere and I'd go back to check out the date night menu. 

I think with a little tweaking and attention to detail, this place could be a lot better.

OMG!!!! Kayla is an amazing bartender! She read my mind and came up with best cocktail possible for me!!! She was super nice and friendly, her personality lit up the room. I'm gonna be back! 5 star service Bravo Kayla!!! bravo!

My wife and I had a fantastic time Friday night at Crave - we eat alot of restaurants in Vegas and also base alot of dinner outings on Yelp reviews. I heard some good things about this place but with a 2.5 rating I was a little skeptical. This rating proved to be wrong. The whole night was perfect from the food and decor to the waiter (Marianna). Starting off with bread basket, sashimi (very fresh yellowtail)  and crab cakes the cakes were very tasty and the jalapeno tartar sauce went perfect with them. Dinner was Mahi Mahi for my wife and I had the Sea Bass. Both pieces cooked perfectly and the sauces that accented both were spot on. The flavors all just worked perfectly together on both plates. Desserts were tiramisu and I want to say a hazelnut pudding? Cant recall but it was a bit grain for my taste, but the flavor was good. Tiramisu was not too traditional but again really flavorful. We ended the night with Almond Coffee which was really a great ending note and was pretty damn good - we had to have a second one before heading out.

On a side note Drinks were all perfect from the bar and their mixed drink menu was pretty good - ginger lime Margarita is worth trying. The biggest plus of the night was our waitress Marianna - probably one of the best we have encountered at any restaurant and was on top of everything throughout the night. From recommendations paired with drinks to explanations of each dish she was all around worth asking for on your next visit. 

Dont base this place on the 2.5 stars it has right now - these will go up. There was obviously some issues upon opening which any restaurant will have - especially when you try to match ticket times from a main kitchen to a sushi kitchen. I was a chef for years in Las Vegas and observe what goes on in restaurants very closely when I visit - they have obviously pulled it together here - its worth the visit.

Very nice, clean and welcoming restaurant. Craig was our server and he was awesome. Started off with truffle fries, buffalo wings and a couple pieces of yellow fin. My dad's dynamite role was "the best ever" but my steak was way over cooked. Great beer selection.

Just order simply grill steak with medallions option didn't like it because the medallions ONLY 3!!! With some potatoes and rainbow califlower and honestly too expensive for such 3 little pieces of meat....for having meat in your dinner menu it should be at least good pieces of neat for the value $$$$ so sorry
This place has definitely redeemed itself since it first opened. Sean, was an amazing chef. Michael was a great server. They took care of us and me and my best friend had a great night here!

First time here and I'm very impressed.  Great atmosphere great sushi.  Had the aloha roll (it was awesome).  Very diverse menu so the no -sushi crowd can be happy while we dig in.  Sake menu limited but great  drink menu.  Fresh, quality, size of the nigiri.  I will be back!!!

What an great experience at Craze.  Staff was on the ball with food and drinks during busy holiday season.  About three to four  Christmas parties were going on and staff was amazing to watch. They were very attentive to us and the parties. Great customer service and cant wait for our next visit.

The seabass was so good think we will be back next week.

Went here for dinner with friends and family visiting from out of town. The food was good. Our service was just okay though; didn't spill one drink, but two drinks at different times, and we never received any refills on water.

We ate at Crave last night, expecting a nice dinner to enjoy with our friends for their last night in town.  The hosted Chyna was lovely, but beyond that the service was lacking.  I wish we had chosen another restaurant.  We had been to Crave once before and because our food was really good, we had forgotten that we  had almost left due to the extreme long wait for a server to even acknowledge that we had been seated.  On this night, our 3 children were dining with us and from the time we sat down until we asked about the progress of our food, it had already been over a 40 min. wait.  A good waitress would have submitted our children's orders immediately.  When we inquired about the food the waitress Julie stated that she didn't enter our food order until 10mins after the appetizer was brought out - only one appetizer was order and it didn't come out for over 20mins.  Her remarks were said in a snarky tone, as if we should be grateful for her failure to realize small children were at the table.  Children have a hard enough time waiting 20mins let alone the almost 60+mins from the time we were seated to receiving their food.  We appreciate they brought fruit bowls to the table for the kiddos, but the fruit was sour and was old, hence none of our fruit loving kids ate the fruit provided.  We watched our plates sit under the heating lamps for over 20mins before being served, I imagine they were waiting for the other meals to be completed.  Just in case you were wondering the restaurant was only about 1/4 full and we seated about 7:15.  When the meals arrived to the table, we were very hungry.  My Bison burger was tasty, however luke warm, as was the rest of meals at the table.  The kids food was barely warm.  A manager, Joe,  passed by with plates in hand for another table, asking how are meal was...we didn't have time to actually answer him, nor was his question sincere.  He stated he would "be right back" but that was not the case.  A few customer service 101 tips: When something goes wrong, ie, slow, slow food service, especially for children, don't give or make excuses...simple say you are sorry and correct it quickly.  As a bonus bring the kids some chips, bread...anything (edible) when there is an extended wait.  If you want to ask your customer how there food/experience is, be genuine and have time to listen.  I have a Crave loyalty card and I really want to love this place, there are some great tasting dishes, the cooks are clearly not the issue.  However, I don't for see us going back or recommending it to friends because the restaurant truly lacks great servers and management.

Went during lunch hour on a Friday and was surprised at how empty it was.  I ordered the Vegas Roll and my husband had the mac and cheese with chicken as recommended by our waiter.  Both our meals were amazing!  The service was awesome as well.  We asked our server if they offered a military discount and he stated they did but later discovered they actually didn't.  He then gave us a discount that he picked up.  The only complaint I have is that when we were seated the hostess' dress was so short she was literally holding it down as she walked us to out table.

Update on the update. 
Social media person keeps letting me know that management will contact me.  Because they don't. It's only making me more upset.  Total disregard for their customers
Update almost a year later.
I received a message last week via FB asking for my contact info from Crave.
The message asked for my contact info so new management could contact me regarding our horrible experience.  Well as expected. No one has contacted me.
I had almost forgotten about Crave which was a good thing. Then Crave opens the old can of worms.  The worst customer service I've experienced in years
Fathers Day Dinner
Priceless
We Ordered wine
20 minutes later told there was no wine glasses.
Our Salads sat over 10 minutes at the pass.
We Had to get server to bring them to the table. 
the server Never brought steak knifes nor horseradish. We were supposed to cut our meat with a dull regular knife.
Our granddaughters order sat at the pass for over 10 minutes prior to getting our meal. We had to go up and get it ourself after everyone else had their meals. 
Server was pretty much non existent
Friend Asked for 2nds on prime rib & never received it. Mind you it was all you can eat and there was so much fat she only had a couple of bites from the first piece.
Childs is meal advertised as free on Sunday's. They charged us for it.
We Ordered 2 desserts 5 minutes later we were told the creme brûlée was sold out
We Never received 2nd dessert. 
They didn't deduct anything from the bill.
Food presentation was pathetic.
The diners next to us were so pissed that the gentleman told manager that Crave ruined his life. 
Seriously. 
This has to be one of the worst meals ever.
Happy Fathers Day my A** 
Sent from my iPad

Good place.  Went for dinner on Father's day.  Service was a bit slow, not that it was the server's fault, they were woefully understaffed.  I've been here twice before and the service has been good, friendly, timely, and interactive, so I think this time was more of a scheduling mishap.

The food I've ordered is very good, I've ordered off the menu, Gorgonzola Stuffed Chicken last time, and Salmon this time.  Both were excellent, though I think I like the Chicken better.  On Father's day, both my Dad and Mom had the Prime Rib special, which was anything but special.  Super thin, over cooked greyish-brown lump.  But, not one of their normal dishes, so maybe a one off mistake.  It was all-you-can-eat, and when the server came with the second round, the meat looked the same, so we said no thanks, and left it at that.

I'll be back though!  Fun place with a lively crowd, especially at the bar.  They must have a decent happy-hour since I've seen the bar busy the 3 times I've been.

Me and my wife on search for new restaurant so we found this place and for sure we'll planning to come back! 
Good food and health too and fast service  
Nice and quiet so it's a good recommendations for anyone

This place should be called "Brave".  You'd need to be to want to go back.

Where to begin? We got to the restaurant Friday evening just after 7:30.  Despite seeing several tables available, I was asked if I had a reservation.  Nope.  So when I was told it would be a 45-60 minute wait because I didn't have one, I hopped on OpenTable and made a rez for 7:45.

"Yes", I said.  "I have a reservation for 7:45."

The hostess got huffy and went and got a manager.  I explained that I went on OpenTable and made my rez after I was told there would be a 45-60 minute wait.  I played by their rules, and the millennial hostess decided to get upset.  "After all, the restaurant is 1/2 empty. A potential hour wait seems a little absurd", I observed.

The manager protested that his place was half empty (it turned out to be more than that). But I remained cool headed and just told him to seat me after he seated everyone else waiting (there was nobody waiting).

My gf and I eventually were seated.  I am 100% certain that the manager decided to mess with me because every single dish came out of the kitchen wrong.  The salad had no goat cheese and was overly slimy.  When I mentioned it, I was given a tiny cup on the side rather than re-making the slimy salad.  The Mac and cheese was under seasoned, my gf's sushi was hastily strewn about the plate, it took 25 minutes for our drinks to arrive, and the first brownie desert we got was so overcooked and burnt it couldn't be cut.

I'm SO glad I ordered the extra spit.  (I'm nearly certain, though have no proof.)

Anyhow, we were there on a $100 gift card and since I will never go back, I tipped the waiter the $25 of change I could have gotten back.  He did fine, it's really too bad his manager and hostess were such clowns.

If I could shut this place down, I would.

Pro tip: Avoid it.

After reading all the bad reviews, I was hesitent about eating at this new Summerlin Restaurant. They have got the bugs out and it was a very nice experience. Deanne the Hostess was lovely, friendly and helpful in telling us about the place and the menu items. Craig, our server was very helpful, attentive and couldn't have been nicer. Tea glasses were filled before completely empty. Food was very tasty and presented very well. Prices are not really bad. They are keeping with area. Portions are large, we shared a Bison Burger and a house salad. I will be back again.

Food: My wife ordered the pulled chicken farfalle pasta, I had the lamb meatballs, and for appetizer and calamari which came out good. The pulled chicken and the lamb meatballs wasn't any good didnt understand how the spinach, chicken, and artichoke combination became a pasta dish. As for the lamb meatballs I expected the taste to be of meditteranean which it did, I just did not like how the lamb meatballs were prepared they were dry and  the sauce wasnt really a good combination with the meatballs.

For the price of the food expected the quality and taste to be at par with the restaurants at the strip sadly its not.

Ambiance: The ambiance is very good. The restaurant would be good for date nights 

Location: Downtown summerlin, which is a very good location.

Overall: I would not come back not unless the quality of the food improves. Paying a high price with so so food is not for me.

Our server, Chyna, was so friendly and personable. She could give lessons on being customer friendly. She was great. Everything we ordered to eat was very good, from burgers to sushi. Only negative would be the balsamic vinegar dressing on the salad was just too too tart to eat. A place we will return to and hopefully Chyna will be our server again.

We ate here for the first time tonight. We had no reservation but were easily accommodated by gracious staff. The interior has sophisticated subdued lighting and is done in rich red and brown tones. The dining area is one large open room with views of the kitchen. We were seated at one of the center tables which are a little too close together for privacy. 

My partner snd I had the turkey burger and steak sandwich. The turkey burger was fine, served with fries that were slightly greasy. The steak sandwich was quite excellent, served on a fresh hoagie with a delicious spiced mayonnaise. The steak was perfectly cooked medium with that wonderful char-broil flavor. The sandwich had green lettuce and some bits of zesty pickled celery, pepper, carrot, and pearl onions that really complimented the flavor of the meat. I rarely take a doggie bag but I brought the rest of the steak home for lunch tomorrow. 

The service is excellent. It was an overall good experience. We'll probably be back again.
I would just like to say: CRAVE has some of the best jambalaya I've ever had! And I've been to New Orleans where I have had some great jambalaya.

Went for lunch with my girlfriends today...we all thought it was AMAZING!!  From the crab artichoke dip all the way to the end!  Betty took great care of us and suggested the angry dragon for our cocktail.  Talk about hitting the nail on the head!!  It was perfect with our meals.  I had the grilled chicken salad which was presented very well along with everything else we had.  Ended the meal with the individual salty caramel mousse.  YUM!!!  The only thing that made the meal from being perfect is that the website says happy hour is on Saturday from 11 to 5.  We were informed by the hostess that they weren't doing it for opening weekend!!  Bummer!!  We'll still be back!!!  Go quick!!!

Our food took so long to come out. On top of that, it comes out and the order was wrong but I was too hungry and exhausted to complain. We paid $15 a plate. The service was very slow even though there weren't very many people in there. Definitely not worth it.

There aren't many food options at the Summerlin mall just yet. On a recent trip Dyanna L, her man Brent S. and I all decided to check out Crave. I'd also seen lots of fellow Yelpers check in here and wanted to know what all the fuss was about. 

Upon walking in we were greeted by at least 4 hostesses. We were quickly walked around what felt like the whole restaurant to our seats. The hostess pulled out our chairs (fancy) and handed us menus. Our glasses were filled with ice cold water. They do have a vast menu and they even have a full sushi bar. The prices are high so be prepared. Since we had intentions of eating someplace else later I was checking out the appetizers, but could not resist their huge sushi menu. Since I was watching my budget I just went with the Spicy Salmon Roll ($8). Dyanna got another specialty sushi roll and a martini and Brent got edamame, soup and some jumbo shrimp. Everything was just ok. Nothing that special and definitely not worth the price. 

Fancy atmosphere and only meh food doesn't mean your can charge outrageous prices. With Wolfgang right around the corner we might as well have gone there and had amazing food or I guess we just should have stuck to Wetzels Pretzels. Save your money and hit up another restaurant in this ever growing mall.

I heard about this place at the Downtown Summerlin Farmer's Market several weeks ago when these girls under a tented area gave us samples & a flyer. The flyer said there was a "date night" for couples & it was $50. I told my boyfriend we should give it a try sometime.

Fast forward to this past weekend, Saturday night, I called to make sure they still have that dinner date deal & they said its on Friday & Saturday nights, perfect! 

We headed there and were greeted immediately upon arrival. We were seated at a booth and handed menus. We took a look at the date deal and were ready to order. The date deal consists of 2 appetizers, 2 entrees, & 2 mini desserts PLUS a bottle of wine (21+ for the wine though). That was such a good deal! 

We ordered our food and took in our surroundings. Dim lighting, nice ambiance, with a bit of an elegant feel to it. All of the staff that helped us that night were friendly & didn't rush us with the check, which I liked a lot.

Our food was DELICIOUS! We we definitely be coming back again soon!
The all day Sunday happy hour is awesome! The lemon garlic wings are finger licking good! The Bartender's, Kayla, friendliness and smile truly made my visit!

Went to celebrate a dear friend's birthday last Thursday at 12:30 PM; restaurant was practically empty.  Service was terribly slow, restaurant had fewer than 20 people in it.  Food finally arrived at 1:30 PM.  Ordered a brownie dessert; that took another 45 minutes.  Manager was summoned, said we should have been told they had to make the Marshmallow topping that goes on the brownie?  Really?  Gave us the dessert for free, but by that time we were over it.  Needless to say we'll be looking for another place to celebrate in the future...
OMG, It was outdtandong. We sat outside for lunch  everyone treated us so special  the waiter went out of his way to please us. The food was absolutely  great. Definitely will return.

Lunched here on a Thursday. Quite busy, but seating was very efficient and took less time than estimated (about 10 minutes). Service was superior (Craig rocks!), and food was very tasty. I had the premium bento box with dynamite roll while the wife had the Chicken Apple Brie sandwich. They even brought a complimentary cup of fresh fruit for our daughter!  Can't wait to try this place for grownup night out with drinks as the bar and wine selection looked quite impressive.  The manager made his rounds while we ate which is somewhat rare nowadays. Will definitely come back!

My wife and I have been here twice now, and the food has been fantastic both times.  That said, we were even more impressed with the service.  The first time we were here, the waitress was incredibly knowledgeable about the menu, which always makes ordering much easier.  The second time we came because we received an email about a four course meal being offered 26-31 December.  We came on the 26th with the intention of having the four course meal, but as it turned out, this location was not prepared to offer the four course meal until the 31st.  We were bummed, but stayed anyway and had a great meal which was comped by the manager Jamie.  Excellent service all around!

I'm back and this time disappointed. I'm having dinner and my sea bass was bland, salmon sushi roll was blah, my wife's pesto chicken was undercooked, my bro's filet mignon was supposed to be medium rare but turned out well(overcooked), which couldve been a very bad health concern, and they forgot my kids apple juice. The place was about a 3/4 empty of people, so for the food to be cooked like that means the staff was full of unprofessional undereducated rookies! Too bad, because this is a total opposite from first experience as you can read in my review. My wife didn't even have anymore time to eat the dish they replaced and by then you can't give back the missed experience of eating w/the rest of your party!

Always slow service. Waited about 20 minutes to take our drink order. Not even an apology, I asked for a manager and was told one was not available. Since it's a holiday they don't honor specials, but their signs out front say EVERY Sunday. Food is okay, not worth the price.

The atmosphere was upscale but relaxing. We sat outdoors with our 14 month old son. He ran around the patio(we were the only ones out there) and the staff were so kind and interactive with him. The bison burger was AMAZING! Tip: order the bison medium/rare. It's a very lean meat so the rare meat juices mixed with the egg yolk was to die for. We will definitely be back here to try more of their dishes.

Walked in today looking for a place that has happy hour. We were greeted by a rude young Asian lady wearing a skimpy dress who seemed like she didn't want to be there. She gave us attitude and seated us in an area that does not have a server! We waited for about 15 mins and decided to walk out. Place looks fancy, service absolutely sucks.

We ordered widmer hefeweizen beer- this is awesome, slightly sweet. 
Lamb meatballs on peppercorn linguini.
Mac & Cheese w/ French fries 
Dessert Sampler- tiramisu, butter scotch pudding, blueberry cheesecake, French silk, rum butter cake, salted caramel pudding. Our favorite was the cheesecake- the rest were cloyingly sweet. 

Good service, and pretty good prices too. The creamy pasta sauce was rich, which went well with the gaminess of the lamb meatballs. The French fries were well-seasoned, but a tad bit salty. The Mac & cheese was a bit 'gabby' (according to my daughter) but overall pretty good

Great Food, Great Atmosphere, Great Service.  

There was a slight wait, but it was worth it.  Joelle took great care to ensure questions were answered, and she made great suggestions.  She is the service professional everyone hopes for on a nice evening out.  

The menu is varied and includes a wide range of house-made dishes.  Try the hummus (I forget the menu word for it).  They also have very tasty sushi options. 

do it!

Good food. Good service. Would definitely return.
I had 2 items from the sushi menu and really enjoyed the Aloha wrap. Great pita bread for snacking on while waiting for the food. It kinda feels like a newer Kona Grill for anyone who goes to Boca Park. Good stuff!

Not the best experience we've had... The server was very attentive but unfortunately the food fell flat... We did enjoy the sushi roll for our app but my husbands burger was not cooked properly and his fries were cold ! Also I had the salmon and it smelt extremely fishy which usually means it's not fresh .. Ruined my appetite and sent it back .. Was excited about this place but unfortunately won't be returning

Just dined there last night for the first time and actually had a wonderful experience! My family and I came in around 5pm for dinner. It was pretty quiet because it was before dinner time, and a Tuesday night. Our server was Jordan and he provided amazing service throughout our dinner. He started off by giving us waters right away. He gave great recommendations and was very knowledgeable with the menu. Some time in between he came back with warm steamed hand towels for us to clean our hands, which was a great touch. Our food came out shortly after. We order tuna tataki, Philly roll, Angus sliders, chicken pesto flatbread, and caprese chicken pasta. Everything was really great, although I'd skip the pasta and flatbread. They were kinda boring and bland dishes. At the end Jordan let us know that if we signed up for a rewards card, we'd receive a free mini tiramisu. We signed up and the tiramisu was delicious. Overall the  service was impeccable and the food was pretty good.

The place was not even half full and it took almost 15 minutes to get a drink from the bar.  Service was very poor in general.  I had the lamb meat balls for twenty some dollars and was less than impressed.  There were only a few and were only an inch or so in diameter. Others had the bison burger which was ok,  but it is hard to mess up a burger. With all the great dinning options in town I doubt I will go back and will not be recommending this place to anyone.  Oh and their largest beers are small and over priced as well.

I'm giving this restaurant 1 star.. Although the service is good... The food was not something I would come back for. It was very bland and unsatisfying. This was my first time and more than likely my last

I ordered the wedge salad and a 702-burger. The wedge salad was average at best-nothing special. The $17 burger was excellent! The sushi was ok but way overpriced.

Like many reviewers commented, the service is very poor. The food takes FOREVER to come out - even on a Tuesday, early evening with very few customers. This poor service is going to be their downfall.

Even after my wife and I (accidentally) made two reservations for 7pm we still had to wait almost 30 minutes to be seated. And we were seated in the Bar, not the restaurant. Okay so be it. It doesn't get any better though. The wine was rancid, the margarita was lame and the main course came 5 minutes after the soups and salads were delivered. It was a disaster and the worse part is the food was just okay. I so want local restaurants to succeed however Crave has some work to do if they are going to last.

So yummy!!! We had the yellowtail app and sea weesld salad too. Both AMAZING!!! Norwegian Salmon and MahiMahi was on point. 
Our waiter was perfect. He had a man bun and i failed to get his name but he was so good.
Food average & tastless, bartender must not if ever tended bar before didn't know drinks or food and made several immature comments. Prepare to wait for food & service even though place is empty?

We found ourselves in this Downtown Summerlin Mall (because we were staying right next door at the Red Rock Resort) and just picked this place at random. Walking in, I noticed how clean and well-decorated the place was. Very clean lines and appealing.

We sat down and I put my service dog under our table. My girl had the grilled cheese sandwich and I had the chicken & avocado salad with an order of Unagi (sushi). The grilled cheese comes on a rectangular dish with six triangular wedges and a cup of tomato-based soup for dipping. Really tasty. My eel sushi was baked to perfection and quite tasty. My salad was so fresh and delicious. It was SO refreshing in this utterly ridiculous heat and humidity. 

Our server was attentive and friendly. I really have no complaints. The food was unique and quite fresh. I would definitely eat here again.
Awesome food...just enough and the setting is grest!  Our server Adam was very attentive and genuine..he was amazing!   We will be back!

The grand opening for Downtown Summerlin was crazy and this being a few places for sit down dinning, it was quite the wait. I am impressed with the service from the hostess to the wait staff. Miranda, our host, was wonderful and pleasant, she disclosed the wait time and accommodated us ASAP when our wait time had surpassed. Emily, our waitress was exceptional, she made sure we were taken care of even having worked since 10am, still upbeat and pleasant. 

We ordered the Michelada and it was amazing! The Poké Tacos are delicious. We tried the Black bean soup and Caesar Poblano Salad was delicious. The grass feed beef burger was just tender and scrumptious.

Will be back for sure.

Was taken here by my family for Mother's Day. I was hesitant, because I thought it was going to be geared more for sushi lovers, but my husband assured me it wasn't. We get there, and after our bizarre waitress swings by to state "I 'll be back", we review the menus only for me to see that I was right. They have food that isn't sushi, but I don't eat fish or hot, spicy food so that narrowed the choices down a lot. I went with the stir fry that came out cold. I'm not talking warm, it was cold like someone had put it in the refrigerator to cool it off. I was absolutely done at that point. I just wanted the check. We had already discussed where we should've gone. The next evening we DID and had good food, good service, and a great time, so we were able to salvage Mother's Day!

We checked this place out on opening weekend and it was inevitably chaotic. Although the wait was rather long and there were alot of open tables (I understand it is they want to pace the flow) we were seated and greeted promptly. Our adorable server Cameron was amazing. He was efficient and thorough in answering all our questions about the menu and accommodating our allergies. Per his recommendations we started out with the Jumbo Shrimp (Mind blowing) and We ordered the Roasted Half chicken and Norwegian Salmon for our entrees. Both were incredible - The chicken was perfectly seasoned - almost had an indian kind of curry taste and the salmon was to die for with it's crispy mustard crust. Cameron seems to be a reader of minds as anything we needed, he got it without us even asking and still made time to chat it up with us amidst the chaos in the restaurant (we probably heard dishes dropped by employees 3 times while we were there). Cameron suggested a coconut cake for dessert which just pushed our meal over the top. We had several managers stop by our table to make sure everything was okay which was a fantastic touch. Amazing, We will be back for sure.

I'm kind of at a loss for words.  I mean, it wasn't bad but it wasn't great either.  I can say we definitely won't be going back for any of the sushi dishes, as each dish we tried (Mexican Roll, Bamboo Bite roll, and jalapeno tuna sashimi) reminded me of the "safe" sushi dishes I would try when I first forayed into the sushi world.  The menu made the rolls sound creative and flavorful, but alas that wasn't the case.  It's been years, possibly decades, since I've used soy sauce on any sushi that I was sad I had to resort to it here.  Without the soy sauce, there was no flavor at all, and that's talking about rolls that purported to have special spices and sauces already added to them.  The tuna sashimi was stringy, and not buttery and I could've done without the cucumber slice.  On a positive note, the sushi didn't come off as "fishy" smelling or tasting, so there was that.  After finishing the sushi, again which wasn't great, but wasn't horrible either, my husband and I decided to try the hummus.  On paper, it sounded amazing, served with goat cheese and herbs infused into the hummus, and rainbow cauliflower and toasted baguettes for dipping.  Again, the flavor was "okay" but there was too much of a layer of diced veggies dubbed as "bruschetta" on top of the hummus that we had to push to the side and the hummus itself had too much of an herb flavoring to it.  We had two bites and finally just opted for a slice of chocolate cake to share.  We will definitely go back and give it another try, as the menu boasted pastas, burgers, steaks, and salads that looked good as we saw them go by our table.  The bar area looked like a great place to meet for apps and drinks, and catch a game or two and the outside seating in the arroyo area of DTS also looked inviting.  Props to our server, who was friendly and efficient.  I'm hoping our experience was just a fluke, and we are open to another visit.

I had the Lobster and Shrimp flatbread. Decent. I advise coming here at night because the day time its pretty gloomy and feels like night anyway and no one spoke to me as if I didn't exist. Maybe will try again but first will try more restaurants in this mall
The sea bass plate was overpriced and not worth it, the burger was OK.
High quality, good food. However, the service is rather lacking and slow. Would come back again

We wanted to check out the new Downtown Sunmerlin with a very hungry appetite for much-needed food. We were told the wait at Crave was a 25 minute wait for a table. We put our names down. Granted, Crave was the only sit-down food place open. We waited 30 minutes and went back 2x thinking they forgot about us. Now, it was creeping up to an hour. We waited inside next to the over occupied hostess stations. There were a lot of tables open but, clearly not enough wait staff. After we complained again about our wait time, we FINALLY got seated. By now, it was well over the hour mark. Our waiter was prompt but then dropped a BOMB on us by telling us that the kitchen is backed up and that it will take 45 minutes to AN HOUR to get food!!!!!!! 40 minutes for appetizers!!!! We have literally never stormed out of a restaurant! You would think the 5-6 hostesses they had huddled around the one hostess stand would've warned customers about the kitchen wait time on top of making people wait for their tables!!! So, even if you had a reservation, you would've had to have waited a least an hour for your food, and this includes their sushi menu!!!! Unbelievable. Note to this establishment--make sure to either have enough employees to cater to the influx of curious people coming to check out the grand opening or, don't serve people at all, especially if you make them wait from lunch to dinner time! Unfortunately, I didn't get the chance to sample the food so, I can't comment on the menu items.

Well let's just say disappoint across the board . I have eaten there before but decided to give it one more try after attending a happy hour with decent appetizers . We first started out with a few appetizers before dinner , the chicken wings , Korean chicken bites,  pork dumplings and sushi tempura bites . The only thing I woukd order again was the pork dumplings. Lunch , me and my gf ordered the short rib hash , I ordered everything extra crispy with runny eggs on top , my friend ordered the same but hard fried eggs , the order came out completely wrong , my daughter ordered the bison burger , not only did the whole plate come out cold the bun was frozen,  manager came and asked if she wanted another or something else , she then ordered a sushi roll at 16.95 I'm thinking this better be an amazing roll , hardly the case not only did it fall apart it was small and tasteless. My friends daughter ordered the chicken sandwich which she said was ok and was only order that came out right but was cold too. I didn't even mention the service our waitress just seemed irritated the whole time serving us , enough so I mentioned it to the manager , she seemed to care but not really.  I'm not even sure how they stay in business , good is sub par and so is the service , for the prices I would much rather take my business somewhere else.  However they did take 20% off out bill for all the inconvenience.  I still do not wish to return again I wish they could get it together because it's a great location .

I came to this place after walking around downtown Summerlin. My friend mentioned to me last week that Crave started their Happy Hour. 

At first I was not sure since I had read so many negative reviews about how disgusting this place because this place are pets friendly. As a person who love dogs myself I think it's nice to have place like that around town. 
I also suspected all 8-9 negative reviews might be friends and I think it's not fair for group of friends speaking about business in all negative thought. People should yelp but let's be fair. So that's why I am trying out this place. 

My message to CRAVE employees is... Don't panic guys.... I didn't take my dog with me today! So I have nothing to complain about pet friendly. 

Our server was very nice. Listening to the server from table behind us also told me that everyone are on point for their customer services. I also noticed floor manager were running the food by himself helping out his employees. 

It's a 4 stars since my server forgot my ketchup for my fries but it's not a big deal! I will bring my own package myself next time lol. 

Happy hour.. A nice selections of food and drinks. I started with drink and how fantastic their serve my favorite Bluemoon for $4! during HH. My friend went for Kinky cocktails drink which I think it's great value for $4 as well. 

Fat!!! Chicken wings, Veggie Bruschetta, Tuna roll and Truffle fries are all tasty. 
Will be back again hopefully for date night special dining with a bottle of wine.

Atmosphere: What a benefit to Crave that they are one of the only restaurants open during the opening of DTS. Crave feels like it's menu of Sushi/Burgers... Identity confused. The sushi smell will likely knock you over when you walk in the door.The hostess could use some classes on cordiality, and possibly look at you when speaking, let alone a smile. My family and I waited for 30min, to be set at the bar when there were open booths available, not the most comfortable. The hiring manager likes blondes with tattoos, that's clearly evident by the very attractive tattooed waitresses.

Food: I was surprised that I had to pay for the bread basket (usually complimentary), but ok. The burger, well it had a patty. Now the flatbread apple sausage was totally worth all the BS that I had to deal with. Also, the crab cake (with salad) was pretty darn good. For desert, the smores brownie... Or the snores browie... 


Not really for the fam, Ironic since Summerlin (the target demo) is mostly families. I hope this place gets it together before any competition opens up.

I'm not sure if we just hit this place on an off night or what, but I will not be going back.
Once we were seated the waitress came to the table and it was immediately obvious that she had zero interest in being there. She took our drink order, came back with the drinks, took our order and then disappeared. We literally did not see her again. Given the attitude she may have just gone in the back and quit. 

Anyway, we ordered the calamari for our appetizer, considering the place was almost empty it took a completely unreasonable amount of time for it to come out, and when the sous chef finally did bring it to us it was cold. 

I ordered the Surfer roll and the Crunchy Heat roll - Both tasted like the the dishwasher had picked them up at 7 11 on his way into work. My girlfriend ordered the Sea Bass, which was delicious. But she isn't writing this review, I am. 

Considering all of the restaurants in that area, I can't see how you couldn't do better picking any place other than Crave.

I was impressed by the food and by the service! We came in with a group of six and our waiter, Nicholas, was amazing! He knew the food inside and out. He also never let us have to ask for anything, he was two steps ahead the whole time!
The food was really good! Everyone got something different and everyone cleaned their plate! The prices were fantastic as well! We will be back for sure!

Went to Crave @ dt summerlin with a party of 4, All I can say is we will never come back here . Server was not friendly. Food was cold. We sent back fish that was cold , and they brought it back like 20 mins later !!! My whole party was already done with their food . We spoke to the manager and he was very careless !!! Overall a horrible experience !!!! Waste of money .

I came here for a salad and it fed my craving. Next time I'll try the sushi. Ambiance is nice, staff is friendly and food quality was good. I appreciate it was in the shopping center. I would come back again!
Service was great! Food was average, some servings were cold. Mimosas were not included for brunch. Needed more variety.

The parmesan truffle fries...sigh. I *crave* them all the time. The Salmon nigiri is fresh and sweet. The sushi rolls are sadly heavy on the rice, and light on fish and veg. We've been twice, and the service has been pleasant and friendly each time. The atmosphere is typical Summerlin, whether that be a positive or negative is up to you. I'd go back for the fries any day, any time.

My husband and I like trying new places to eat. We finally went to Crave for lunch on Father's day. 

We had the dumpling & bruschetta for appetizer which was good and it all went downhill after that. For entree my husband had the crave burger which took forever & I had the bento box which sat at the counter for a while, bento box was a waste of money!!! We were seated right by the service area & sushi bar. Timing was very bad. Our server kept apologizing for the delay in our dessert.

They should have anticipated that it was going to be busy due to father's day.
Love this place!! Awesome food, great outdoor seating, service is good. Many different food options...

This place is a joke and a disgrace to summerlin!
I had the blackened fish tacos and they were mostly filled with the slaw and a very small piece of cold fish... zero flavor! Not to mention, who the hell wants French fries with tacos!!!??? Chips and salsa should be automatic... the fries were cold and undercooked! Not to mention someone there is obviously afraid of salt! Ridiculous

Fantastic meal was had by all. Jacob was a wonderful server. Extremely attentive given how insanely busy this new restaurant is. It was difficult to b pick just a few dishes. Everything on the menu looked great. The Chicken Sausage flatbread is not to be missed. The Sliders, both pork belly and sirloin, were great. The sushi was good, but order early as there was a considerable wait from the sushi counter. The kids devoured the chicken fingers, mac n cheese, and s'more brownie. It's a new restaurant, folks, wait a couple months before posting your negativity.

My partner and I decided to give this place a try as we had plans to see a movie. Our waitress brought us our drinks and we ordered the lobtser and spinach dip. For 14.00, we both felt it was a really small portion, but tasted fine.  He then ordered the salmon and I ordered the crave burger.  The wait was very long for the food and our waitress only came by once to refill our drinks. After the food arrived, I found the burger to be really bland and my partner's salmon was really undercooked.  We didn't have time to order anything else, so asked the waitress to just take the salmon of the tab. It was amazing how fast our waitress was to get us the tab and get us cashed out, but couldn't even stop by twice to see if our drinks needed refilling. My partner didn't get dinner and had to order food at the theater.  Sorry, but this experience isn't worth another trip back.
The food here is probably one of the best in downtown summerlin. I have come here for date nate with my girlfriend multiple times and I have always been impressed.

Food was 3 stars. I got the lemon garlic chicken and it was ok. Service here is terrible. Who hires these waiters. All they do is hang out and chat with eachother. Took me 25 minutes to get my check. Never coming back, thanks to the idiots that work here.
Sushi was ok.... Very fishy taste for some reason.....Serivce however was great.... The drinks served were horrible.... Probably would not recommend..... Next ...

This was a new place to try, for lunch, they have a good variety of foods and decent portions, I would definately go back to this place again, the waiter was very nice and attentive to our needs. The price is good too. We will be back!
Food was great, interior is very nice and clean, server was fast and friendly, I definitely will return for the appetizer pizza!

Being the only place open in Downtown Summerlin we were kind of forced to try this  restaurant out. 

The atmosphere was alright, it was your typical chain restaurant bland atmosphere.

I know I can't give 0 stars but even if I could I would still give 1 star because our server, Victor, was fun and knowledgeable. 

 I LOVE sushi and was excited to see that they had a menu that was relatable to sushi and non sushi lovers. I ordered the Mexican Roll and a side of sashimi. I was super excited because i love anything spicy. I ate the majority of my roll because it was good! Everything was going great until early the next morning when I felt extremely sick, as did my other friend (who also got the sashimi).
One of my favorite spots in Downtown Summerlin.  I have not been a big sushi fan but I am turning around with the help of CRAVE and it's wait staff.  Wonderful atmosphere.

We received a coupon in the mail & decided to give this place a shot. Made reservations for a Saturday night date night. We showed up & waited for our table for about 10 minutes, with reservations but it was a Saturday night so I guess we let that slide. Our waitress was overly stressed out. We ordered drinks and chips & guac. My margarita came in a tumbler, no salt, very little tequila. Our guac was served with shredded lettuce which I found to be odd. Honey ordered steak, I got steak medallions with asparagus. Food was barely warm when we finally got it, but they were nice cuts of meat. Didn't do dessert because the wait times for even water were just too long. We won't be going back anytime soon.

Sat in bar area.  Service was decent.

The food:

Crispy rice -  Two large square of pale pinkish tuna that looked like very low quality and the consistency of a well blended hummus.  The pieces were too large and had a gagging consistency

Duck Flatbread - Supposedly a specialty.  Tasted like Fig jam and the duck looked like it was microwaved.  Greens were dirty and flacid. 

Sushi - very large pieces but not very good.  Too much rice on the rolls and didn't look appetizing or taste very good

Dips - Soggy cucumber pieces and cold flatbread with three spreads that were decent.  Best food item but not saying much.

None of our food went back to the kitchen empty and almost all of the flatbread was on the plate when the server took it away.  No questions were asked if we liked it or if we were just full.   The truth is it was hard to eat any more.

Manager looked like she was going to a coffee shop with a very large back tattoo and could only be distinguished when she helped with a credit card.  Her appearance was a reflection of food and experience.

The 3 stars are only for our server! He was great! We were a loud party of 12! The food was not good at all. So bland and such small portions! I had been there for lunch and didn't eat my food at all, it was just not good but a friend wanted to have his b day brunch there. The breakfast had no flavor and it wAs so small, we were hungry after we ate so we ordered donuts, and they tasted like empty calories. However the bottomless mimosas are great and only 11 bucks!

While the food was decent overall, and the waitress made sure to check in on is..... That is about where the good remarks end. Our two kids (party of 7) both had chicken fingers. Our daughters came out 5 minutes after the adults food. Our sons took an additional five minutes to come out (he's 2 and not very patient...), and when I cut into one of the fingers, it was raw! We had to send it back and wait an additional 10 minutes (by this time everyone else was done with their meal). My husbands chicken wings (ordered lemon garlic, only 2 of hem were lemon. The remaining were buffalo. Oh, and on holidays.... Kids don't eat free, which should have been disclosed at the beginning of the meal, not after we received the check. Nothing was offered for the mistakes and the raw chicken I almost fed my toddler.

One of the most annoying dining experiences I've had here in Las Vegas. EVERYTHING has an ingredient my wife can't tolerate in food and they couldn't make ANYTHING that didn't have it. To boot, it was really pricey and the service was very slow. I won't be back.

Everyone has the same idea about this place--3 Stars. We went over to crave after looking at the menu because Wolf Gang was closed. Upon entering, the restaurant looks pretty nice. It's interesting because craves menu has a bunch of diff options: tacos, sushi, Korean BBQ, burgers...we thought, what the hell? 

As an appetizer, we ordered jalapeño citrus yellowtail. Prob the best thing we ordered. The fish and mandarin orange sat on top of thinly sliced cucumber. It was so refreshing! 5 TINY pieces for like $12-$13? Also ordered the tomato soup, good but not memorable.

My husband ordered the 702 burger. He said "it was good." It had egg, candied bacon, red onions, spinach, tomato jam. It was really large, he had to cut and eat it with a fork lol.

I ordered Blackened mahi tacos. First off, it wasn't blackened, it was good, nothing exceptional. It had like a corn/jalapeño salsa...good but definitely lacked flavor. 

Our son had the quesadilla with fries. He didn't like either but that's just because he's picky and tired. 

There is an advertisement on every table that says like half price bottled wine on certain days, kids eat free Sun-Tues 11am-close etc. When we got our bill, our sons food was on the ticket which was fine but we asked the waitress do they not do this on holidays? She came back and said management would honor it even though they do not usually do this for holidays. So that was nice.

There are better options. I probably would only come back if every other restaurant was packed and I couldn't wait for a seat. Not bad, just nothing special.

We weren't impressed... Definitely not chef quality!!! The calamari was either old, overlooked or both. The lamb meatball/fettuccine dish was heavy, with the pasta all stuck together, plus over spiced.  The salad and desert were very good if that's any consolation.. Ambiance was nice and service was superb, friendly and accommodating. The wait wasn't long, now we know why?

We give it 2 stars, but we will try again. Always give a place a second chance to redeem itself, one can only hope.  For the money we would have expected a lot better...:( :(

Not impressed. Way over priced. Very slow service. Food was mediocre. We were disappointed. Had high expectations especially for the price point. Should be three $$$, not two.  Not crazy about "Downtown Summerlin" either.

Since my last visit, this place is getting worst food quality sucks! Thd flatbreads seems like it had been waiting for someone to bring it to us, not hot anymore, salad was very soggy. We were just so hungry ... Although our waiter was nice, service is very slow.  I don't think I will return.  Nothing exciting about the sushi, I cud have gone somewhere else. Get rid of the sushi chef, you can do better.

I see a lot of mixed reviews on here. All I can say is my wife had a great experience and great meals.  The food was really fresh. Jenna was our server and she was awesome. We had sushi for a starter and it was delicious. My wife had Salmon and I chicken and pasta.  Both were really good!  We had the coconut cake for dessert. It was good but, not great.

The flatbread pizzas were delicious.   A few unique flavor options which was nice.  I had the asian chicken salad.  Very large portion...wasnt able to finish it all.  It was good, not the very best I've had, but still good.  A wide selection of food on the menu.  I will be back to try other items.  Modern and clean place.

I've been wanting to check out The Crave since it opened and finally made it in. We stopped in after 9pm so the rush was over and we're seated quickly by a very nice hostess. Mike was our server and was awesome. We were impressed by the menu selection and settled on a starter of quacamole and chips, it was good but not great. For my main course I'm a sucker for a.good Bison burger so I gave it a try along with some well seasoned fries and was not disappointed. With such a diverse menu and excellent service by Mike we'll be back to try some other dishes. Overall, 4 stars for our first go. And I'd say The Crave has the potential to be our go to spot in Downtown Summerlin.

I was looking for a place to duck out of Halloween much to the chagrin of the GF.  I thought Downtown Summerlin would be a chill place to avoid trick or treaters.  The GF informed me this was the only restaurant currently open in the mall.  I thought we should give it a shot.

I read some of the reviews talking about the wait.  We were fortunate to be seated in quick fashion.

Our Harry Potter dressed server was prompt in taking our drink orders.  I tried a "Lazy Uncle Jack."  It contained JD whiskey, blueberries, and sweet and sour.  Tasty enough..I ordered a second.  These were about in the area of $10 a pop.

For my meal I chose the "Bison Burger."  It was topped with pork belly, cilantro mayo, and pickled shallots.  Cooked to medium, it was A-OK.

Until Downtown Summerlin launches everything it is going to offer in the way of dining, CRAVE will do you in a pinch.

I've been to CRAVE three times now (one dinner, one lunch, one happy hour), and I've enjoyed the food each time. I can tell that it's been freshly prepared utilizing high quality ingredients. To me, that's a huge plus for any restaurant.

My experience with the service has been positive all 3 times. Note that the lunch and, obviously, happy hour were both in the bar.

While I haven't tried their sushi yet, I did enjoy their mahi mahi dinner. The fish was fresh and the preparation tasty and unique.

I would agree that the menu is a bit overpriced, but I'm willing to pay for quality.

CRAVE is worth checking out if you're in the area.

OH MY GOD! 

Yes, yes! I just love this place! I'm gonna try not being bias here as the whole reason of writing a review is to give the readers and idea of the type of experience we had by eating there. So, let's start by talking about their location, service, foods, deals and finally what makes them different from other restaurants.

Located at Downtown Summerlin in Las Vegas, The CRAVE restaurant has a very good location right by the Red Rock and the luxury theater Downtown Summerlin. I have been eating there since they first started and I have to say that I'm still getting impressed with every new dish I try.

What I love about it is their service and deals! I got a royalty card that it's very useful, it's not just a cheap punch card, it's a card made of hard plastic just like a credit card. You can always expect your card to reward you with something every time you eat there. Sometimes it's going to be a simple $10.00 discount, but sometimes it will give you a two for one entree or even a free meal. Keep in mind that their entrees are just out of this world. Their servers are well trained and very happy for working there, which makes the whole experience very enjoyable.

Ask the servers to help you choose something, trust me, they know what's up. But if you are looking for a something specific, you can still dig thru the menu to find it. Their menu is very diverse, from amazing steaks and salads, to poke bows, chicken wings and even flatbreads; everything you order is going to be top quality and presentation.

My only concern is the price, since their food is so delicious that you might end up spending more than you wanted (happens to me all the time at restaurants like this one where everything is damn good). Besides that, make sure you ask for the royalty card and sign up for their email marketing so that you can get to know about their special deals and events.

Finally, I can't finish my reviews without letting you know what's good there right out of my review. You must order their truffle fries, then try their flatbread and their chicken wings. For your main entree, order a File Minion with Crab sauce and vegetables. They have a great list of wines and beers too. They also have sushi, OMG, how can it get better than that? Well, it does when they have deals that allow you to get two entrees for the price of one! Me and my wife got two File Minions with crab sauce for the price of one!!!' Yes, two top meals for one!!!
