Of course it doesn't happen that often, so that's why you must subscribe to their email marketing list and get the awesome Royalty card!!!!!! Just an awesome place!

I absolutely love this restaurant. I discovered it and ate here 3 times in the past three days. Service is great! Ask for Jordan, he's funny and gets things to you right away. Also, definitely get the calamari no matter what you end up ordering for the entrée. Delicious.
Service is terrible. Had a drink spilled on me by the busser within 20 min.

Have the rib eye, was amazing!!! Cooked to perfectly, girl had a sushi roll she said it was really good. Had a app the crab and artichoke dip was very good, service was amazing, will def recommend this to everyone I know.

we go out as a group of friends and we go out regularly and every time we leave dinner we always compare it to crave hahah. I got the 702 burger and it was amazing probably the best burger i have had in months the staff was friendly and took great care of us

We stopped in on the opening weekend. It was predictably packed, but we were seated promptly for our reservation. We were incredibly fortunate to have Emily as our server. It was obvious she was very busy, but she never seemed rushed or flustered. She even managed to find the time to chat us up about my iPhone. 

I ordered a Paloma. Excellent. I had the bison burger which was the best burger that I've had. Ever. The only real drawbacks were the uncomfortable bistro-style stools and that it was ridiculously loud to the point that it was hard to carry a conversation. Other than that, a pretty good experience all the way around.

Had another visit for Fathers Day dinner and was somewhat disappointed.  Service left a lot to be desired when you have to ask 4 times for water... The prime rib special was the poorest cut of meat possible and not worth the money. 
The pesto chicken was very good and baked mac n cheese ok.

There's a reason this place can't make 4 stars... Just pay attention and you'll see why.  Found a large long hair on my 702 burger... And the greens on the burger were awful... Yellow with rotten tips.  Didn't look like the chef was even trying to hide the zero quality of the arugula.  I wouldn't call the cook a chef to be honest.  

I wasn't offered any real apology, a free dessert or anything, still had to pay full price for everything and the replacement dish.  

When I found the hair, it took 5 minutes and I had to get out of my seat for me to get someone's attention, still had to wait after getting up when finally a manager noticed after a second pass.  It wasn't busy, the service was just poor, neglectful, just sad... The burger was returned and I ordered something else because I didn't trust a cook who served spoiled arugula (that should have been thrown away awhile ago) to not try and recycle some parts of the burger I sent back.  

Water was empty 3 times and had to wait 3 times.  

People need to remember, these low star reviews are just showing what people see.  It's always worse than how it looks.  The only reason I went here was because I had stubborn company.  I would guess that the idiot owners have a lot of money and take for granted that this place is in downtown summerlin and resting on the value of the location, so they don't seem to actually care about the quality of the food or service.  

An infant in a high chair was playing with their paper menu, it fell on the floor and a hostess walked right by it without picking it up.  This table was not situated in a way where I could believe anyone sober could actually not notice it.  The parents didn't see because of how the infant was positioned around the table.  The manager walked by, noticed, and picked it up and put it back on the table.  The infant picked it up and dropped it again.  Things that fall on the floor don't belong on a table... Especially in a restaurant, especially in front of babies that put their hands in their mouth.  In the food industry, there is absolutely nothing, in any circumstance ever, where the right thing to do when something falls on the floor, is to pick it up and put it back where it fell from.  

Whoever owns this place definitely did not deserve the money they thoughtlessly threw into this place.  

This is my 3rd or 4th Yelp review... Maybe only second... Because I only dump on places that actually deserve to be called trash.  This is not an isolated bad experience, a bad apple... This is pretty foundational.  The staff doesn't need a pep talk or a little staff meeting, it needs an episode on Restaurant Impossible.

I've been here 3 times so far already and will continue to be a customer, I just crave this place sometimes. They're salmon with miso is my favorite, drinks r delicious, and the chocolate layer cake is just to die for. Glad I decided to try this place!

I must say, I was looking forward to eating here but what awful reviews!

What is really turning me off is the pets.  I am the owner of the most precious Yorkie, I am not however a fan of dogs/pets in malls, grocery stores, and the most disgusting restaurants.

Robertos doesn't even allow dogs, at least in the eating area. Shame on you Crave! And your supposed to be upscale? And in the heart of Summerlin.

First time in downtown Summerlin and thought we'd stop by for some lunch. My boyfriend and I thought this would be a good spot. When you walk in and the atmosphere was very nice and we were greeted right away by the hostess. We didn't have to wait to long, had a wonderful waitress and gave us the lunch menu. Had a variety of choices to choose from.  We started off by the chicken avocado spring roll which was good.  It had more of avocado than chicken.  On to our entree's my boyfriend ordered the chicken, apple brie' sandwich and I got the salmon salad.  When his sandwich came out it was different it than your regular bread it came as a focaccia bread folded in half - Like eating a taco.  It was yummy!  Very good tasting.  My entree' had great presentation and the portion was just perfect - My salmon was cooked perfectly along w/ the other wilted spinach and israel couscous. Every bite was complimentary to everything.  We also had dessert which was good.  You can pick individuals or sharable.  We chose from sharable - Smore's brownie (it said ice cream but it wasn't it was just a marshmallow topping) and the cheesecake w/ rhubarb strawberry topping - Very good but huge. All and all, I would come here again.

Made a 4pm reservation for the three of us including my 6 year old son. Still waited 20 minutes to be seated. Ordered an appetizer and they forgot to bring it out. Food was mediocre at best. Spent 90$ for what! I would never return to this place again. Don't know what all the rave was about Crave.

We just went to crave for lunch.  We were given a high top, which we asked politely if we could change, to no avail.  We felt like we were annexed to a time out seat!  The hamburger was rare, when I had ordered med well.  My husband ordered a noodle chicken stir fry, which looked and tasted as if it came out of a can!  Inedible!  We won't be back.
Tried the hot hot hot burger and loved it! The quinoa salad was amazing!!! The pickled peppers they add on the side are a perfect touch and also delicious. I can't wait to go again.

What can I say about CRAVE?  I can't say that I'll CRAVE it anytime soon.  To me, this will be a go to spot if it were the last option ever.  I was told by family that this was a good place to eat.

The hostess was friendly and sat us a few minutes upon arrival.   Then greeted by our waiter a few min later.  He asked us if we had any questions on the menu and my friend asked about their rice bowls, and he had to go ask someone about the ingredients, one time was okay, but 2nd time he had to go ask, it just felt like he don't know the menu all too well.  Or am I just being too critical?  Okay, let's skip that....

According to the waiter, we came on a "slow" night.  So, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but our food came out FAST!  It didn't even feel like ten minutes before it even came out.  I ordered the Chicken Caprese Pasta.  Flavoring was great in the pasta as well as the flavor in the chicken, but what was bad about all this was the temperature of the pasta.  It was in between cold and luke warm.  How is that possible... it just is.  Some bites that I took was just cold.  The chicken was cooked in a bread crumb/tempura batter and honestly the presentation of the chicken looked burned.  It was a dark brown color, and I was expecting it to be a golden brown color.  My friend order the Thai Curry Shrimp bowl.  It came with three jumbo shrimps.  For the cost of $16 dollars, you would think you'd get a little bit more shrimp.  So if we broke it down, it was around $5 something per shrimp with a side of rice and curry sauce.  Yep, that sums that up.  I honestly would have been better off at an Olive Garden.  At least they served bread with my meal.  

The server that we had, we'd be in the middle of a conversation and he'd reach over and fill our cups with water and MY CUP WAS STILL FULL!!! He did that several times!  Which started to bug me because my cup didn't need any water.  When we were finished eating, we were still talking and when my water was actually empty, he NEVER came back once to fill it up or offered to fill it up!!! WTH!!!! The whole time I DIDN'T need water he was trying to fill my cup and when I NEEDED water, he didn't even bother filling it.  

If you do try this place, I truly hope you all have a better experience than I did.  With that being said... Happy Eating!

Absolutely love this place!  The food is delicious, the service is stellar, and the ambiance is yummy!  I love sushi and my man likes hamburger - they make them both to perfection!  We've eaten at Crave about 10 times, and never had a bad meal, bad service, or a bad experience.  We've brought friends and family, and each guest loves it as much as we do!

Horrible experience on the first visit!! I visited the restaurant for work dinner on Wednesday night. We had calamari and bread platter as appetizer and I had scallops as the main dish. I got a terrible food poisoning after the dinner. I was up all night, feeling very sick and I was close going to the emergency room. I have every reason to believe that those scallops were either not properly stored or were not fresh. I would highly recommend not going to this restaurant for sea food unless you want to spend your night on the toilet and throwing up. 

I eat seafood 1-2 times a week and I don't think seafood has ever made me sick.

Edit: ended up going to the emergency room in the morning. Definitely not a good choice of restaurant.

Walking in on Tuesday night and were sat right away. We were seated at high top table by the bar, we were not offered to be sat in the restaurant or the sushi bar. It was our first time here so we really didn't know the restaurant offered. Our server Stephanie was super sweet and knowledgeable. She helped me pick out a popular margarita, I believe the lime and ginger, to start with. They also have a lot  of beers on tap which my friend enjoyed. We started with the crab and artichoke dip and the bread basket. The bread basket it not complimentary but it's only $2.00. I loved put starters, everything was warm, gooey and flavorful. I asked for another popular margarita drink and Stephanie told me about the prickly pear. I decided to go with it. When it came  out and was a very pretty drink but not my style. Stephanie graciously switched it out for the lime and ginger one. We ordered two pastas to share. The lobster linguine and the lamb meatballs. The lobster linguine was great, nice chunks of lobster, the sauce was buttery and light. The goat cheese meatballs were in a Pablano sauce that was just okay. The lamb meatballs oozed goat cheese but the lamb itself was vey under seasoned and need salt. Safe to say we finished the lobster linguine and just picked at the lamb meat ball dish. We got the chai tea Creme brûlée dessert along with, by Stephanie's suggestion, a baileys and coffee with a bit of fransican, I think?  It was a hazelnut liquor from what I understand. Either way it was great. Stephanie also brought us house made marshmallows fluff for the coffee. Oh it was so good! The chai Creme brûlée was very tasty and a nice twist on the classic. We are already planning our trip back to check out their happy hour!

I want to start off by saying I understand as a server what the job entails and the work that goes behind it.. I am a server at Wynn hotel and we constantly have to give that 5 star service to guests. 

I went in today for a late lunch with my sister and my son. We were all pretty hungry and ready to enjoy some tasty food. I walked in and a manager, a man in a button up and tie was at the front on the pos system. I asked for a menu and he didn't look up and handed it to me. He responded but not a lot of engagement or a greeting while I was there. He then walked away and I waited for a hostess to approach me. We had 2 and a high chair... it took her a few minutes to get back to us and sat us. She sat us on the patio, which was beautiful and comfortable. 

I got us settled in, looking at the menus to decide on food... 5 minutes had gone by and no one had greeted us... I saw 2 servers. A man and woman talking to other tables but neither looked our way and walked by to say "I will be right with you." I get it.. you're busy but to inform us you are aware of our presence is ALL I ask and that wasn't the case.... I then went to the front and asked if we could get a server. A woman who seem to be a manager or supervisor apologized and brought us waters. She was very accommodating and quick. She then took our orders and brought settings to the table. 

I was still waiting on the high chair.. my son gets a little wild when he is on the loose... I got up again to ask the host if I could please get it. At this point I felt like a burden... She was great and I'm sure she just forgot because she looked like she was running around working and bussing tables. 

Food arrived about 15-20 mins later and food was okay. I was surprised how small my shrimp tempura roll was... we got the kids flatbread, the roll, tempura bites, and a fried rice chicken bowl. All of it was okay... It wasn't until our food came that I actually got to see who my server was. She came and asked if we needed anything and I requested spicy mayo for my roll... she left to grab it and came back but I saw she didn't have it in her hand but other drinks etc. for her other tables. I waited a little more because I figured maybe someone else would come out with it... she came out and back in another time then started to bus her tables and check on other people. At this time I was getting upset... my son and sister had finished their meals and I was still waiting for a side sauce to use... 

When she came back around I asked for the check, boxes, and side of spicy mayo to go. To get me cashed out and boxes it might've taken her less than 5 minutes which pushed me over the edge. I spent $44 on my lunch didn't get to enjoy it or eat more than a few bites... it wasn't even expensive but I just didn't enjoy my experience.. at all. They were quick to collect my money from me and send me on my way. I was trying to be as understanding and patient but all in all I felt we were being neglected and other tables had higher priority... I had high hopes here. I am sorry but I will not be returning.

Great experience. Had a group of 15 family and friends. They treated us wonderfully, the menu offering had something for everyone from Sushi, to Steaks, Seafood, Salads, and many more options. Allergy and Gluten issues were catered to, and the service was excellent. Marco the waiter was awesome. Very informative and patient and appreciative. We will be back!

This is our 3rd visit and only returned because we had a coupon. First visit was opening day, so we gave some slack on the lousy service. Second visit we were seated in the back which is dark and uninviting and service lacked. We said that was our last visit. When coupon came in mail we gave it another shot. Food is good but the service has been slow and inattentive on each visit. Too many good restaurants in Summerlin to come again. I predict this place won't last.

Front desk seemed a little confused and unorganized. We walked in at lunch time and left my name and number and was told that the table should be ready in about 20 minutes and that I will be receiving a text from them. We took a stroll around the area and went into a couple of the stores nearby to kill some time. 50 minutes had passed by and still no text. My boyfriend and I remembered that there was a BJ's across the street. We went there instead. No regrets (:

I know that this place had just opened up. So hopefully they get it together.

I work in the area and after work my friend said lets eat at crave. we did restaurant week.
we each had the pork dumplings. i also had the burger and he had the sushi box. 
2 hours later the food poisoning kicked in. I've been a restaurant manager before. so im understanding that things happen. I called to let them know what had happened that both my friend and I got very badly sick and we both had the dumplings. I was simply calling to alert them. i didn't want anything free. the host (like she has any training in this area) said "oh, food poisoning takes 24 hours to kick in." Even though that isn't true i didn't appreciate her fighting me when i was simply trying to help. 

She took down my name and number and said a manger would contact me to check in on me and how i was feeling. 

.......Well its a week later and no one called. 

I used to come here A LOT after work. NOT ANYMORE!

I went to check out Downtown Summerlin yesterday with a few of my girlfriends for the first time. After an hour or so of exploring the new shopping area, we wanted to find a place to enjoy drinks and share a few appetizers. 

We looked up happy hour specials nearby and found that we could still make it to Crave's happy hour. 

I really liked the atmosphere of the restaurant - very modern and attractive in decor. We sat at a hightop by the bar so we could partake in the happy hour discounted specials. 

For drinks, I ordered a glass of Chardonnay and one of my friends got the Kinky Mojito. I tried her drink; it tasted sour and I couldn't taste the alcohol. She didn't enjoy it either so she ordered wine for her second drink.

We all ordered our separate happy hour menu items and shared a Caprese Pizza. I ordered the Pork Belly Sliders and a Philly Roll. My friends ordered fries, Crispy Chicken Bites, a Futomaki Roll, and the Kogi Tacos.

The food wasn't bad... it was pretty average. The sliders had a unique taste - the pork belly was grilled in a Korean BBQ marinade and topped with a Kimchi relish. They were good, but nothing to rave about. The sushi rolls were rather large but I've had much better. I would not recommend this restaurant if you wanted to splurge on sushi. I enjoyed the fries my friend ordered, they were seasoned perfectly and came with a Peppercorn Avocado Ranch dipping sauce. You can never go wrong with fries!

Our server's name was Joelle and she was very sweet. Attentive to our needs and checked up on us throughout our meal. Nothing negative to say about her.

I would give Crave a 3/5 for the food and a 5/5 for the service. I would recommend Crave only for happy hour drink specials. I think I recall Blue Moons (my favorite beer) being only $4 during happy hour!

The food is so yummy! The wings are insanely good. It's also a super fun environment with a really unique and original menu. The food is delicious and the staff is extremely friendly. Will definitely be back!

I was in Vegas visiting my daughter and grandkids.  We went to Summerlin to do some Xmas shopping.  Since we were hungry , we decided to get a " quick bite " and go on our way.  The restaurant was not busy and we liked the fact that they were not playing loud obnoxious music.  Then everything went downhill.   In hind site i wish we had just left .  We had our menus which were long and there were about 3 different parts that went with the menu - there was the main one and then I think a lunch one and maybe something else.  The server asked what we wanted and we told her we needed more time but we did want some drinks and 2 waters    For whatever reason it took quite awhile to get our drinks and had to ask a 2nd time for water .  She finally reappeared to take our order and since we had already been there for 20" we requested an appetizer to ( hold us over ).   Another 10 - 15" went by  and no appetizer so we grabbed the manager (?)  and he said there was a mix up because of shift change and our appetizer had not been made yet !  To appease us he brought us some calamari (on the house because it had been made by mistake ). After another 20" we finally got our food, which was mediocre  and our server had her head in the clouds    Could hardly wait to get our boxes and check and get the hell out of there.   Awful experience. All total we were probably there an hour and 20 minutes    Certainly was not a quick bite.  It was  agonizing and we will never return ever !

Two weeks in & the place is still struggling with being new. Still not enough wait staff to support the place, as many tables were still empty on Friday night. The wait is still ridiculous (45 min for 2 people & we got there at 5:15). But it's still the only fancy-ish restaurant open yet. And the place is LOUD, like Red Robin loud. And no toilet seat covers...? What is this Europe? But the service was great, the rib eye was delicious, the potatoes were bland & the brussel sprouts were OK (they could use some bacon). The mini desserts were the best part. I'd go back, maybe months from now when they get their act together. PS. Watch your children people, those cactus out front are real!
The bimbimbap is special and tasty. I like it. It mixed some thai food element. Especially i am surprised to taste coconut rice.

If you are looking for a pleasant dining experience this is not the place to go. Was greeted with nothing, but attitude when we walked in the door from the hostess. We asked for a booth and were told they had to clean one. We said no problem we would wait. 10 minutes later we still had no booth. I asked the hostess what the delay was and she tells me sorry they are waiting for people to get up foe desert and it may be 15 more minutes. I told her the table was empty. She responds with, sorry someone else took that table and there is nothing she could do about it. I said can't you ask them to get up? Needless to say that wasn't happening either. Then I asked to speak to the manager and she did nothing to help either so we left and definitely won't be back. There are a lot of great options in the area. Don't waste your time or money here. Your business will not be appreciated.

The few times we have been there have been a mediocre experience.  I was expecting more being one of the anchor restaurants for the Downtown Summerlin mall.  Maybe it's just because they are working out the bugs.  The food is decent and presented well but the service is a little off still.  We've been there a total of 4 times and will wait to try again in the future when they have some more experience.

I've dined at Crave restaurant twice.  The food was just ok.  Nothing to rave about.  The atmosphere is nice.  The management staff was just mediocre.  During my first experience, our party ordered 4 Sangria's.  The waiter heads over with the drinks, places three on the table and drops the fourth.  Glass and red sangria spill all over my sister.  The waiter was very apologetic, but the management staffs response was lackluster at best.  They made no attempts to accomodate my sister or replace her sweater which now had red sangria and glass all over it.  The manager never provided her card or name for follow up.  This experience left a bitter taste with us, forcing us to move our weekly girls outing to another location.
Lisa& I came here for lunch. Have to say very nice place with different variety food. The customer service friendly& helpful. Highly recommend this place to everyone ..

The food in this restaurant sucks had the sushi roll that was bland. Also had some cooked fish dish was was ok at best. The burger was cooked incorrectly and I had to return it. This place is nicely decorated. It was real noisy when we were there. The menu has too many food options they should concentrate on one type and keep the menu simple! $80.00 for  two people dinner and left disappointed!!! I'll take my money elsewhere next time!!!

Definitely won't be back to this place!

So disappointed not because of the food mattar of a fact the food was great, but because of the poor treatment that we received from the manager. To my knowledge dogs are not allowed in restaurant unless is stated some where on there wall/door/ window, we were subjected to witness dog pissing next to our table while our food being served sat through the smell, and we mentioned that to the manager she said I can move you!!!! Really???? There was 9 of us the food is in front of us we were her first!!!! No apology nothing. I'm surprised and I had never experienced such a poor treatment from restaurant manager. Crave you disappointed me, never again .

This midwest chain recently opened in the new Downtown Summerlin complex. It claims to be chef driven -- and maybe it is -- but the quality and execution is on par with similar chain restaurants. The duck confit flatbread ($15.95) was one of the more interesting sounding dishes, but there wasn't enough duck to balance out the sweetness of all the fig marmalade. The lemon garlic wings ($13.95) were huge, but the heavy lemon flavor made them unappealing. The Crave burger ($13.95) wasn't bad. It's a simple burger made up of an angus patty, smoked cheddar, lettuce, tomato, onion and their signature burger sauce. The undercooked and under seasoned patty were the only thing holding it back from being a decent burger. Desserts fared much better. Although for someone with a sweet tooth like mine it's tough to screw up chocolate cake ($7.95) -- five layers of dense, moist, sweet chocolate cake. It was, however, lacking a sufficient amount of the orange creme anglaise mentioned on the menu. The S'mores brownie ($7.95) had some enticing elements like the chewy brownie and the marshmallow ice cream, but the amount of torched marshmallow topping the brownie was overload.

With so many other places in town to try, I'm not sure I'll return. Sure, they have a large menu, which also includes sushi but the combination of that and American food in the same restaurant is an even bigger deterrent to my return.

2.5 Stars
I loved the salmon salad!  So good I wanted to lick the plate clean.  Granted, the service was a bit off but our server was nice.  The truffle fries were YUM.  I would go back just for the salad.

After reading the reviews I was kind of skeptical to try this place out. Most people complained about long waits to get seated and for food to come out. But as a new restaurant I know they're probably still adjusting and learning so I tried anyways.

I was not disappointed.  We did get seated immediately,  I guess we were lucky. I had a hard time deciding so our waiter helped us decide. I wanted a burger so he highly recommended the bison burger.  And if anyone is planning on eating there, please please please try it. It was the best burger I ever had! 

The peach ice tea on the other hand did not taste good. It wasn't sweet at all. So I don't recommend that. 

Price was a little high I must say

But other than that it was good. I will be going back in the future. We had excellent customer service when I went

Normally when we frequent Crave, which is about 3-4 times a month, we are very happy. Food is good, service is good, all around very nice. However, today we went and ordered ice-t and the waiter informed us the machine was broken so we could not have ice-t which was fine. We then ordered bottled water and he then informed is that they were out of bottled water as well! How disappointing !!!!!! We left and went to CPK next door. 


Went back to Crave after a less than stellar performance the last time and they got it all right! Everything was amazing! We had sashimi and it was spot on! There are two Maggie's that work there. Both are servers and both are very very good at their jobs! Thank you Crave for making tonight's visit what we are accustomed to!

Damn....What can I say. Bad service. (45 mins) for a drink. No acknowledgement. Yea not good. We gave this place a 3rd shot....As they say. 1, 2, 3 Strikes your OUT!! Never again. Sorry not sorry. Shake Shack it is!!

Service was terrible. I had to get my own refill at the bar......our plates weren't removed till about 15 minutes after we finished our apps.  The restaurant was nearly empty ( now I know why) the food was okay. The bison burger was excellent  but the sushi was bland with no flavor. I've worked as a food server in the past and I would not recommend this place for lunch nor dinner. The service was terrible. This was our first time here and it did not impress. ..... Good thing there are more options to eat around summerlin mall...

I tried this place fir the first time for a late dinner. I thought the menu had a nice variety and the food was pretty good. If you can score a discount coupon it is a great deal. Our server was friendly and attentive.

Well my husband and I with some friends decided to ignore the recent reviews and try this new restaurant. We all thought let's give it a try and chance. We went for happy hour and at first it was ok. We ordered drinks and appetizers though our food came first warm we had to ask for our drinks ... A bit strange !!! Then we ordered  a second round food was cold and our drinks were not only total wrong and completely off with no alcohol and they served a martini in a juice glass !! Who does that !! The drink that was to be made with rum was served with a splash of whisky instead. Service was horrible had to ask for everything at least twice. Happy hour  for what you got is pricy and don't go in the bathrooms I had to rummage thru the storage units to find the toilet paper. To say the least if they don't get it together this Restaurant won't last !!! I expected a lot more especially from a new Summerlin hot spot.

The family and I decided to check out this new restaurant because there seemed to be a lot of buzz around it. We stopped by for a late afternoon bite and walked into a crowded entry. The place just opened, why wouldn't it be packed in here! However, that was not the case, there were 4 tables and 2 couch areas opened on the outside patio and the bar area had only a handful of patrons. There were 3 women at the hostess podium who were engaged in their own conversation. It looked like they were trying to figure what they were going to do. There was no friendly greeting nor did they even acknowledge our existence. One walked away, another when to seat the group in front of us, the blonde in the white shirt (I'm assuming she was management since everyone else was in all black) continued to ignore us and stare at her laptop even as I walked up to her. Another girl came by and greeted us, I asked if we could be seated outside. She commented that we can but she's not sure if there were any open tables as she hesitantly went to go check. My Husband commented that there were open tables, she returned a minute later and directed us to the patio. 

Our server was friendly, however service was bad. It took a while for him to greet us, take our drink order, take our food order, and our food took 40 mins. If the food was good, the wait time could easily be overlooked. The food is MEDIOCRE AT BEST! Seriously, we travel a lot, we eat out a lot and we love trying new places, nor are we snooty food critics. We simply enjoy dining out and appreciate getting what we pay for.

The menu is all over the place so I had a hard time deciding on what I wanted. There's sushi, burgers, pasta, salads, etc. There's no rhyme or reason for the menu. I ordered a salad and added a grilled chicken breast, my husband got the crave burger and our daughter got the baked mac n cheese. Yeah, we settled for this because nothing else seemed appetizing and as much as we love sushi I'm glad we didn't order from here. 

Again, the food was mediocre at best you can go elsewhere to get better food. The icing on the cake however was that THEY RAN OUT OF BEER! The server was kind enough to tell my husband that there was a possibility that they were out of Stella and make a 2nd choice just in case. The server ended up coming back because they were also out of his 2nd choice which was Miller Lite. Are you kidding me?? OH and did I mention, I also ordered a cocktail, some dragon drink. I don't remember the name of it nor can I comment on it because I NEVER GOT MY DRINK! I get it they just opened up, but you ran out of at least 2 types of beer at 4pm?

There's not too many restaurants open at Downtown Summerlin yet, until then go to the Red Rock Casino and enjoy better food and over 150 beers on tap at the Yard House!

Visited Memorial Day. Nice looking place, waited a few minutes fro a greeter to arrive, some what bizarre for the size of place. Waitstaff was very friendly but overworked. 
Food could have been great, but seasonings way off. Beef taco, too salty to eat, Mac and cheese bland, Maui Maui was overcooked and no seasoning. The food looked great, but not tasty.  Server never brought wine ordered to wife, so she had enough. Happy hour prices were not discounted on ticket. $81 for 2 adults and one teen, not worth the cost.

Maybe a good place to go after work and have a drink in bar, nice atmosphere. If you want dinner, Yard House a similar concept, much better choice.

Super pricey and not that delicious! We spent Valentine's Day at home with and invited our best friends (another couple) over and my bf ordered food from bite squad to be delivered to home. The packaging of the food was ugly, and the portions were ridiculously small! My bf spent over 300$ that night and everything was blah! Nothing special even the chocolate cakes he ordered (tasted like grocery store cake). Complete disappointment.

CRAVE... I tried to enjoy this place...
We came in to Crave to kill some time before our movie.
This review has nothing to do with wait time...lucky for us there were two seats open  at their bar. The restaurant has a nice vibe...very comfortable. 

Ordered the Kogi beef tacos...
The food runner came out with the tacos and another entree looking a bit lost as to where to deliver it to. After realizing that it was our order, I told him we never ordered the second item so he hands it to the bartender who then passes it around the bar asking if it belongs to anyone. It ended up sitting behind the bar for the rest of the time that we were there. 
Very unorganized system they have going on...

The Kogi beef tacos itself was very bad. I took one bite and passed it off to my friend who eats anything and everything but even admitted that it was pretty terrible. The meat tasted as if it was marinated in butter rather than cooked with it. The bite left a very unpleasant greasy film like taste in my mouth. 
I will not be coming back to try anything else on their food menu.

Loved it! 

Beautiful space, excellent service and great food. The chicken strips appetizer was spicy and delicious. For my entree I had the jicama and grapefruit salad. It was fantastic. Impressive wine list and I had a cocktail I wasn't overly impressed with but it was pretty good too.

We went here for a family dinner and we were all pretty impressed. Aside from the service glitches, CRAVE is on the right path. 

For starters we placed an order of the cheese and bacon loaded tater tots in addition to edamame. Plain edamame can get pretty boring, CRAVE adds a twist by tossing the edamame in a special sauce blend - so good! 

For an entree, I was craving (ha!) a burger, so I went with the 702 burger and I loved it! The bacon was the right amount of crispy, the burger was cooked exactly how I ordered it and the egg was a perfect touch... in hindsight, I'm wondering why they didn't just call it a breakfast or hangover burger, ha!

CRAVE has a decent beer list, when it's available. It took me three beer brands to finally order something that they actually had in house... Pro Tip: Update your menu as often as you switch out the menu items so that your guests don't get let down. 

The only major discrepancy was the service... the evening wasn't TOO cold so we wanted to sit outside. The hostess was prompt and our wish was granted. The server, not so prompt. I feel like it took her quite a bit to greet us and when she finally did, we were treated as if we were inconveniencing her more than anything. She couldn't seem to get away from our table fast enough... quick to walk away before everyone had even had their questions answered. People have bad days/nights though, so I'm willing to give it another shot!

*2016 Yelp Review Challenge: 19/100*

Got the scallops & risotto, it was ok good not great. $30 for 4 scallops and a small scoop of risotto.  Friends got the crab topped steak filet...they said it was just ok.  Don't waste your money....there are many better restaurants around here.

Geesh people give them a minute! I saw amount of stars and almost didn't go but if you read them everyone is complaining about the girls at the front. My gosh they've been there like a week let them settle in. 

The food here is really amazing. The sushi roll I had was amazing I can't wait to go back and try literally everything on the menu. "I" actually messed up and ordered my sushi wrong and they fixed it even though it was my fault. (Mexican roll...YUM!)

Our waiter was super friendly and prompt. I hope people read reviews because the stars are a bad reflection of the food. I'm super snobby when it come to food and this place was GREAT!

Check it out yourself and leave a review if you love it. Yelpers shouldn't leave reviews on service of a brand new restaurant at least give them 30 days come on people!

A bit overpriced, but for being part of the new downtown summerlin, I can see how they want to cater for a certain crowd.

Came here for an office lunch, we made reservations for 10. Even though we had a reservation and made it on time, we still had to wait 20mins. Not too bad, but you would think they have the table ready for a reservation beforehand. 

The sushi was OK, I had better. I feel it was somewhat plain with the menu only showing the 'standard' specials. Like spicy crunch tuna...etc. nothing too fancy that can be seen as signature. 

As for the entrees, we had a bunch of sandwiches, standard BLT, burgers, etc. the the Kobe burger was the most fancy one. I personally had the sautéed Norwegian salmon. The fish was tender, flavorful, but not dry. The sauce was creamy and perfectly paired with the veggies and fish. I recommend this 100%. For this fish alone, I would come back, my husband likes classic burgers so he is good with that.

The ambiance is nice, very modern, suiting the overall setting of the mall. Only visited during lunch, so we'll see how dinner will be. Perhaps I'll update the review when we have done so with my dinner experience.

Staff was friendly, didn't know the specials, again, went here opening week, so I'm sure everything was new.

Located in Downtown Summerlin. Sushi and burgers on the same menu!?! Why? You may be asking! Why Not! Is my reply. There is something for everyone here. Everything was fresh, the service was very good. So what else are you asking for? Reasonable prices? You got it. So take a break from shopping, stop in and enjoy yourself. Live It Up You Are In Las Vegas For Cryin' Out Loud!

Crave for lunch and drinks. My friend and I had the Hoshii Boat which is a small boat and a small amount of sushi. We also had the scallop poppers which is baked scallops wrapped in salmon with dynamite sauce it was delicious. I have to say I will be back for the drinks. My friend and I enjoyed the white sangria  it was refreshing!  I would also like to try other dishes on the menu. Our waitress was also super nice made us feel comfortable and was friendly.

My aunt and I stopped in Crave for some post Christmas shopping lunch. It was a beautiful place to dine and the food was good. My aunt enjoyed a sweet potato soup, while I opted for a sushi roll and chicken wings. Everything came out pretty quick and the staff was nice. There was nothing cosmic about my meal, but it was good. If in the area I wouldn't be opposed to eating there again, but I would probably try another place before opting for a repeat Crave experience.
Have been here a couple of times. It is a great spot for relaxing after shopping in Downtown Summerlin. The service is always great and they have a variety of food, including sushi!
Great food.  Service was amazing!  Our Waiter was Jake.  Best service I have had in a long time!  Nicole the Hostess is a sweetheart!  Definitely recommend!

It was my first time here and I was very satisfied with my experience. The food was so delicious and the service was outstanding! Our waiters name was Jordan. He did an amazing job. I will definitely recommend this place!

had a birthday celebration at Crave last night. we were a bigger group of about 12 people, we were promptly greeted and asked if we were celebrating anything special, we replied yes a birthday! server brought waters but never asked if we wanted to order drinks, we of course asked him for drinks. then asked if we were ready to order instead of offering appetizers first, so we all ordered apps n entree at same time. service could have been better! most everyone ordered dessert but they never did anything for the birthday girl, that was pretty rude!

Very slow service at 3pm even if it was after lunch hours....it took 30 minutes to serve my food, but manager apologized.....can you imagine if it is during lunch or dinner times.....food is mediocre and not worth the money.....

When I first saw this restaurant in Downtown Summerlin, I wanted to eat here. It seemed modern and interesting. Plus that, it was crowded so must be a good thing. It was easy to make reservations and I made them on open table. 
There were a lot of items to choose from on the menu from appetizers to drinks to entrees to desserts...we just got to come back again. For our appetizers, we tried their edamame and namasu (guess we missed Hawai'i a little). I had the mahimahi with shrimp and macadamia nut rice and banana fig butter. "So Ono!"  My husband just loved his sea bass with pesto and guacamole salsa. So innovative. 
We had a difficult time deciding on dessert but finally decided on the sampler with 3 items; triple berry, blueberry cheesecake and chocolate silk parfaits. 
The next time we visit Vegas, Crave is a must!

We tried this establishment when it first opened. We walked into the place it smelled like rotten fish. We ordered our food needless to say it was just terrible. 5 of us no one had a nice thing to say. I will say the manager with kind and, most of the mail which we did not ask for. She encouraged us to try this again. We tried a few weeks ago oh, I'm sorry to say we have to pass.

At first we went, everything was perfect. The food was delicious, or so we thought, everything went well. The waitress messed up our orders but it was ok, not a big deal. We had to pay for bread which was kinda strange but again, not a big deal. Dinner went well and everything was alright. It's what's in the food that I question. My boyfriend and I and his parents we to eat there, we all ordered different things but idk something in the food have ALL FOUR of us diarrhea and tummy aches.  Boyfriend and I have been on the toilet for two days now along with his parents. This is really sketchy, I don't know how they did or what they did in the kitchen but I'm definitely never coming back. Awful explosive diarrhea and stomach aches. Spent $170 there just to get sick after. Very disappointed, I had really high expectations.

My party of 4 was told there would be a 30 minute wait for a table. Since it was opening weekend that didn't seem so bad. The whole front desk situation was pretty disorganized and chaotic.
While waiting, I asked to use the restroom and walked through a half empty restaurant which we were told was due to a "shift change".
We were finally seated right next to the open kitchen and placed our orders. Plates that were out when we first sat down were waiting for a least 30 minutes before they were finally thrown away. In fact, by my estimation, at least (and probably more) than half of the food put out was thrown away because it sat too long. This didn't make much sense because there were tons of wait staff standing around waiting for plates that were never passed to them. 
I can't speak about the quality of the food because after an hour we never received our food. I had a hard time sitting any longer watching food get thrown away while we waited. 
Crave is the only restaurant open at Downtown Summerlin which seems like it would put them in a great position. If they don't get their act together then I don't see them still being open in 6 weeks when all the other restaurants open.

First off...those who are reading reviews about wanting to go to Crave, ignore all the reviews where people are bashing them about service.  Keep in mind, they just recently open and like all new restaurants, venues, hotels, there will always be some level of service issue.

I for one can say, we did experience some negative service but not by the staff.  But the organization of the kitchen.  Our experience ended up where dinner turned out to be an 2 hour ordeal, but it wasn't unpleasant as the staff were very tentative and apologetic.  We sat by the kitchen so we were able to see what all the held up was.  So I can ding them for the slow service but I am not going to because service provided by the staff was execellent and I honestly cannot fault the staff for something that is out of their control.  I would say the the GM is to look at your kitchen, your line cook and get that together.  But I won't be harsh because we went on openinlg weekend.

Now for the food, I made two appetizer plates into my dinner; the Pork Belly Sliders with kimchi, Korean BBQ sauce, cilantro and the Kogi Beef Tacos with red miso, napa slaw, sesame.  I was a bit disappointed that the Pork Belly Sliders weren't serve in the steam buns that I am so used to have pork belly with, but the flavor and the meat was excellent!  I may ask next time when I order to see if it is possible to get the steam buns.  Now the Kogi Beef Tacos were my favorite!  I can eat those ALL DAY!  And I might even just order two of those next time as dinner!  The meat was so flavorful and rich, with the red miso, napa slaw to give it that nice sweet and spicy kick!  

I can't find fault in this place.  Food was good, service (staff) were attentive and friendly and I am sure it will take time for the kitchen to figure out a smooth system.  Until then, I will still be coming back!

Came here for the first time last night. Wasn't very impressed. The hostesses were nice & since there was an hour left of happy hour and my honey is a beer connoisseur we decided to sit at the bar. Wow, wish we would have just gotten a table. 

One of the bartenders came around & asked me what I'd like to drink. I asked if they had coke. She said "umm..." And had to turn around to look at the sodas to see. Then she said yes they did. After she brought our drinks, somehow she disappeared & another woman bartender, Samantha, took over. 

Now I'm not sure what was going on behind the bar, but there was some drama & confusion because the three bartenders were muttering to each other. I'm not sure what the problems were but you could tell they were stressed out. I've worked in restaurants before & I understand how stressful it can be, but that's no excuse to give bad service. And that's what she did. 

We asked for menus & decided we'd just order some apps from the happy hour menu. Samantha, in the middle of listening to our order, walked away from us when another bartender walked by her and said something to her. Just walked away! I wasn't sure if she had gotten all of our order or what! Then she came back and said "I'm sorry" & looked at us so we ordered again. 

Basically once we ordered we hardly saw her again. Pretty sad considering we were AT THE BAR and so on front of her the whole time.

Our food was good, especially the beef tacos & the tempura sushi. Very good. 

When it was time to pay the bill we put the money in the glass & waited for Samantha to close it out. Only she didn't pick it up. She kept walking back & forth, making drinks, etc. completely ignoring us until finally my boyfriend called out "excuse me. We'd like to close our tab out". Pretty sad. 

All in all, we'll probably go back again. But never will I sit at the bar.

I stopped by for a happy hour meetup. I ordered some sushi. I love sushi, but it is not so fresh here. I am not sure why I expected it to be good. I did really like the brownie desert. I can't remember the exact name. I shared it with some friends, but we also found a piece of hair in the ice cream. Buzz kill. ha. I am not sure I would go back.

If you are going to offer a gluten-free or "gluten-sensitive" menu then make sure that the items on it are actually so. After ordering I was informed that both of the options for sides to my burger (a spinach salad or fries) are both not gluten-free. Why were they even listed as options on the specifically gluten-free menu?

30 minutes to get drinks, (beer for me, and lemonade for kids).  This was very disorganized situation understandably being the opening day of downtown summerlin.  The food was above average actually so they get 2 stars when you factor in 30 minutes to get the first drinks, and almost 1.5 hours for food to arrive.  The complete disorganized situation negates the desire to return here.

My first visit here was a refreshing new dining experience.  My party of four was greeted warmly by the hostess, and we were quickly escorted to our reserved booth amidst the plush decor and opulent design of this relatively new addition to Downtown Summerlin.

Pan-fried Pork Dumplings was a good opener.  A cup of seasonal Lamb Meatball Soup was so spicy it literally took my breath away, but was nevertheless quite tasty.  To the degree that next time I will order a bowl!  Pan-fried Pork Dumplings were crispy and also tasty.

A nicely laid out massive Wedge Salad with Blue Cheese Dressing was a refreshing starter.  And Pita Bread from an ordered Bread Basket was supple and fine.  

For my entree, Beef Stroganoff, with Braised Short Rib, Mushroom Cream Sauce, and a large dab of Horseradish Chive Sour Cream was meaty and quite satisfying.  And, seated beside me, Diane very much enjoyed here real creamy Mac & Cheese.  

Dakota, our server, was friendly, helpful, and proficient in all waitressing tasks  The restaurant manager stopped by three times to chat briefly with us and check on our dining progress.  Afterwards, our dining companions were effusive in their praise for this restaurant.  And, I will surely be back!

4-1/2 stars overall on this autumn night!

Excellent stop in Downtown Summerlin. The food and ambience was phenomenal. Had the Lemon garlic wings. Came out piping hot and delicious. The happy hour specials were a great deal too. Will come back

Went during happy hour, when there are certain appetizers for half off. Buffalo wings were among as well as crispy chicken sliders. They are also in the process of revamping their menu. I also got this cheesecake/ came. It was very light and had a lemon like flavor. I forgot what it was called, here is a picture below.

I had the bison burger with pork belly. The pork belly was under cooked and I got severe food poisoning, which worked out great since it was Christmas eve. I had the worst holiday ever on the toilet.

Besides the food poisoning, the menu is all over the place, the ambience is nothing special, and the food is a bit over priced. I hope this place goes out of business ASAP. Oh, the server took 15 minutes to get my beer as well and they weren't even packed.

This place is GARBAGE.

I went there on a Wednesday night and it was deserted. Happy hour is from 9 pm to close. Ordered buffalo wings and they came out cold. They were gracious enough to make them for me again but they were slightly better than the first order. I was hungry and so I didn't complain. In addition to the wings, I had chips and guacamole, plus crispy pork dumplings. Both wee alright. Maybe next time, IF I go back, I will try the sushi. The waitress was really nice and attentive which really helped. The food wasn't horrible but it wasn't anything spectacular. The best part of the meal was my mini dessert!

The ratings seem to be ranking this place pretty average, but Crave is one of the better options at Downtown Summerlin. Prices are a pretty penny for what you get, but they offer specials like $50/couple Date Night entrees and wine, discounted sushi days, and such. They do offer an "Under $10" snack section that trends to small and disappointing, but I guess it's the thought that's supposed to count.

LEMON GARLIC WINGS: I'll start with the positive menu items. Hot damn these were good! Fragrant with garlic, flavorful and crispy, and served as the full wing rather than just the drumstick as elsewhere. Even the bleu cheese dipping sauce, while totally unnecessary because the chicken itself was delicious, was good.
CRAB ARTICHOKE DIP: This was tasty, decent amount of meat combined with a "lemony mayo" that gave it a bit more flavor than other versions. Served with thin triangles of flatbread, but we mostly at it with the aforementioned tortilla chips. Though there was crab in this dip, there wasn't much in the way of artichoke, surprisingly. $15 for a small, shareable appetizer portion.
CHIPS & GUAC/PICO: Chips with guac and chips with pico are both listed on the "snacks" section, and they're fine. Portion is small to match the $5 price tag. Guac was fresh, pico was boring and bland. Having a solid house salsa would be a better option.
NEGIHAMA ROLL: Simple maki-style roll with a white fish, seasoned with some green onion and a hint of ponzu. Fresh and tasty, if a bit on the boring side. Can't really argue with the $5 price, kind of hits the spot if you're craving sushi but don't want to do a full meal of it.

Service was lackluster: initially walked in to an unmanned hostess stand, as we debated whether to dine elsewhere, she returned and told us to seat ourselves if we were going to be in the bar area. 15 minutes later, no one had acknowledged us so we went back to the hostess to receive an actual table. She didn't seem surprised or apologetic, so this may be the norm. Server was less than efficient and not particularly personable. 

As other reviews have stated, the menu is all over the place with apps, pastas, burgers, fish dishes, and sushi, leading to a 'jack of all trades, master of none' feeling. Despite sampling a few different types of dishes, I can't honestly say there's one they do best. Will likely be coming back to try their date night or sushi specials. 

NOTE: For those with Celiac disease, they do offer a dedicated GF menu that isn't as sparse or boring as other places.
Just average.  Great sushi specials if you like that sort of thing.

My wife and I decided to try Crave for the first time yesterday. The restaurant is designed to be very comfortable and inviting. Overall I gave the restaurant four stars because I thought my meal and the meal my wife ate was really good. If I had to rate the service from our waiter who was named Craig, I would give him a a solid 5 star rating. He was very friendly and attentive to our every need. I guess everybody has their own experiences here, but I know for sure that my wife and I will be going back again and hopefully we get Craig as our waiter.

Not worth the hype :( me and my friends desiderate to eat here...well food quality was good, I order there burger I give it a 8/10 services was 2/10 we couldn't even order deserts because  it was taking forever to serve us the place was nice, I decided to park valet, well I had to run to get my car because they close at 9pm kind of dumb when the restaurant close at 10pm kind of  expensive for the experience, will not be back again.
When can a steakhouse be great and great sushi? When it's Crave!  Great filet mignon, delicious tomato basil soup! Husband got sushi and it was delish!!  I recommend this place!

We had a buy 1 entree, get 1 free coupon and it was well worth it. Girlfriend had the Sea Bass and I had the Beef Tournedos (filet medallions). Both meals were excellent. I think they may have been a little understaffed on this night but our waitress was moving as fast as possible. The Tournedos were served with mashed potatoes and asparagus with a peppercorn sauce for the meat. Meat was tender and tasted great. The sea bass was served over rice with a pesto sauce. I had a bite--flaky and excellent flavor. The place was hopping this night. We were very pleased with the meal. Couldn't beat the 2 for 1 deal either.
Atmosphere is nice, casual, well appointed. Service was fine. Hostesses very nice. Food was ordinary. Out of 5 in our party, four would not return.  The fifth had left so didn't weigh in!

It was just before 10pm, they are still open. Went up to the host's stand to get a table. The girl said sorry we're closed. I asked "what time do you close?"  she said 10. I said well it is 10 to 10 so you are still opened. She said sorry the kitchen is closing and by time you order will be too late. Wow for a new business trying to make it not very professional. They should be happy to get what ever business comes in. Won't be back!! Impression starts at the front door!

My wife and I came here 3 weeks ago. Service was great and the meals were very good. I made a reservation last week for 5 of us. The hostess asked if this was a special occasion, I told her yes. Our daughter was coming in from New York to celebrate her 30th birthday. 

We arrived on time and we we sat within 5 minutes. Four of us were served our meals, unfortunately we had to wait 10 minutes for our last meal. One of our party ordered the Bison burger medium rare. It was well done. 

I understand that things happen, but why ask if it is a special occasion, and then do nothing but bring the check. Disappointing.

Oh well.

Decided to give this place a try.  Place was esthetically great, but to bad the food did not look or taste as good!  Very disappointed with the selections had.  Started with a blueberry lemonade which was good, but not the best I ever had. It was more of a mojito and I'm never one to hate in a good drink.  Moving on to the Crab-cakes with jalapeño sauce. They were a bit on the sweet side and the jalapeño was very, very lacking.  The salad with baby greens and tomatoes was good.  Then we ordered the pork belly sliders.  Huge disappoint and maybe I'm just spoiled ( I blame a certain somebody for that) but none the less pork belly was a little to chewy for my taste and the garnish in it has a refrigerator taste.   The Kobe beef tacos were actually one of the better items. If you order this is probably a must just ask for garnish in side as it made the tacos soggy, but the meat was cooked well and very tasty.   And last but not least the Mac and cheese with sausage was good.......yes, here it comes it lacked salt or some sort of a step up to make good and something worth recommending .  The sad part is after i posted I was here then I got comments that this was not the place to eat. To say the least I feel like I spent money for something I didn't enjoy.   Our server was nice and accommodating and that is the reason they get two stars.  This place seems to have potential , but food needs a bit of a rework and the presentation needs to be part of that stepping it up!!

While it appears to be of something awesome by its outer and inner appearance, sadly, it wasn't for me with the food. BUT!

But here goes to my fair judgment. First impression, 5 stars! From the time we entered, to the hostess seating us and so forth...wonderful! I was excited to stare at the menu. The menu wasn't overwhelming nor was it needing more. Remember, tis all an opinion! 

I was tossing between a bison burger which has pork belly, cilantro, and a couple more add-ons that I can't recall. I just kept reading pork belly, pork belly, pork belly. Lol. Not one to eat pork too often, although, I do enjoy some good home fried or bbq pork belly a few times in a year. So, passed on the bison burger. I ended up ordering the chicken caprese sandwich which is basically chicken, mozzarella, arugula, tomatoes, a drizzle of the balsamic glaze, and placed in tandoori bread. Which is pretty much a pita bread.

How boring I know. But I love caprese anything! Simple ingredients but it could easily be messed up! Plus, it was 7 something at night and i didnt really have the stomach for a burger even though deep down inside i was longing for one. 

When I received my order I thought, aww....this looks deelish. I took a bite and thought damn, I need more of that balsamic glaze because there were droplets of it in my sandwich and I needed more since I could barely taste the balsamic. Waved our waiter down and he happily gave me more. Which by the way our waiter was always in sight!  Alright, so more glaze to drench this sandwich in. 

I didn't really care for this type of sandwich with the tandoori bread. It felt sloppy. It was like eating this giant taco with each bite I had to ensure I gripped that sucker or else it'd fall apart. Annnnd if you didn't bite into it methodically it could get messy. But, probably because I added a little more glaze? Not sure. But it was a little uncomfortable biting into considering it is labeled as a sandwich.

The fries were crispy with a mush. I don't even know how that happens, but I liked it. Didn't get the parmesan fries for a 2.5 dollar upgrade...so regular fries it was. 

I can only offer 2 stars because of the staff and ambiance. My food wasn't something that blew me away or thought, hell yes I'll be back for THAT caprese sandwich. The husband ordered the sandwich that had the apples, brie, and grapes? He usually likes that combo but he too thought twas pretty basic. It truely felt it lacked effort. I mean, how exciting can you make a caprese sandwich. Believe me, I've had perfectly executed caprese whether twas a salad, slider, flatbread, bruschetta, etc....you get it. This really was pretty blunt.

Will I be back? Ummm....maybe just to try the other things in hopes to up my review. How soon? Probably not that soon because there are so much more other eateries there for me to experience first. Will I recommend it? Ummm...probably wouldn't be a place during a convo where I'd even mention it! Nothing memorable. But I wouldn't count them out only because it was my first time there and I only tried 1
 food off their item. 

I do love, though, how they serve each child a bowl of complimentary fruit as all the adults read through the menu. They were very quick to bring that out. That's the way to shut these gremlins up so us adults can focus. Lol.

You try for yourself kind of place.

Definitely kid and stroller friendly! Oh, and a highchair with an actual working buckle!

This is one of the few cool bars/restaurants in downtown Summerlin. They have some drinks and food on happy hour but most of the items are very small. Their signature drinks are really good, I tried the Michelada (which is great if you like spicy items), Raspberry Ginger Gimlet (was super good, very refreshing, somewhat sweet and with a great flavor) and the Angry Dragon (also a very tasty and flavorful drink) if you are not into prepared drinks they also have a large selection of beer. 
The atmosphere of the restaurant is very inviting. The decor is fresh and modern but somewhat relaxed at the same time. 
We tried the mini chicken apple sauce flat bread which was good, but nothing that I would be craving. The crispy chicken bites were just ok, but again the size portions were small. We ordered a few rolls and they were no big deal, I'm sure I can get the same quality at Smiths. Overall a good place for drinks, but there are probably better options out there.

Great place to enjoy lunch or dinner. We both enjoyed the Chicken Pasta Rosa. I would like to recognize our server Cassie who provided outstanding service. Five Stars to you Cassie. I highly recommend you try The Crave for either lunch or dinner.

Second time I've eaten here.  Food good. Service absolutely the worst and slowest on the planet.  
 Each time
I've been here 25 minutes to order cocktails and server rarely returned. 

Also looks like a cafeteria style setting way too any tables that are empty.

Don't go hungry. This place is slowwwwwwwww. Party of 5 last night. Watched my daughters COLD sushi sit near a heat lamp for 37 minutes before attempting to be served. Then when they did we refused it. Brought us another. Manager came over. Lady and I don't think she was a manager and just apologized. I felt very sorry for our server. She was working hard but the kitchen staff needs work yet. They opened way too soon. Won't try again until next year!! Save your $$$ on this place until they work the kinks out!

3 stars is exactly what it is...although if you consider the prices it maybe should be 2.5. Food was ok, service was ok, and the place was pretty empty for a Friday night. When you are paying good money you should not have to ask for silverware when your food gets to the table. I found it funny that all the empty tables had bread plates, but no silverware. I don't feel any need to go back, so I guess I'll wait for it to go out of business  and change hands before I return.

We have eaten here twice now and are probably not going to again...  

The first time we came was 9:00 on a Friday night, it was mostly empty, and we were seated promptly. The food came out quickly. I really enjoyed my lettuce wraps because they were already assembled! My husband loved his sake and his sushi roll. The server was happy and friendly. I got a coupon in the mail which I actually remembered to use for once! It was just the two of us and we had a good experience overall. 

The second time was 9:00 on a Saturday night, it was mostly empty (again) and we were seated promptly. The server seemed put-out by the 5 of us being there. We ordered our drinks and the other 4 people at my table got them at one time and my glass of wine came 15 minutes later. When it finally arrived, he said "Sorry, we had to open a new bottle of wine". Since when does it take 15 minutes to open a bottle wine in a mostly empty restaurant? Then the food finally came out and the guy quickly disappeared before my husband (who got sushi) could realize he had no chop sticks! Since the server didn't return for 15 minutes, he ate half of his dish with a fork before he could even ask for chop sticks... fail! Then he brought us the bill and disappeared without saying anything. We were like, wait, we wanted to order another round of drinks. What if we wanted dessert? Ok, we get the hint, we will pay and leave. Seriously, we got the hint!

I can't really figure out why this place is only getting a three star rating... When I loved my dish...I will say a lot of their entree dishes are severely over priced... Which is what I am going to deduct stars for...And my mom was not impressed with her chicken farfalle. It was a 20.95 dinner priced item (it was also a lunch sized portion that they only charge you 13.95 during the day for). Don't order it unless you're there for lunch... Not worth the money and you won't be getting extra food... Or even a dinner salad with the dish.

My dinner was great... Price point was on point. They accommodated me totally, Being vegan and Taking out the sashimi and adding a few extra cucumber and avocado rolls. The veggie roll it came with was delicious and flavorful. The rice was just a tad but dry... And I would always prefer brown over white... I'll ask next time if that's an option. It was 13.95 for a lot of food... Saving them some stars..

The edamame app was severely over priced.  8 dollars for a child sized portion... I'm not sure why I even ordered it or what I was thinking... But it wasn't worth 8 bucks... I could of got 4 large bags of traders joes edamame... For what I spent on one serving there. Never again. Please note they use fish sauce... So order it steamed... With just Lemon and sea salt if you are vegan. 

The server was really accommodating and sweet. She was on top of the table and we never had to ask for anything. She was knowledgable about the menu and accommodating to my life style. I probably will come back for happy hour... Or lunch... But 50 bucks for dinner... For the two of us... For two mediocre dishes is not really my thing... My dish was amazing and so was the service. That's whats earning them three stars. Get your prices together guys! If I'm spending 20 dollars on an entree... I don't want the bottoms of my table to be balanced with napkins on the ends of the legs to keep it from wobbling... Or having a free stoli bright read umbrella over my head... Yes those are free from
The liquor reps... Fix the patio decor and ambiance... Throw a candle on the table... Make me feel like I'm in a 20 dollar entree price point.... You guys can do better than 3 stars!! I'm coming back to give it another chance... And I'll update accordingly... Hopefully your happy hour saves you next time.

We started with the jalapeño humus appetizer. It was very good but the flat bread that it came with I felt was too soft. It should be crispy. The little tomatoes on the side was very amazing. My husband had the 702 burger which he said was delicious! The fries were a little under cook but very tasty. I had the Mahi Mahi dish. It was cooked perfect. The salad & smashed potatoes that came with it was bland. The ambiance is elegant & the service was excellent.

Good sandwiches and fries, BUT microscopic sushi rolls and absurdly horrible service.

Came here on a Saturday at 2PM to grab a quick late lunch. The restaurant was mostly empty with at least half the tables empty.  Two parties in front of us and the hostess took about 10 minutes to seat us.  She did not give us a food menu.  She was wearing thigh high boots which looked hard to walk in and a spaghetti strap low-cut tank top, which is consistent with another Yelp review that also pointed out another unprofessional outfit worn by the hostess.

Our server was friendly enough, but very slow.  He never refilled my water and never came back to check on us after our food came.  A different server brought our food.  The food took 20-30 minutes to arrive.

I asked to speak to the manager and he apologized and offered us free dessert.  We declined as we were already in a rush and he gave us a coupon for $10 off or a free entree.  Took some more time for us to get the bill (i.e. the service did not improve after my complaint) and the server told us we couldn't even use the coupon! 

Skip:
- Sushi rolls here are anorexic.  Tempura shrimp roll literally has one shrimp in it and is the smallest sushi roll I have ever seen.  Priced at $10, this is a rip off.

Recommend:
- Lamb piadini sandwich. This was a 5-star sandwich with thinly sliced lamb on flatbread and comes with .
Place looks great so we decided to try it. The food was disappointing. The service was ok. I don't think I will be back here again.

Horrible horrible horrible its our first time here and the server is like rushing us and he said we need to to get pur order in at 10:00 and I was like I cant decide coz the menu looks fade away, I cant even read the ingredients esp on the sushi side. While I was looking at the menu trying to decide what to get he was just standing there like the fuck I need space smh.. Then its 10:02 he came and ask us again but thought the order needed to be at 10 smh so we just left.

There are plenty of good restaurants at Downtown Summerlin, but we love to support the annual Restaurant Week, so we decided to stop in here on a recent weekday. The food was fine, and the price was right--especially considering that some of our $20 lunch was going to a good cause!

My husband had the avocado rolls and the Crave burger. Not much to say about the rolls, but the burger was pretty good. I had the edamame and bento box, and I think I got the better bargain. The edamame was delicious--among the best I've ever had--served warm with a tasty Sriracha soy glaze. The bento box was chock-full of delights, from fruit and salad to fried shrimp and four different types of rolls (tuna, salmon, yellowtail, and cucumber). We both had the mini blueberry cheesecake for dessert, which was served parfait-style. As I said, the food was fine, but nothing (except for that awesome edamame) was compelling enough to bring me back.

Service was good, although they brought out our entrees before we had finished our appetizers. While waiting for our food, I read their happy hour menu, and that looks like a promising deal. Much of the menu reads like the Yard House happy hour, which is one of my favorites, so if I lived nearby, I think I would stop in occasionally for that. But otherwise, I think I will try one of the other Downtown Summerlin restaurants next time I am in the area.

Hello and welcome to Crave. We were greeted and seated promptly, hostess was very friendly. We were early for our reservation but they were able to work with us and provide us a seat. We came the day before Valentines day for a Prix Fix dinner for two. Price was 89.00 before taxes and drinks. Our waiter Jake came right away and gave us water and requested a drink order. We had not seen beverage list and asked him to return. He came back soon after took drink order.( was very impressed with his service considering how busy he was). I want very hard to describe Crave. Its not upscale, or bistro. Has a bar in front open restaurant with open kitchen. It was loud and hard to talk over the din at times. They were quite busy and despite that they did have great service. The Prix Fix Menu had choice 4 items for starter and 4 items for entree and the desert was a duo that came together. Starters were for us Bronzed Scallops and Coffee and Pepper Crusted Petite Tender in Chocolate Port Sauce. The Scallops were perfectly cooked however had a fishy smell that I am not used to with Scallops. They did taste good and were rightly cooked. The Petite Tenders were cooked mid rare and the Chocolate Port sauce was very interesting. When added with the Coffee pepper rub on the meat it gave it a sweet mocha taste. Not bad just different.
Entree....Salmon and shrimp Duo and New York strip. Jake did not ask how I wanted my steak cooked. When I told him Mid Rare he stated "is there any other way". So be warned if you want a more cooked piece of meat (and why would you) you must ask. Mid rare is their way. (Yay). Steak was actually bigger than I expected for a Prix Fix dinner. Had great flavor, the red wine reduction was quite nice also. Garlic mashed and Asparagus. Asparagus was nicely cooked on the grill and properly flavored. Josie had The Salmon and Shrimp. Both cooked perfectly. The shrimp had a crispy skin that added perfectly to each bite. There was a carrot Ginger puree' under the Salmon. The flavor of the puree' is hard to describe. Almost like a pumpkin spice but not as bitter. I kept wanting to eat off of Josie's plate. 
Dessert....Duo of Chocolate cake and a Passion Fruit Creme Brulee. The cake was okay, the Brule was grainy and flavor was more Lemon than passion fruit. 
All in all it was a good meal and experience. Service was excellent and food was quite filling. Again very impressed with the portion size for Prix Fix meal. We will return again. If you are shopping or going to a movie in Downtown Summerlin it's a good eating spot.

I seriously created an account just to rate this bad restaurant. The service was horrible. Empty drinks for 20 minutes, no silverware, every time we asked a question to our waitress (not sure her name but she was a bigger black lady) she said "hold on let me check" and one question was about the price on the drinks since there are no prices listed. Ridiculous! Very bad first impression and I will not be going there again. I was so mad I really just started to ignore the waitress because she was quite useless.

I tried this place for the first time for a work meeting and I really enjoyed it. The service was pretty much excellent, except toward the end, it slowed down a bit. They have a well rounded menu with lots of appetizer and small plates options. I ordered the beef sliders and a california roll. I was in an appetizer mood. They were both very good. One thing about the sliders was that it had a "juniper mayo" on them. Every now and then I would really taste the juniper and it would kind of throw me off. Just note that you should read the description before ordering because most of the items have an ingredient that sets it apart from it's similar entrees at other restaurants. 

I would definitely like to try this place again. They especially have good happy hour which is worth trying.

Pretentious restaurant serving mediocre food. The burger was good, but nothing spectacular.  Charging for a bread bowl of focaccia, pita, and a small shot glass of olive oil.    Friend had the Mac and cheese.   Was bland and needed spice.   Other friend ordered bison burger.  Was told 5 minutes later they were out of it. At 2 pm?????  You've only been open 3 hours and already out if your signature???   Poor planning.   Restaurant was noisy.

Fried ordered desserts to go.  Desserts took over 15 minutes to come out.   Slice of chocolate cake and a slice of cheesecake.

The ambiance was nice, the service was excellent, but the food I'm sad to say was disappointing. My girlfriend and I ordered the lettuce wraps which were the best of everything although the meat was tough and surprisingly hard to chew. We ordered a burger which was lacking flavor on every level, she ordered scallops she wasn't impressed with, and then we shared S'more brownies which I was most excited about, but the brownie was dry and crumbly, the graham crackers made the dryness worse, and the ice cream flavor didn't help matters. If the place wasn't as pricey as it is, it would be easy to say we got what we paid for. But it's been a while since I've been to a place where each dish that came out was more disappointing than the last. Definitely a bummer.

A lot of mixed reviews , but me and my husband loved it! First time here , got a coupon 1 entree 2 one free. And it was worth it! Everything was excellent , seated very nicly, waiter was super friendly! Should get a raise ! Very patient , explained everything so clearly, the best way to use the coupon . And which is the best meal of all to the least hahah , very truthful! Had the scallops and husband had steak (forgot the name but was $31)by our waiter recommend and it was amazing !!!! Loved it ! Steak was juicy and soft , scallops with nice flavors. And the waiter was awesome and nice ! Very cool place !  Overall excellent place! :)
