We came here on a Monday evening. It was a while before we got noticed, greeted,and seated. The restaurant was nearly empty but we still needed to wait for a specific table in a specific section to be cleaned. (the logistics) hostess never smiled at all...
Pros:
1- restaurant is absolutely gorgeous
2- steak was very tender. Portions are sufficient 
3- waitress was very nice and courteous
4- large selection and menu variety

Cons:
1- the long time it took to get noticed and greeted
2- there were discrepancies in pricing between the menu posted outside and the menu delivered to the tables
3- unfriendly hostess

You guys have so much potential to be the best restaurant in your area. I think the points you missed are stupid and fixable. We like you and we will try to come once more before making up our mind.

The food was terrible. The waiter was nice. Restaurant was empty at 6:00 on a Saturday. Don't attempt to go here if you go gluten free! Can't say I feel good 24 hours after.  I had the lamb meatballs and rice noodles. All of it was completely over cooked and I am pretty sure it was put in a microwave. The rice noodles they replace the pasta with were soggy and I could only get two inch pieces at most on my fork, because they were so overcooked. It was in a green sauce. Not sure you could say it was cream sauce as most of it was soaked up by the noodles and it was green? Can't understand the choice of rice noodles as there so many other options of pasta that taste amazing as GF. The meatballs were completely dry and tasteless and the tomato garnish was as dry as a potato chip. Maybe an attempt at their own sun dried tomato? Not feeling this restaurant. Kids and husband had pizza flatbread that they said was Ok. My six year old had chicken fingers that could have come from a cheap diner and wouldn't eat the fries. Ice cream sandwiches down the street saved the night. Don't bother going here. So many better options a walk away in Downtown Summerlin. Can't say I didn't warn you!

Ugh. This review is long overdue. I purchased a Livingsocial voucher for Crave. The deal was $58 for a three course dinner for two that included an appetizer, entree, and a dessert from a select menu. My husband and I came to Crave to celebrate our 10-year anniversary together. 

CRAVE STARTER SALAD ($7.95): The ingredients sounded exciting but the salad tasted pretty average. Nothing special here. 3/5
POBLANO CAESAR SALAD ($7.95): The polenta croutons were an interesting touch and the mister approved of the salad. 3.5/5

GRILLED MAHI MAHI ($26.95): He thought it was alright but complained that the shrimp was really rubbery. 3/5
LOBSTER LINGUINE ($28.95): Got it without the lobster, of course. The truffled butter sauce was extremely rich and got old real quick. After the third bite I was not feeling this entree at all. 2/5

COCONUT CAKE ($7.95): The cake looks beautiful but tastes like a store bought cake. I was really disappointed. 2/5

VIBE: Crave is a nicer restaurant with a fancy bar and a proper staff. The bathrooms are gorgeous. On a Tuesday evening, the place was nearly empty. I found it interesting that upon getting seated, our server handed us warm moist towels to clean our hands. That's a first. 4/5 

SERVICE: Started off with a bang but faded off into obscurity. Our waiter disappeared and it took a while to get refills and get the check. 2.5/5

Worth a Return Visit?
After all was said and done, me and my husband agreed that even with the Livingsocial deal, our meal wasn't worth what we paid for. Nah, we won't come back. The highlight of the meal for me was the salad. Nuff said.

YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2015: #136

Yummy! We have been in twice now. The staff is friendly, the food is good, the prices are reasonable, happy hour is good too. Their wine selection by the glass is certainly lacking but that's ok! Nice place overall we will be back

I really can't say this place deserves one star.  We are visiting our son and he was taking us out to eat and chose this place.  I suppose the food was good but finally after over an hour we still didn't have any food even though our server said it would just be a few minutes about four times, even saying they would take 20% off our check, which really equates to a tip they wouldn't have received and didn't deserve anyway. They seem to cater to the bar group.  There really weren't that many people in the place.
The menu is way too extensive to begin with.
By the way if this place makes another year I'll be very surprised.

Great addition to the neighborhood. Good service. Interiors are a dressed up yard house vibe. Mahi mahi and the chicken were fantastic. Bision burger and the sirloin sliders are some of the best around.

Lovely outdoor seating.... But their wasn't any available servers to seat us for the outdoors...area... We agreed to a window seat inside and waited at least 20 minutes for any acknowledgment...very poor service...flatbread pizza was average...chicken tender were above average...lemon garlic wings were Delish...would probably not dine  here again.

I went to a wine dinner last night with 4 others.  The food and wine were excellent but the service was outstanding.  Our servers were fabulous.  Attentive and responsive.  Our whole table was impressed with the service.  We look forward to attending the next wine dinner.

Not so impressed.  The place has an identity problem.  Burgers to tacos to sushi to pasta, and you're not really good at any of them.  That's the problem.  Waited 25 minutes for our food.  Wife ordered pulled beef tacos and I got the chicken caprese pasta.  Pasta was over cooked so a little mush (angel hair).  Hair tacos were nothing special.  The flour tortilla was dry and a little hard.  Our tempura appetizer was mushy and, again, not great.

Good place to get a drink maybe, but not so much for dinner.

Been here many, many times. Love the happy hour. We came here for lunch and ordered off the regular menu recently. Most from my party had burgers. They enjoyed them and said they were juicy and full of flavor. I had sushi, which was great as always. Our waitress made us some sort of lemonade concoction she recommend...turned out to be delicious AND bottomless! 

The only thing I noticed was the hostess (seemed to be new) disappeared from her booth. We could see the main entrance from where we were seated. We noticed a family with two small girls waiting around to be seated for almost 15 minutes. The bartender eventually saw them and apologized. That's the only down-side I saw. Even when it gets slow, make sure your hostess is where she's supposed to be. 

Otherwise, great food and service at our table! Will be back.

Sunday, May 8, 2016. The online advertised Mothers Day Brunch buffet was NOT what we received upon arrival today. This was a special day resulting in let down and disappointment to say the very least. Shame on Craves management team for enticing return/repeat customers such as ourselves via online advertising to "book reservation for Mother's Day brunch" using LAST YEARS 2015 Mother's Day brunch PHOTOS of their previous brunch buffet layout. The only reason we returned for this years Mother's Day is because of said brunch buffet. Ultimately, their management team should refrain from using BAIT and SWITCH shameless tactics. Word of mouth is what brings business in, not lies. There are many wonderful Restaraunt options in Las Vegas to choose from. Why would anyone choose this establishment for special occasions, when they participate in unsavory deceptive advertising?

From the service, to the food, everything was fantastic!

We started off with the crab cakes for an appetizer along with the Godzilla roll. Crab cakes were fantastic! Sushi roll was 20$ but a fairly larger portion.

 I got the mahi mahi. It was to die for! A burst of flavor! It had hints of pecan and cinnamon on a bed of shrimp rice. My friend got the apple sandwich that came on pita. Very good, great for a tasty lunch. 

We finished off with The tiramisu shooter, and the chocolate cake. 

Everything was excellent! We will definitely be back next time we spend our day in dt summerlin!

Went to this restaurant this past weekend. WOW. What an amazing place this is. We walked in and was greeted by a wonderful hostess, she was friendly and polite.The decor here is very beautiful.  We were seated as a party of 6. Got menus and waters right away. They have a variety of things to choose from to eat. We ordered all sorts of stuff and we were able to share and try everything out... FOOD was BOMB.... Service was BOMB also. When Im back in Las Vegas I will sure to be back. The one thing that I noticed was we sat at a booth and if you want a more romantic and intimate setting they have a curtain which I assume you can close so you can have your privacy,,, Very cute for couples...

I got to the point where I only want to write 4-5 star reviews on Yelp. I want to help businesses not hurt them!


Back to my point, my initial thoughts were: What?! Only 3 stars?! What's wrong with everyone!  

First of all the service has been on point everything I've gone in (6 times). Not only has the service been quick, the servers are very kind, considerate, and resourceful! 

Their food is magnificent! I have had their pasta, sushi, burgers, chicken wings, salmon, flat bread, steak, and mahi mahi. However, my favorite dish is the parmesan chicken pasta!

Once again, only 3 stars?! I just don't see it!

I'm not impressed with this place. The food is way overpriced and the flavor & taste is mediocre. Service was slow & lack of attention to detail. We had to ask our server for more water. They brought the dessert out way before we were done with our meal.

My cup of fish chowder was weird. There were little bits of stuff that seemed like chopped bits of meat, no idea what kind of fish. It was a flop. My Margherita flatbread was excellent. My wife's beef Stroganoff was ok. I was put off by the high wine prices and the lack of prices for beer and mixed drinks.

The sushi was very good, but entirely over priced.  I.e. Scallop poppers were $10 for three little poppers. The Godzilla roll was $19 for an average sized roll.  Like I said, it was tasty, but a $73 bill for two rolls , app, 2 beers, and glass of wine...........could have just gone to a local sushi joint and saved about $25-$30

Amazing service and excellent quality food.  The menu variety is also a huge plus.  Our server was very friendly and made great recommendations.  The management is very customer focused and the entire experience from host to check was superior in every way.  A truly premium experience with an incredibly warm and friendly approach.  I would highly recommend you skip the chain brands nearby and give Crave a chance.  You won't regret this experience!

Awful food. We had a party of seven and no one liked what they ordered. The spicy sushi rolls were bland. The beet garnish on the kale and beet salad had a black spot through every slice and the dressing was much too sweet. The pizza was served on a tortilla. The grilled cheese sandwich was without cheese. I do not recommend this restaurant and will not return.

I tried this restaurant for lunch today. This is a lively, high-energy spot with a diverse menu. My waitress was very nice and attentive. I tried the Bison burger and fries; both were tasty!  I really liked the fact that they offer mini desserts (nice when you just want a little something sweet).  Enjoy!!!

My husband and I went to crave for the first time on a Friday night date. The restaurant was full at 6:30 but we had made a reservation so we got right in.  I decided to go to the sushi bar.  I should have known when not one person was at the sushi bar that something was up.  We ordered tuna and a spicy roll of some sort and  It just wasn't fresh or very tasty.  We were so disappointed.  Giving it one more chance, we ordered one order of salmon and another type of tuna sushi and both were just OK.  

On another note, the service was great from the server that brought our wine.  I will return to the restaurant for their regular menu as it does interest me but I will not return for sushi.  

Oh, one more thing, there was no soy sauce at the bar.  After asking for some low sodium, the server came and poured a way too generous amount in our dishes.  He sould know to let the customer do that, as we like to get a certain amount in the dish to get the consistency right with their wasabi.

First the Pros...really the only Pros are the staff, who is warm, friendly and attentive... and the view of the water if you sit on the patio. 

So,  as mentioned previously, we asked to sit on the patio.  The problem here is that they have cranked up their own music outside, which conflicts with the music played by the mall.  It's unpleasant, to say the least. It makes it hard to think, let alone chat.

I ordered the chicken with lemon and garlic sauce for $22.95.  Sadly, it tasted neither like lemon, nor garlic.  It was really bland.  It tasted most like plain grilled chicken sans salt and pepper.  My husband ordered the chicken stir-fry, which was also bland.  It lacked seasoning and the vegetables were over cooked. This was not anything either of us would come back for, let alone "Crave". 

We hope they improve the taste of their food so they can live up to their name.

I was amazed as soon as I walked in! The hostesses were very welcoming and enthusiastic. The waiter had so many great recommendations for their sushi and sandwiches. The food arrived in a timely fashion, the prices maybe a little high for some but it's well worth it.
OK, this review is on the mac and cheese only, because that's all I ate. Yep, big enough for the main course. I had it with the apple sausage mixed. Loved it.

After seeing a lot of the negative reviews my friend and I decided anyways to check it out since the menu seemed pretty tasty. Upon finishing our lunch here I'd have to say I don't know what people are talking about in terms of bad service. My water was constantly refilled and my server was super nice and checked back multiple times during our meal to see if we were doing ok. Great feel to the place. Would definitely come back again. I had the Bison burger which was amazing and also the sliders to start. Also amazing. The only thing I didn't like was the butterscotch pudding for dessert slough it was risky probably to order it anyway but the texture was a little strange and it was too much. But that might just be the butterscotch flavoring. I dunno but other than that great experience. Will come again for sure one day.

Had a great experience today at their Mother's Day brunch. Service and food was great, all staff was welcoming, and they even went the extra mile and gave roses out to all the moms. Nice touch! First time at Crave, but will not be the last. Will definitely be back again soon.

Totally Average the waiter was really slow and our waters weren't getting filled up. The waiter said that the water person was all over the place. I order a salad and I found a hair. No one even came to a apologize not even a manager no one. If you are reading this that works here please get your act together. Everything was really ok. The only thing that was the best was the blueberry cheesecake. I would totally suggest that. I would totally not come back only for the desert.

We were so impressed with this restaurant! I've been wanting to come here for awhile since it has sushi and American food as well. My husband got a small roll and said it was fresh. He got the bison burger and I got turkey burger. They both were made fresh and tasted great! Our waiter was Vincent and he was excellent. We will be coming back!

Yikes! So let me start out by saying that I was extremely excited to try this place out and ended up a tad bit disappointed.. Or maybe that's an understatement.. I was beyond disappointed. I made a reservation through opentable.com for a party of two. Upon arriving I was greeted by a very polite hostess who asked where I would like to dine (inside or outside). I of course wanted to dine outside because the weather was perfect. So here's where the train started to wreck. We waited for our server for approximately 15 minutes. 1 person came up to tell us that she would be right with us and then she didn't come over as soon as we expected. Now don't get me wrong she was a very nice and polite server but that doesn't cut it when it comes to moving quickly and efficiently. The excuse that they may or may have not been busy can be forgotten. In this case they weren't! So for my appetizer I ordered the CRAVE stack sushi roll and my partner ordered the Crunchy Roll. The sushi was just OK..Dragon Fruit martini was good! For dinner I went with the 702 Burger that was recommended by our server which I wasn't impressed at all. Took OVER 20 minutes for two burgers to come out? Really?? And then to comer out not even the right way? When it came out the bacon was BURNT..like burnt to capacity! I showed my server and even she agreed that was unacceptable and that she'd have some more bacon sent out to me. Fries were cold on both of our plates had to have more fries sent out. The problem is that it took about 15 mins for that and I literally was damn near done with the burger by then. My partner had the CRAVE burger and he to was not impressed with the burger so I'm really not sure if we just caught them on a bad night (if they are allowed to have those) but yeah the jury is still out on whether or not I will be returning or not. Management hopefully reads these reviews because clearly the general consensus is that they need to get it together.. I can now see why they are rated an average 3 star! I really wanted to like this place especially because it's so close to my house..

Betty, one of the managers greeted us at our table after our party had waited a while for a server to come. We waited for around 10+ min to order drinks. Betty made it right by giving us excellent service for the rest of the evening.

I ordered the Mac & Cheese, something simple, and it was fantastic. Betty also brought an order of Lemon Garlic Wings to the table for us, and they were so good. It was such a nice flavor, I will most likely come back again for the wings.

Terrible service, very rude. I felt like they didn't  care if we will come back or not.  So guess what me and my husband are boycotting Crave.  We will tell all of our friends not to eat there as well.  Good luck surviving next door to Wolfgang puck!!!!

Not what I would expect for the prices, but not awful either. Sunday afternoon, not busy. We started with one server and then another showed up and relieved the first. Had to tell the second what our drink order was. Thought she could've asked the first server. Kale salad was pretty good. Bistro grilled steak had garlic butter over it which I thought was different. It was ok. The steak was cooked right but I felt like I spent a lot of time chewing, more than normal! I left two medallions as I just couldn't chew anymore. Pureed potatoes were fine, nothing special. The grilled, burnt brussel sprouts were not the best, though I ate half for the nutritional value. The candied carrot drink was different and ok. Again, ordered that for the carrot juice nutrient.
The server came to the table a few too many times and always when I was chewing. Give it a rest after your first check on the food stop by. Just keep an eye on drinks. I may go back once more for another item. Husband enjoyed his sushi.
